The attack came shortly after Rahman got bail in a case filed over demeaning Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujibur Rahman and Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Bangladesh (2009-) Detective Branch
NOTES: On August 5, a large number of police from the Detective Branch arrested a photographer and human rights activist from his residence in Dhanmondi town (Dhaka city) and allegedly assaulted him in custody.
On Aug 28, a female journalist was hacked to death by unidentified armed men at Radhanagar Majumdarparha in the Pabna town.
On Sept 27, unidentified armed men attacked an acting editor of a local daily in Rajshahi city for uncovering illegal gambling activities.
On Sept 29, a journalist was seriously injured when a gang of criminals assaulted him in Kalarong area in Taltali upazila for his reporting on crime in the region.
On Oct 13, unidentified armed men attacked a journalist in Pabna town leaving him injured. Reason for attack is unknown, assumed political or due to the reporters reportage.
On Nov 2, a Jubo League leader and his men assaulted a journalist and vandalised his property over a land dispute in Barunagaon Masterpara Village of Sadar Upazila in Thakurgaon.

Assumed on 20 Dec, supporters of Jatiya Party candidate Dr Rustam Ali Farazi attacked Independent Television district reporter Tamim Sarder, while he was performing his duties at an election campaign, in Mirukhali Bus Station area (Mathbaria, Pirojpur). The victim was critically injured.

On 24 Dec, a mob of 30-35 men attacked a group of 40 journalists staying at a hotel in Nawabganj (assumed town). The attackers were armed with iron rods, hockey sticks, and sharp weapons. Several journalists were injured and 16 media vehicles vandalised.

On Dec 28, a group of unidentified men, numbering 6-7, beat a journalist of television channel ATN Bangla with iron rod and hockey sticks while he was standing in front of his residence in Nabharan area, Sharsha (Jessore, Khulna) leaving him severely injured.
On Dec 29, local correspondent of the Daily Noya Diganta was attacked by unidentified men in Sharupdaha area (Jessore, Khulna).
On 8 Jan, a journalist of Wazirpur Upazila (Barishal) was beaten by a local Awami League leader near the upazila office. No reason was stated in the report.

On Jan 12, in Barisal city, five policemen assaulted a journalist in Barisal city when he was capturing photos of a scuffle between policemen and a rickshaw driver carrying wheat bags with government logo.
On Feb 2, a journalist, who published a report against a local BCL leader, was beaten up by the BCL leader in Barguna (Barisal).
On Mar 17, former chief reporter of Bangla online was attacked and killed by unidentified assailants in Pallabi, Dhaka city. His body was found in his apartment.
On May 21, a journalist was found dead near Jamalpur-Mymensingh rail track (Mymensingh). Police said that the journalist was strangled to death by unidentified assailants.

On June 10, at least ten people including a local journalist were injured in an attack by a local Jubo League leader and his cohorts at Alipur (Kalapara, Patuakhali) allegedly over publishing of a news regarding a scandal involving the mayor. The activists and leader used sharp weapons during the attack.
On Aug 3, a journalist of private TV channel was abducted by unidentified assailants in Gulshan, Dhaka city. He was released after four days having torture marks on his body.
On Oct 5, a sub-inspector and constable of police force beat two journalists in Azimpur area (Dhaka city) after the journalists denied to get in police vehicle.
On Nov 16, a journalist belonging to Bangla Tribune was killed by unidentified assailants in Dhaka city. The reason of killing is yet under investigation.

On Dec 18, activists of BCL beat and broke the legs of a local journalist in Dewanpara area (Sadar upazila, Jamalpur). The journalist was a witness in a case filed against assault on a journalist in 2018.
On Dec 21, office secretary of Narsigndi Press Club was stabbed and injured by unidentified assailants near Rahimabad village (Raipura, Narsingdi). The reason of attack is yet to be known.

On 27 March 2020, two photo journalists were assaulted by policemen at Barisal university area in Barisal city (Barisal) for taking photos of a government campaign to prevent coronavirus transmission.

On 7 April 2020, two journalists were severely beaten and injured by policemen in Rupnagar locality of Dhaka city (Dhaka) when they were returning after donating blood. Allegedly, they were beaten for being out during the coronavirus lockdown.
On 16 April 2020, a journalist was allegedly beaten by police personnel in Dhaka city for being out on roads amid coronavirus lockdown restrictions.
On 21 April 2020, a journalist was injured in an attack by policemen at Duramari area near Thakurgaon Municipality area (Thakurgaon, Rangpur). The reason of attack is yet to be known.
On 11 May 2020, accomplices of a local union council member assaulted and injured a journalist in Rajshahi district (Rajshahi) allegedly for writing a report about an unauthorized market.

On 29 July 2020, unidentified assailants attacked and injured a journalist and his family in Lalmonirhat town (Lalmonirhat, Rangpur). The journalist received critical injuries in the incident. The reason of attack is yet unknown.

On 6 August 2020, unidentified assailants stabbed and severely injured a journalist in front of Mohanpur Press Club in Mohanpur town (Rajshahi) allegedly for writing a report about an unauthorized market. He was also attacked in May for the same reason.
On 3 September 2020, unidentified assailants stabbed and killed a local journalist at Barabaria village (Dhamrai, Dhaka) over a previous enmity.
On 28 September 2020, unidentified assailants stabbed and injured a journalist at Navaran Satkhira area (Sharsha, Jessore) allegedly over a previous enmity.
On 11 October 2020, unidentified assailants killed a local journalist in Adampur area (Bandar, Narayanganj). The reason of incident is yet under investigation.

On 1 November 2020, a group of at least five assailants assaulted a journalist and left him unconscious near Kumira Bazar in Sitakunda Upazila (Chittagong), for allegedly reporting against gambling operations in the locality among others. He was abducted by the assailants on October 28.

SOURCE: Independent (Bangladesh); New Nation (Bangladesh); United News of Bangladesh; Dhaka Tribune; New Age (Bangladesh)
NOTES: On 5 April 2021, a group of Hefazat-e-Islam supporters assaulted a journalist and vandalized his house at Sonargaon (Narayanganj), for allegedly insulting the organization's joint general secretary.

On 5 April 2021, a journalist was beaten by police, allegedly following an order of the upazila nirbahi officer (UNO), at Kalapara (Patuakhali, Barisal), after an altercation over a punishment of two locals for violating coronavirus lockdown protocols.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Bangladesh (2009-) Border Guards Bangladesh
NOTES: On 15 April 2021, BGB personnel allegedly assaulted a journalist in Lalmonirhat (Lalmonirhat Sadar) accusing him of possessing illegal drugs in a case filed with Sadar Police Station in the city.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Bangladesh); Former BSU: Bangladesh Students' Union; Students (Bangladesh)
NOTES: On 22 April 2021, unidentified assailants abducted and assaulted a journalist and a former leader of the Bangladesh Students' Union at Aminbazar in Dhaka city (Dhaka), over unknown reasons. He was rescued the following day.

SOURCE: Dhaka Tribune; New Age (Bangladesh); New Nation (Bangladesh)
NOTES: On 28 April 2021, a cameraperson of a private TV channel was allegedly tortured in police custody at Kumarkhali police station (Kushtia), following his arrest from a clash between Awami League members in the locality.

On 16 August 2021, a former BCL leader along with his 7-8 associates stabbed at and injured a journalist with sharp weapons in Chuadanga town (Chuadanga Sadar), following an argument over unknown reasons.

SOURCE: Armenpress; Sputnik Azerbaijan; APA; Panorama Am
NOTES: On 19 April, in Yerevan, a plain-clothed man attacked a journalist Tirayr Muradyan, covering a protest. The journalist was hospitalized with grave injuries.

On 21 April, in Artashat, during a protest to support acting prime-minister of Armenia, a plain-clothed man attacked a journalist, covering a protest, punching her in the face and attempting to grab the camera.

On 25 March 2021, in La Paz city, a journalist was shot and injured by unidentified armed assailants in the 16th street of Achumani in the south of the city. The victim was taken to Metodista hospital. The reason behind the attack is being investigated.

On February 2, 2018 in Sarajevo settlement of Otoka in Bosnia and Herzegovina, journalist Nedzad Latic was assaulted by an alleged member of the Wahhabi movement in Bosnia and Herzegovina, as claimed by Latic.

On August 20, 2018 in Konjic, Bosnia and Herzegovina a group of masked individuals attacked the journalists of public broadcaster BHRT who were in their van, injuring the driver and causing material damage on the van.

On August 26, 2018 in Banja Luka, Bosnia and Herzegovina journalist of a regional television station BNTV Vladimir Kovacevic was beaten with metal rods by unknown perpetrators, after which he was hospitalized. Kovacevic was assaulted after having sent his report from civil protests organized by group 'Justice for David' who are protesting unresolved death of youngster David Dragicevic.
On March 28, in Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina, a member of a municipal council of the SDA political party physically assaulted a journalist who was doing field work.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Bosnia and Herzegovina); Women (Bosnia and Herzegovina)
NOTES: On June 5, a female journalist who was reporting about an explosion in Mostar, Bosnia and Herzegovina, was physically assaulted by two unidentified men, who deleted the photos off her camera.
On 16 January 2018, in Cacoal, Rondonia, a journalist, owner of Jornal Rondonia and alternate Councilman of Cacoal, was executed in a drive-by shooting by an armed man on a motorcycle.
On 17 January 2018, in Edealina, Goias, a radio journalist was killed by a Councilman (PR).

On 14 February 2018, in Sonora, Mato Grosso do Sul, a journalist was attacked and injured on Marcelo Miranda Soares Avenue by the brother of a person who had been featured on the journalist's news outlet. The suspect was arrested.
On 15 February 2018, in Curitiba, Parana, a man threw a bomb at the doors of Mundo Livre 98 FM radio station injuring an employee. The motive is unknown. The suspect was arrested.
On 20 February 2018, in Curitiba, Parana, a man threw a bomb in the doors of Mundo Livre 98 FM radio station for the second time that month. The motive is unknown. The suspect was arrested.

On 20 April 2018, between Jaru and Ouro Preto do Oeste municipalities, Rondonia, a man was injured in a drive-by shooting on the BR-364 highway. The victim was a known radio presenter with controversial opinions. Motivation and authorship are unknown.

On 21 June 2018, in Braganca, Para, a journalist was killed in a drive-by shooting by two armed people on a motorcycle in front of the Perola Radio building. 11 people were charged for the crime, including a City Councillor.

On 8 August 2018, in Curitiba, Parana, two journalists and the son of a radio station owner were attacked in front of the radio station building in Pilarzinho neighbourhood. A man opened fire against them, shooting the car of one of the journalists. No one was injured. Motivation and authorship are unknown.

On March 21, 2019, in Santa Cruz do Capibaribe, Pernambuco, a broadcaster was shot to death by an armed man after leaving work. There is no information on the identity of the perpetrator or crime motivation. 1 fatality.

On 1 Apr 2019, in Araguaina, Tocantins, a reporter was shot and injured by mistake by armed individuals. According to the Military Police, a young man who was being chased by armed individuals ran towards a neighbouring house of the reporter. The man was shot dead and the reporter was hit.

On 25 May 2019, in Marica, Rio de Janeiro, a journalist, owner of the newspaper O Marica, was shot and killed by suspects in a gray car, as he arrived at his house in Boqueirao neighborhood. The victim was also a pre-candidate (Avante political party) for the 2020 Mayor elections. 1 fatality.

On 18 June 2019, in Marica, Rio de Janeiro, two suspects approached a journalist from the website Lei Seca Marica, about to get in his car after exercising, in Aracatiba neighborhood. One suspect shot him twice to the left side of the head and once to the neck. 1 fatality.

On 21 Jun 2019, in Braganca, Para, a radio journalist was shot dead when arriving at work. The Office of the Public Prosecutor considered 11 people responsible for the murder, including a councilman (PR). The crime was motivated by dissatisfaction of a political group with the declarations by the journalist.

On 13 May 2020, in Araruama, Rio de Janeiro, a journalist and pre-candidate running for the City Council (Patriota party) was shot dead. He was known in the city for being a community leader and taking part in social projects. He was conducting interviews on the street when he was approached by men on a car who shot at him and fled.

Around 25 September 2020 (as reported), in Japeri, Rio de Janeiro, a reporter and a camera worker were attacked when filming a news report in a health center in Mucaja neighborhood. A man tried to prevent them from filming, used racial slurs and slapped the journalist.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
NOTES: On 6 October 2020, in Manaus, Amazonas, a female journalist was beaten up by military police officers while she was sitting in a square bench at the city center. The officers thought she was filming them, seized her phone, and then beat her. When they noticed they were being filmed by other people in the square, they returned her phone and walked away.

On 26 October 2020, in Boa Vista, Roraima, a journalist was abducted from his home in the Aeroporto neighborhood by three armed individuals. He was tortured, tied up, and had his legs broken. He was found in the Bom Intento region the following day. Police authorities believe he may have been abducted by drug trafficking gang members.

On 27 October 2020, in Joao Pessoa, Paraiba, a man was killed by at least two armed individuals who invaded his home in the Mangabeira neighborhood. The victim ran a social media page of police news and had been receiving death threats. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators.

On 29 October 2020, in Prata, Minas Gerais, a press crew was attacked. A reporter was conducting interviews at a health unit about the upcoming municipal elections when a doctor tried to take away his microphone and cell phone. A second man grabbed the reporter and choked him. The attack was recorded, the aggressors were identified (they were both civil servants) and fired.

SOURCE: R7; G1; Folha de S. Paulo
NOTES: On 11 November 2020, in Sao Vicente, Sao Paulo, the car of a journalist and mayoral candidate (PSDB) was shot in a drive-by shooting by a suspect on a motorcycle. She was inside an armoured car and no one was injured. The candidate declared she was being followed and that the attack had political motivation. [women targeted: candidates for office]

On 15 November 2020, in Peixoto de Azevedo, Mato Grosso, a journalist was killed in a drive-by shooting by two armed individuals on a motorcycle. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators or crime motivation.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
NOTES: On 17 December 2020, in Salvador, Bahia, a journalist and community leader of the Barra neighborhood was beaten up by military police officers after he reported on a radio show a shoot-out between military police forces and suspected drug traffickers.

On 9 July 2021, in Moju, Para, a journalist was shot and injured by two armed individuals as he was getting home. The victim had been receiving death threats. There are no reports on the identity of the perpetrators.

On 17 August 2021, in Mage, Rio de Janeiro, a journalist who previously worked as the city's communications secretary had his car shot four times in a drive-by shooting by armed suspects on a motorcycle. He was not injured due to the fact that he was in an armoured car.

On 12 October 2021, in Aparecida, Sao Paulo, a reporter was assaulted and injured by a supporter of the President Jair Bolsonaro (no party) during the president's visit to the city. The victim had his face injured. The aggressor shouted that he would kill him if he could. Military police officers refused to arrest the perpetrator.

On 16 January 2018, a journalist that was taking pictures in the Belize side of the border with Guatemala reported that he was assaulted by Belize police officers that demanded him to go to the Guatemalan custom point.

On 13 May, an investigative journalist was abducted in the Montana region by two unknown persons after publishing a video of illegal activities by a water supply organization in Troyan. The journalist showed up at a police station in Montana the next day and said he was unharmed. The media that published the footage had earlier received anonymous threats to remove the video.

On 17 March 2020, the editor in chief of newspaper '168 Chasa' was beaten up with metal rods by three masked assailants in Sofia. Police suspects the attack was related to his investigative work on political and environmental corruption issues.
On 4 October 2014, in Kyaikmaraw township, Mon state, a journalist was killed while in the custody of the Myanmar army. 1 fatality.

On 21 Feb 2015, a convoy flying the flag of the Red Cross Society was attacked by unknown armed group near Chin Shwe Haw. Both the government army and Kokang rebels are denying responsibility. A journalist, an Red Cross official and three civilians were wounded.

SOURCE: Front Line Defenders; ProtectDefenders.eu; The Observatory for the Protection of Human Rights Defenders
NOTES: On December 13, 2016, in Monywa, Sagaing region, a journalist with the Eleven Media Group investigating illegal logging and timber smuggling was found dead by the side of Pyidaungsu Road near the Monywa golf course. He is believed to have been beaten to death.
On December 20, 2017, a local journalist was stabbed by an unidentified assailant in Sittwe, Rakhine state.

On 26 February 2019, in Waingmaw Township, in Kachin State, two journalists of the Myitkyina Journal were assaulted by the employees of a mining company as they reported the local residents' concerns over a controversial Chinese tissue-culture banana plantation. The employees of Tha Khin Sit Mining Import/Export company forced two reporters to go with them and then detained them separately and assaulted them.
On 3 September 2019, in Muse Town, in northern Shan State, a reporter of the state-run newspaper 'The Mirror' was shot by unknown gunmen near his home in Ho Moon Ward. He was injured.

On 31 December 2019, between Gwa and Kyeinstali (Gwa Township, Thandwe District, Rakhine State) (coded as Gwa), an unknown assailant shot the editor-in-chief of Myanmar Now while he was in his car. His family members, a colleague, and the colleague's wife and son were in the car where the attack happened. The editor-in-chief had a gunshot wound to the leg which required surgery.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2016-2021) Border Guard Force
SOURCE: Myanmar Times; Radio Free Asia; Karen Information Center News
NOTES: On 4 March 2020, in Myawaddy Town, in Myawaddy Township, in Kayin State, a journalist from Frontier Myanmar and a news photographer for the Myanmar Times were detained and beaten by the Myanmar military border guard force after the two took photos of the new casino project construction site in The Pon Seik which is under the control of the BGF. The two were released on March 5.
On 13 May 2020, in Sittwe Town, Sittwe Township, Sittwe District, Rakhine State, two unknown men on a motorcycle attacked an independent journalist. The journalist was injured.

On 28 February 2021, in Myitkyina city (Myitkyina township, Myitkyina District, Kachin state), security forces, reportedly a combined forces of the Myanmar military and police, detained and beat up a journalist.
Around 28 February 2021 (as reported), in Lay Myay village (Budalin Township, Magway District, Sagaing Region), a soldier from the Myanmar military beat up a CEO of a news agency.

On 1 March 2021, in Myeik town, Myeik township (Myeik District, Tanintharyi Region), at around 10:45 pm, the house of a journalist was raided by soldiers and armed police officers in 7-8 military vehicles. His house was reportedly pelted with stones, and gunshots were fired outside his house, as seen in a live video recorded by the journalist himself which had since gone viral. It was not clear if the gunshots were rubber bullets or live rounds. Doors and windows of the house were damaged, and the journalist was forcibly taken away and had since been detained. On 2 June, he was sentenced to 2 years in prison. On 18 October, the military regime released him along with hundreds of anti-coup protesters across the country.

SOURCE: Democratic Voice of Burma; Radio Free Asia
NOTES: On 3 March 2021, in Pyay town (Pyay Township, Pyay District, Bago Region), the security forces beat and arrested a DVB journalist. He faced a lawsuit but the family were unable to contact him, according to his lawyer. On 12 May, he was sentenced to three years in prison. On 18 October, the military regime released him along with hundreds of anti-coup protesters across the country.

On 19 March 2021, in Det Khi Na Thi Ri town, Det Khi Na Thi Ri township (Nay Pyi Taw region), ahead of a court hearing for a NLD patron, plainclothes men took away two journalists (a BBC correspondent, and a former correspondent for Mizzima) in front of the Dakhina District Court. It was not clear which party was responsible and their whereabouts.

On 20 April 2021, in Katha town (Katha Township, Katha District, Sagaing Region), police arrived at a scene while people (including teachers) were organizing things like tying flowers to prepare for a people-less protest against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement. The police opened either rubber bullets or live rounds and arrested a middle school teacher as well as a journalist from Shwe Myitmakha News Agency.

SOURCE: Network Media Group; Radio Free Asia; Democratic Voice of Burma
NOTES: On 12 November 2021, in Dawei town (Dawei township, Dawei district, Tanintharyi region), a military informant who worked as a crime reporter was shot nine times and killed by two unknown men on motorcycle while shopping at a tea shop in Sun Chi ward. The Guerilla Dawei later claimed responsibility for the act.

On 18 November 2021, in Thanbyuzayat township (Mawlamyine district, Mon State) the Myanmar military shot dead a journalist and his wife who were traveling near a security checkpoint in Thanbyuzayat township. The military force shot them because they refused to stop at security check point.
On 18 November 2021, in Na Bar village (Indaw township, Katha district, Sagaing region), the military arrested a freelance journalist. She was beaten during the arrest and her belongings were seized.
Three people, including a journalist of Vyizigiro radio, Mr Gabriel Ndabazaniye, were killed by a group of armed men in Taba District, Gihosha Zone, in the northwest part of the capital, Bujumbura.
Rebels carried out an attack on Mutanga-Nord in Gihosha zone northeast of the capital, Bujumbura, killing a journalist with Private Radio Bonesha FM and his son.
Radio Puplique Africaine journalist attacked by gunmen last night in central Ngozi Province.
A journalist attacked by police officer after witnessing act of corruption

On 14 December 2014, a taxi driver was attacked by men with machetes after he dropped off a journalist in Kanyosha. It was reportedly claimed that the men believed the journalist was still in the cab, and that the attack was motivated by the victim's profession.
Leading human rights activist was arrested and injured during a police raid on the headquarters of a media association. He was released the following day with minor injuries.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: On 27 April 2015, journalists were attacked by Imbonerakure in Kaynosha.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: Imbonerakure attack journalists of IWACU
Youths attacked several journalists, arguing they want only government media.
Radio Bonesha attacked by men in police uniforms
Journalists attacked by Police forces
Two journalists were reportedly assaulted ('roughed up') by police in Bubanza while attempting to interview relatives of recent abductees. Many more are reported to be receiving death threats.
Journalist Esdras Ndikumana was arrested at the scene of the assassination of a top general in Bujumbura and was badly beaten by government security agents.
Investigating on the murder of Nshimirimana, a journalist of RFI was jailed and beaten for two hours by Police Forces.
Jimmy Elvis Vyizigiro, a journalist working for France 24, was attacked in his home by masked intruders who beat him as they searched for documents he collected regarding flaws in recent elections.

Jean-Claude Ciza, a journalist who previously worked for a state broadcaster and now works with Radio France Internationale, was beaten with a steel bar by a police officer while covering events in the Musaga neighborhood of Bujumbura.

In retaliation for the earlier kidnapping of 3 police officers by 'insurgents', police began shooting at houses in Ngagara. They killed a local state broadcaster cameraman and then executed his wife, nephew, two teenage children, and a local guard in the main street, according to multiple witnesses. Police shot randomly at houses and intentionally executed 3 more during the operation

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) API Unit
NOTES: API unit attacked and injured a radio station correspondent in Muyinga.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
SOURCE: International Federation for Human Rights; HRW
NOTES: 10 December. Marie-Claudette Kwizera, a journalist with Ligue Iteka, was abducted in Bujumbura city near central polyclinic by police SNR forces. She was later killed by SNR.
Journalist beaten by policeman in Bubanza.
A cameraman was shot and killed in a confrontation with police.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
NOTES: Journalist abducted and beat by SNR between Nyakabiga and Rohero.

A journalist of 'Oximity News' went missing last week. He was arrested by unknown people when he was at home to be held in the SNR jail. (Because he has not been found in the SNR jail, he is considered to be abducted by unknown group.)

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
NOTES: On 16 July 2016, an IWACU journalist went missing in the Bugarama area of Muramvya province. Witnesses at the scene said that they saw him being arrested by agents of Burundi's national intelligence service. His whereabouts is unknown.

Journalist Jean Bigirimana from independent Iwacu newspaper reportedly arrested, but his family could not find him in the jail system and the police deny that he is in their custody. Family fears he may have been assassinated.

Journalist of Great Lakes Info was threatened and beaten up by a policeman in a bar after asking him why he was still in the country while his colleagues have fled the country. On Tuesday 26 July, this officer threatened him again (threatening getting a warrant to arrest him).
A young woman was assaulted by police officers who were attempting to arrest her over a payment dispute. A journalist who witnessed the scene was threatened with violence if he reported the incident.
A cameraman for the Radio Television Nationale de Burundi was beaten by police officers.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction); Journalists (Burundi)
NOTES: An influential Imbonerakure in Mubuga, working with the police, arrested and beat an FNL Rwasa supporter. He was accused of sending information to radio stations based in Rwanda.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: On 24 February 2018, an IWACU journalist-reporter was severely beaten by Imbonerakure in Giheta for allegedly spreading bad news about Giheta commune. They then stole his cellphones and money.

Three radio journalists were detained and severely beaten by the police in Ngagara area of Ntahangwa commune in Bujumbura Mairie on August 27, 2018 as they reported on a land dispute between the local community and the administration.

14 May 2019. An unidentified armed group attacked a former journalist with machetes in Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura Marie. The former journalist had previously faced judicial prosecution for covering the activities of armed actors in Burundi.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
NOTES: 30 October 2019. 4 SNR agents abducted a former RPA journalist from Gaturungu area of Bujumbura. After the abduction, the vehicle was in a car accident in Bujumbura and the journalist was let go. However, the journalist may have been abducted again.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: On 9 April 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a journalist from Radio Isanganiro and their driver in Rukuba (Kanyosha1, Bujumbura Rural). The journalist was going to cover persecution against CNL members.

On 27 April 2020, police attacked and injured a journalist in Mparambo 1 (Rugombo, Cibitoke). The journalist was researching a case regarding armed thieves who had stolen from and attacked civilians. The journalist works for Radio Isangario and Iwacu Newspaper.

On 22 May 2020, an unidentified armed group abducted and tortured a former technician for Radio Bonesha FM in Bujumbura city (Bujumbura Mairie) near Kanyosha neighborhood. He was released alive on 30 May 2020.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: On 27 May 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a journalist from Radio Isanganiro in Buhiga (Buhiga, Karuzi). Imbonerakure accused him of taking pictures and recording an off the record conversation.

ACTOR1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
NOTES: On 24 July 2020, an Imbonerakure attacked and injured a journalist in Mugina commune (Mugina, Cibitoke). The attack occurred during an election for communal administrator.
On 23 September 2021, police beat up a journalist attempting to report on the grenade attack on a colonel's house that evening in Kamenge (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie). He was then arrested.
On 1 November 2021, police beat up and injured a journalist at Buja FM in Rohero (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie). The police entered the radio broadcasting room with an arrest warrant for harassment.
On February 18th, Belarusian journalist Andrus Kozel was beaten by four policemen whilst filming in a polling station in Minsk.

On May 21st 2018, in Mogilev, a journalist Alina Skarbunova has been abducted by plainclothes people who later were confirmed as police. The abduction and further detention was caused by alleged cooperation of the freelance journalist with BelSAT independent media service.

On September 30th 2018, in Brest, masked police officers broke into Siarhei Piatrukhin's apartment. As a result, the blogger, who did not resist arrest, received injuries. The critical blogger faces criminal charges for alleged insult against a police officer.
On January 13th, journalist Konstantin Zhukowski and Boris Anikeev were attacked by four men with pepper sprays near the city of Khoyniki in Homel Region.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Belarus (1994-) Prison Guards
NOTES: Around 10 August 2020, security guards severely beat and tortured detainees and journalists in a detention centre in Minsk-Maskouski who participated in anti-government protests.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Belarus (1994-) Prison Guards
SOURCE: Charter-97; TUT.BY; Amnesty International; AFP; EuroNews
NOTES: Around 13 August 2020, security guards severely beat and tortured detainees and journalists in a detention centre in Minsk-Maskouski who participated in anti-government protests.
In March, a soldier seriously assaulted a Reaksmey Kampuchea journalist for allegedly taking unfavorable photographs of gambling in the Paoy Paet area (PP, BM).

On 14 January, a photographer from The Phnom Penh Post was beaten and briefly detained by district police at the Boeung Kak lakeside in Phnom Penh. The journalist was photographing the demolition of homes in the area.

On 11 September, Cambodian journalist Hang Serey Udom was found dead in the trunk of his car, in Ratanak Kiri province. The journalist was covering illegal logging and deforestation. He had left his house on 09 September, without returning. A military police officer was arrested.

On 25 September, a 42-year-old journalist for the Ta Prum weekly newspaper was severely beaten by three men, at his home in Malik commune, Andong Meas district, in Ratanak Kiri province. The suspects of the crime are a former police officer and two villagers, all accused of being illegal loggers.

On 10 April, Sorn Mongkul, a journalist with the Kampuchea Thmey newspaper, was severely beaten by deputy national military police commander Lay Sopheap and Kong Thearith, an assistant to Preah Vihear provincial military police. The journalist was covering illegal logging in Preah Vihear.
On 11 April, a reporter was allegedly beaten in custody while covering illegal logging in Pursat province. Capital of the province coded as location.
On 2 May 2014, Daun Penh district security guards chased and beat a VOD journalist for reporting on a council election event at Freedom Park in Phnom Penh city (PM, PP).

On 12 October, two journalists were allegedly assaulted by a group of suspects smuggling luxury wood, in northern Preah Vihear province. They claim when they encountered a vehicle they believed to be hauling illegal timber and took pictures of the cargo, the smugglers surrounded them and began to beat them with their helmets and sticks.

On 12 October, a journalist from Khmer Journalists Democracy (KJD) was fatally shot in Kratie province while investigating illegal logging near the border with Mondulkiri province. The suspect of the shooting is a police officer in Sre Chhouk commune in Keo Seima district, and also a timber trader. Some officers said that the journalist had been extorting luxury wood from the suspect.

On 22 December, six journalists representing four media outlets were beaten, shot at and had their equipment destroyed while trying to cover the scene of a traffic accident, in Daun Penh district's Srah Chak commune, in Phnom Penh.
In the week of 6 Feb 2019, in Pir Thnou commune, Snuol district, Kratie province, a local journalist was ambushed and beaten to death by three locals.

On 28 September 2020, five to six unknown assailants attacked two journalists who were on a trip to investigate the illegal timber trade in Memot district (Tbong Khmum). The assailants beat the journalists with sticks and threw an axe at their car. At least one journalist suffered an injury on his back. It is believed that the attack was motivated by the victims' reporting of forestry crimes.

On 20 October 2020, timber smugglers smashed the vehicle and attempted to assault 2 journalists reporting on illegal timber trade near Sekong bridge in Steung Treng commune, (Steung Treng, Stung Treng). One journalist suffered a slight injury.

On 14 March 2021, two men, presumed to be illegal loggers, attacked a journalist while he was asleep in Svey Leu district (Siem Reap). The victim claimed that the attack was premeditated and he was targeted due to his coverage of the crime. He required stitches and had two teeth broken.
A French journalist is kidnapped in the north and freed a week later, April 5th. The man was beaten and denied food.
A journalist is arrested in the north.
Brutal intimidation over a journalist by the police forces while he was looking into a children traffiking affair
01 September. The body of a local radio employee was found. He had reportedly been detained by security forces the day before.
07 October. Unidentified armed men shot at a Cameroon Tribune vehicle in Buea.

30 January. A journalist, Paul Chouta, is stabbed at his home in Yaounde by an unidentified armed group, following a string of violence against journalists after their coverage of an opposition protest.
04 February. A journalist, Paul Chouta, is beaten and stabbed by an unidentified armed group in Yaounde.
21 February. A journalist, Ambe Macmillan, is kidnapped by Ambazonian Separatists in Bamenda of Mezem.

SOURCE: Cameroon Online; RFI; AFP; Camer.be; Reuters; Mimi Mefo
NOTES: On 17 August 2019, military forces reportedly tortured a journalist to death in Yaounde city (Mfoundi, Centre). The victim was arrested on 2 August 2019 allegedly for being critical about the government's management of the Anglophone crisis. The authorities confirmed the death only on 5 June 2020 after the information was made public by a private media, and denied having tortured him while accusing him of coordinating logistics for separatist fighters.
03 September. A radio presenter was kidnapped by Ambazonian separatists on the outskirts of Buea, Buea subdivision, Fako. Separatists burned some of the radio station buildings during the abduction.

On 15 May 2020, the police forces reportedly arrested a journalist in Bonaberi neighbourhood of Douala city (Wouri, Littoral). He was then taken to a prison in Yaounde where he was reportedly continuously tortured for at least 25 days. He was accused of funding Ambazonian separatists.
On 31 May 2020, soldiers severely beat up and injured a journalist in Bamenda town (Mezam, Nord-Ouest).

On 20 January 2021, Ambazonian separatists kidnapped a worker of the regional hospital in Bamenda town, Bamenda 2 subdivision (Mezam, Nord-Ouest). A journalist was also abducted by separatists in the Ntarinkon neighborhood of Bamenda town. They were both later released.

On 14 March 2021, suspected Ambazonian separatists kidnapped a CRTV national television journalist in Buea town (Fako, Sud-Ouest). She was reportedly released shortly later. Separatists fighters denied having perpetrated this.

The journalist Elisabeth Blanche Olofio, presenter at Radio Be Oko of Bambari, was killed by rebel forces occupying the town.
Ex-Seleka members attacked a journalist of Radio ICDI at his home. He managed to escape, but his house was looted. Following this and other death threats, Radio ICDI has suspended its broadcasts.

A journalist was severely injured when armed Muslims attacked his home. He later died from his injured on May 5th 2014. His brother was also killed.
A Ndeke-Luka journalist was attacked by ex-Seleka while he was working.
Journalist Ulrich Landry Nguema-Ngokpele, director of Le Quotidien newspaper, was attacked by a gang of Anti-Balaka when they became suspicious of his work equipment.
The brother of Pachomius Pabandji, a well known journalist, was beaten and kidnapped by unidentified men, close to where the Iraqi MINUSCA employee was taken.

NOTES: 2 Western journalists were severely beaten up by ex-Seleka men after filming dead bodies along the river.

NOTES: A Poddala Pradeshiya Sabha member has been allegedly assaulted by the Poddala Pradeshiya Sabha chairman following a statement he made to a media organization.

A freelance journalist was assaulted by a group of men in what seemed to be a planned attacked while he was coming back home. The journalist reported injuries and was hospitalized. Police are investigating.
A group of media personnel were reportedly assaulted by the police forces while they were covering the IUSF protest.
A journalist was attacked - and subsequently hospitalised - by an unidentified group while he was walking in the Kattankudy area in what seemed to be a planned attack.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Sri Lanka); Tamil Ethnic Group (Sri Lanka)
NOTES: A Tamil journalist was allegedly attacked by a group of people believed to be part of a paramilitary group. The journalist reported injuries and was hospitalized.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Sri Lanka); Tamil Ethnic Group (Sri Lanka)
NOTES: The chief editor of a Tamil newspaper was attacked by two unidentified men who followed him and beat him up with iron rods. He was hospitalized with head injuries.
A chief editor has been assaulted by a lawyer when he expressed his opinion on the conduct of some Sri Lankan lawyers. The police are investigating on the incident.

An employee of Uthayan Daily was attacked by a group of persons who arrived in several motorbikes and was subsequently hospitalised while he was carrying newspapers for distribution. Police are investigating. Another distributor of the same paper, taking papers from Maalu-santhi Junction to Valveddiththu'rai was chased by some unidentified persons.
A journalist attached to The Sunday Leader newspaper was shot at and injured by unidentified gunmen at his house. Police are investigating.

A journalist attached to a private television station was attacked by 5 supporters of a local politician who arrived on motorbikes in what seemed to be a planned attack. He reportedly sustained head injuries and was admitted to hospital.

A journalist was attacked - and subsequently hospitalised - by a group of persons while he was heading home after work. The newspaper said that the attack came just days before he was to publish an article on the northern elections. Police are investigating.

A squad, believed to be operated by the Sri Lankan military intelligence, attacked a journalist. When he tried to escape, the attackers chased him on foot and assaulted him causing severe internal injuries to his head.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Tamil Ethnic Group (Sri Lanka); Journalists (Sri Lanka)
NOTES: A military squad reportedly attacked a Tamil journalist and attempted to throw him in front a speeding bus to kill him. It has been reported that Sri Lankan military intelligence operatives have intensified attacks on independent Tamil journalists in Vanni.

Regional Correspondent Suranga Rajanayaka was injured seriously after having been attacked by a group of people at the Gampola Hospital premises. Following the incident he was admitted to the Gampola Hospital.

On June 2, a worker at the Negombo Municipal Council and his accomplice armed with wooden pole attacked a human rights journalist in Gampaha district (Gampaha, Western) over an article the journalist wrote about a family suspected of being involved in corruption and association with criminals.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Sri Lanka); Tamil Ethnic Group (Sri Lanka); Women (Sri Lanka)
NOTES: On 28 Sept, in Jaffna, a motorcyclist attacked a Tamil journalist by intentionally crashing her motorcycle, injuring her. He also threatened her verbally before fleeing the scene.

On 28 Nov, in Colombo city, the entourage of the Chief of Defense Staff (CDS) assaulted journalists trying to photograph the CDS as he arrived at the Fort Magistrate's Court. A navy officer was later arrested by police for assault. Several journalists had been injured.
On Feb 19, following a petrol bomb attack on a house, a journalist who came to report the attack was assaulted by the police in Kokkuvil (Nallur, Jaffna).

On May 28, a Tamil Guardian journalist was assaulted by the police officer in charge of the Kokkilai police station in Mullaitivu, after report on the lack of progress in fulfilling court orders to remove CCTV cameras.

On November 14, an unidentified armed group attacked and injured a journalist while holding his wife at gunpoint in Galle city (Galle Four Gravets, Galle district). The incident ensued after the journalist published a book criticizing the main opposition candidate Gotabaya Rajapaksa ahead of the presidential election.

On December 26, an unidentified armed group attacked two houses including one of a journalist in Manipay town (Valikamam South-West (Sandilipay), Jaffna district). Police state that the attack was carried out as a retaliation against the recent arrest of two of their members.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Sri Lanka); Tamil Ethnic Group (Sri Lanka)
NOTES: On 21 August 2020, a Tamil journalist was attacked by two unidentified men in Jaffna city (Jaffna district).

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Sri Lanka); Tamil Ethnic Group (Sri Lanka)
NOTES: On 14 October 2020, two journalists investigating illegal smuggling of teak trees were assaulted by unidentified persons (allegedly smugglers) in Mullaitivu city (Mullaitivu district).
On 7 April 2021, a journalist was allegedly picked up and assaulted by police at the Maradana Police Station (Colombo), while he was taking photographs at a protest site in Colombo.

On 2 September 2021, police personnel blindfolded and beat up a freelance journalist along with his brother in Akkaraipattu (Ampara), for allegedly not wearing face masks to contain the spread of coronavirus. The duo was attacked when the journalist came out of his home to collect the news. The personnel also broke his camera.

On 27 November 2021, a group of four soldiers attacked and injured a journalist in Mullivaikkal (Mullaitivu district), while he was taking photographs of the Mullivaikkal name plate located in the area.

Radio Brakos director Vatankhah Tchanguis was arrested and severely beaten after airing of an interview with a Chadian opposition figure. He was released in critical condition 48 hours later.

A journalist with Radio Terre Nouvelle, was beaten by police officers in Chads southwestern Mayo-Kebbi Est region for asking questions about a civil disturbance he was reporting on
Armed Agents From the National Security Agency in Ndjamena the capital and detained them in handcuffs on the premises of a private hospital

A journalist was abducted by unidentified assailants in N'Djamena after leaving church. The arrest came shortly after he released an article critical of the president and security/intelligence services.
On February 25, unknown individuals assaulted a journalist and seized his motorbike in N'Djamena.

On 15 November 2018, in Temuco, Araucania region, the police forced a female journalist to undress under police custody. The victim claimed the officer denied her the right for a phone call and to use the restroom.
On 23 October 2019, in Concepcion, Biobio region, a journalist reporting for local media resulted injured when members of the Police Forces of Chiles charged against her with their horses.

On 24 October 2019, in Arica, Arica y Parinacota region, two female journalists reported sexual violence by members of the police forces of Chile. According to the victims, police officers arrested them in spite of showing the press card. Then in jail were forced to undressed and performed squats in front of a group of male officers.

On 25 November 2019, in Santiago, Metropolitan region, a group of between 6 to 10 police officers attacked a journalist. The victim claimed he was ambushed while walking alone and beaten by the state officers. The attack was registered by the go-pro camera carried by the victim.

On 02 December 2019, in Concepcion, Biobio region, police officers attacked a journalist. The victim claimed he was beaten by an unidentified officer. The attack was registered by the go-pro camera carried by the victim.

SOURCE: 24 Horas (Chile); La Estrella Concepcion; El Dia (Chile)
NOTES: On 27 March 2021, in the rural area of Tirua commune, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen opened fire on a group of journalists in the San Ramon area, injuring two people. One of the victims lost sight in one of his eyes. The team was in the area to interview a member of the CAM. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals.

On 5 March 2018, a Uyghur journalist was arrested in Yining city (Ili, Xinjiang) and detained incommunicado. He was later sentenced on 5 May 2018 to 19 years and 10 months of prison for terrorism and inciting hatred and ethnic discrimination and helping criminals. Some sources believe the motivation for his detention to be more related to his profession or because his son is studying abroad.

On 11 April 2018, two women were beaten up by dozens of people including security police and street and community personnel in Shijingshan District (Beijing) when they tried to visit the wife of a ''709'' lawyer (the lawyer had been missing for around 1,000 days). The group of government personnel had been gathering at the residence of the human rights lawyer to prevent anyone from entering or exiting the house. They kicked the victims and attacked them with a chair. The two victims were sent to hospital later. Some journalist on the scene was also dragged out of a car and beaten by the police.

Around 15 April 2018 (month of), a Uyghur businessman was arrested in Yining city (Ili, Xinjiang) and detained incommunicado. Reports later circulated that he had been sentenced to either 18 years or life in prison. The reasons for his detention remain unknown.

On 16 May 2018, at a hearing for the ''709 crackdown'' at the Beijing Lawyers Association Chaoyang Lawyer Service Center in Chaoyang District (Beijing), a photographer from the Hong Kong-based Now TV was violently pushed to the ground by three plainclothes police officers, and handcuffed by two uniformed officers. It was reported that he was beaten by ''between five to six'' police officers until he was bleeding. A human rights lawyer (the defendant) was also beaten by the police when he attempted to stop the assault of the journalist. Both of them were then forcibly dragged into a van. The lawyer was detained for 5-6 hours, while the journalist was released four hours later, reportedly after the State Council's Hong Kong and Macau Affairs Office had ''mediated'' at the request of the Hong Kong government.

Around 3 June 2018 (between 31 May and 6 June), three dissidents and one female dissident-cum-journalist were ''taken on mandatory vacation'' by the police in Beijing due to the stability maintenance before the 29th anniversary of the Tiananmen demonstrations on 4 June 1989. One was taken to Huangshan City in Anhui and then placed under house arrest back in Beijing on 5 June. Another was taken to Harbin City in Heilongjiang and then transferred to Jilin Province. Another was taken to Guizhou Province, and last reported in Changsha, Hunan Province. It was reported that the extension of their ''vacation'' after 4 June might be due to the stability maintenance during the Shanghai Cooperation Organization Summit in Qingdao between 9 and 10 June.

Around 7 July 2018 (as reported), a renowned Hunanese media commentator was being held under Residential Surveillance at a Designated Location (RSDL) by Chenzhou city (Hunan) police in an undisclosed location. Chen disappeared and lost contact several days after his 25 June 2018 reporting on the professional negligence and malfeasance of the Shaoyang Commission for Discipline Inspection Secretary. His wife and two brothers were also arrested.

On 13 August 2018, a journalist and his assistant from the Chinese department of news outlet Voice of America were taken away by the police and held incommunicado when they were interviewing a retired scholar at his home in Shangdong province. During the interview, people standing guard outside the scholar's home were trying to interrupt the interview multiple times. They were forced into a police car afterwards and driven away to an unknown location.

On 24 August 2018, more than 20 Guangdong police forces arrested at least eight editors and staff of Red Reference and Epoch Pioneer at their offices in Suzhuang, Fangshan district of Beijing, after both Maoist website organisations were involved in the Jiashi workers unionization labour movement. Their whereabouts are unknown. During the search, the police confiscated books, computers and broke furniture, and sealed off the premise.

Around 30 September 2018 (end of month), a Bitter Winter contributor was arrested in Xinjiang after he reported on ''transformation through education camps,'' including their internal construction. His whereabouts remained unknown as of 27 Dec.

Around 3 November 2018, a prominent photojournalist was taken away by the Ministry of State Security while on a field assignment in Kashgar (Xinjiang). Police notified his family about his detention more than a month later, but did not provide any reason for his arrest.

SOURCE: China Political Prisoner Concern; HKFP; Made In China Journal
NOTES: On 6 February 2019, a detained labour rights activist-cum editor of Xinshengdai - a migrants' rights monitoring website - was placed under residential surveillance at a designated location (RSDL) after being caught by the Shenzhen police in Guangzhou on 8 Jan and detained at Shenzhen No.2 Detention Centre in Futian District (Shenzhen). His disappearance was part of a crackdown on students and activists advocating for workers' rights.

On 22 Feb 2019, a former state television talk show host who was unable to be contacted and had not posted any social media updates was suspected to be kidnapped by state forces for at least a week before reappearing at the Communication University of China in Chaoyang (Beijing). The talk show host had been involved in a whistleblowing case regarding documents being stolen from a Supreme Court judge's office for a 100 billion yuan mineral ownership case. There was no official statement about his whereabouts during his 'disappearance'.

SOURCE: Weiquanwang; Radio Free Asia; Made In China Journal; HKFP
NOTES: On 20 March 2019, the labour rights activist-cum-editor of Xinshengdai - a migrants' rights monitoring website - was incommunicado for at least 24 hours, and suspected to have been kidnapped by police officers from Guangdong Province, as his co-editor had been arrested in Guangzhou city (Guangdong) the same day. On 26 March, it was made known that the editor was detained by the Shenzhen Pingshan Public Security Office at No. 2 Detention Centre for 'picking quarrels and provoking trouble'. Their disappearances were part of a crackdown on students and activists advocating for workers' rights. On 19 April, the activist and his colleague were placed under residential surveillance at a designated location (RSDL).

On 21 March 2019, the former editor of Maoist website Red Reference - and now editor at a cultural organisation - was charged with 'inciting subservion of state power' by the Nanjing Ministry of State Security (Jiangsu), and placed under Residential Surveillance at a Designated Location (RSDL). The organisation was involved in the Jiashi workers unionization labour movement, and the Ministry was allegedly concerned with domestic non-government organisations that received funding from overseas. The editor usually worked in Nanjing, but also lived in Shanghai.

On 20 April 2019, an editor of the labour rights website 'New Generation' was placed under Residential Surveillance in a Designated Location by the police in Shenzhen. He was first arrested on 20 March 2019 and was being held in criminal detention for 'provoking troubles'.

SOURCE: RTHK; CRLW; Radio Free Asia; DW
NOTES: On 23 April 2019, female journalist and political dissident was 'taken on mandatory vacation' by national security officers from her apartment in Beijing, and could not reveal her location. It was last reported that morning that she received formal documents signifying the end of her house arrest. She had been sentenced in April 2015, accused of leaking state secrets to foreign media. She served her sentence in jail, then at home when released on medical parole.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of China (2017-) Hong Kong Special Administrative Region; Journalists (China)
SOURCE: Ming Pao; HKFP; Radio Free Asia
NOTES: On 21 July 2019, hundreds of masked assailants dressed in white assaulted residents, protesters, journalists and a lawmaker in Yuen Long, presumably targeting anti-government protesters returning from HK Island to New Territories. These attackers used bamboo sticks and other weapons to attack people in the station, causing 45 injuries, including one Legislative Councillor. Police officers were not visibly present when the attack occurred. In a widely circulated online video, pro-Beijing lawmaker was seen applauding to people dressed in white.

On 11 August 2019, a large group of people dressed in red clothes with the characters 'Fujian people' written on them gathered in North Point in the Eastern district of Hong Kong. It is suspected that they are an organised group. They ganged up with a middle aged man to attack a citizen wearing black clothes and many reporters. Police took some of the attackers into a police car. Number of arrests and injuries unknown.

On 17 October 2019, a journalist was arrested by the Guangzhou Police for reporting on the anti-extradition protests in Hong Kong. She was detained for over 40 days before being placed under Residential Surveillance at a Designated Location.

SOURCE: Ming Pao; DW; HKFP; Radio Free Asia; RTHK; Weiquanwang
NOTES: On 17 October 2019, a female journalist went missing after being called to the Baiyun District (Guangzhou City, Guangdong Province). She was confirmed to be arrested by the police after a week because of her reporting on the recent demonstrations in Hong Kong.

On 6 February 2020, a citizen journalist and lawyer from Qingdao who reported on the coronavirus epidemic in Wuhan prefecture (Hubei) (coded to Jiang'an) disappeared and lost contact for more than 24 hours. It was reported that he had been forcibly quarantined by the authorities for reporting on the situation of the coronavirus epidemic in Wuhan. Without any formal charges being brought against him so far, he had been incommunicado and held at an unknown location for nearly 14 months, until he was reported to have been reunited with family on 29 Mar 2021 with limited freedom of movement within a specified area.

On 9 February 2020, a citizen journalist and businessman who had reported about the coronavirus situation was taken away by plainclothes police from his residence in Wuhan prefecture (Hubei) (coded to Jiang'an) (coded to Jiang'an), and firefighters were seen prying open the door. He had been detained and released several times between 1-9 Feb for streaming and posting videos about the coronavirus condition and corpses inside Wuhan hospitals. His WeChat account was then shut down, and his conditions and whereabouts remained unknown as of 26 Dec 2020.

On 26 February 2020, a citizen journalist was suspected to be taken away and held incommunicado by personnel from the Public Security Bureau in Wuhan City, Hubei Province. He had been in Wuhan reporting from the front line of the coronavirus outbreak, and was likely to be have been taken away by the authorities. He was livestreaming from his place of residence when there was a knock on his door, and his camera was abruptly cut off. This was part of an ongoing crackdown on people who had been reporting or sharing information about the coronavirus outbreak.

On 29 March 2020, a photographer from Wuhan who had been working for a German television broadcasting company reportedly went missing in Wuhan, after he had been reporting on the coronavirus outbreak in the city. It was reported by several news publications that he was likely to have been taken away by the Chinese authorities for his coverage on the coronavirus. His enforced disappearance was the fourth incident of journalists who had been reportedly missing or detained by the Chinese authorities since February 2020 due to their coverage of the coronavirus outbreak in Wuhan.

On 15 May 2020, a female citizen journalist was taken away from her rental house in Nanshixia Village, Gu'an County (Langfang City, Hebei Province) by the police. She was then handed over to the local government officials and detained in a hotel until the end of the annual parliamentary sessions. After the detention, she was repatriated to her rental house for treatment of her back pain.

On 3 June 2020, a female citizen journalist was taken away from Beijing by personnel from the public security bureau of Dingzhou City, Hebei. She remains uncontactable at the time of reporting on 4 June 2020. She had recently been detained at a hotel on 15 May 2020 to prevent her from reporting during the annual parliamentary sessions.

On 10 June 2020, a middle-aged pro-establishment man attacked a female online media reporter at Citygate, Tung Chung in Islands District (Hong Kong). The reporter was at the scene filming two demonstrators who held a 'Lunch with You' rally at the mall, when the man, who was allegedly unhappy with the demonstration, attacked the reporter. The man was arrested by the police, while the reporter was sent to the hospital for treatment.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: DAB: Democratic Alliance for the Betterment and Progress of Hong Kong; Former Government of China (2017-) Hong Kong Special Administrative Region
NOTES: On 12 June 2020, a man (who was later identified to be a former community officer of DAB) attacked an Epoch Times reporter and members of the public with a knife at Kwun Tong Station (Yue Man Square) Minibus Terminus in Kwun Tong District (Hong Kong). Several people stepped forward to subdue the assailant after the attack, and the man was arrested. One man who sustained injuries was sent to the hospital for treatment. The incident took place when people had gathered around a street booth that had been set up in commemoration of the first anniversary of the first major police clashes during the anti-ELAB demonstration on 12 June 2019.

SOURCE: Reuters; DW; Radio Free Asia; Liveuamap
NOTES: On 14 August 2020, an Australian female citizen and financial journalist (born in China) for CGTN (the English-language channel of CCTV) was arrested in Beijing municipality and placed under Residential Surveillance at a Designated Location (RSDL). Australian authorities learnt of her arrest on the same day. It was then suspected that the arrest could be related to her public comments about China's handling of the coronavirus pandemic. Six months later, the Australian foreign ministry stated that charges of 'illegal disclosure of national secrets overseas' on 5 Feb 2021.

On 23 November 2020, an imprisoned female citizen journalist and lawyer was forcibly tube-fed through her nose by fellow prisoners (assumed to be at the behest of prison guards) in her cell in Pudong New Area Detention Centre, Pudong New Area (Shanghai) (coded as Shanghai-Pudong New Area), for undergoing a hunger strike since six months ago. This had happened several times during her imprisonment, leading to stomach pains.

On 11 May 2021, a female reporter for Epoch Times - also head of the Hong Kong Association of Falun Dafa - was assaulted by an unidentified assailant near her Ho Man Tin residence in Kowloon City district (Hong Kong) (coded as Hong Kong - Kowloon City), who beat her for a minute with a baseball bat, then hopped onto a car and fled the scene with his accomplices. The reporter received hospital treatment for the multiple bruises to her legs. She had been followed by unknown individuals in the past year.

On 19 September 2021, a female independent journalist and an activist were taken away by police at a residence in Haizhu district, Guangzhou, ahead of the journalist's planned departure to study in the UK via Hong Kong. The pair was placed under residential surveillance in a designated location for 'incitement to subvert state power', mainly due to the regular gatherings of friends at the activist's home. On 5 November 2021, their family members received an arrest notice, stating that they had been officially arrested on 27 October 2021 and detained at Guangzhou No. 1 Detention Centre. SOURCE: ProtectDefenders.eu; Front Line Defenders; Caracol Radio
NOTES: On 17 February 2018, in Filo Gringo, El Tarra, the body of a social leader and broadcaster of the community was found with bullet injuries. Local organizations and leaders asked the authorities to clarify the death.

On 5 March 2018, in Pioya, Cauca, a Nasa indigenous journalist was shot dead by armed men. Together with a community group, he was persecuting armed men who earlier had released criminals detained in the city hall.

On 1 August 2018, in Suarez, Cauca, a radio announcer and journalist was shot dead in Los Almendros neighbourhood. The victim was know for his work in a community radio, where he frequently reported issues faced by the population.
On 17 December 2018, journalist was shot dead by unidentified armed actors in his house in Los Nogales neighbourhood in Riohacha (Riohacha, La Guajira).

Around 11 January 2019 (as reported), a group of journalists was harassed by armed men in a motorcycle while they were reporting the targeting of social leaders in the town El Salado in Carmen de Bolivar in Bolivar.

On 16 February 2019, The ELN abducted four journalists and a social leader in the rural area of the municipality of Teorama in Norte de Santander. According to the version the group was released hours later due to military pressure.

NOTES: On April 25, 2019, ESMAD police forces attacked a journalist that was covering the protest held by social organizations in Bogota. The victim was injured in the face.
On June 11, 2019, unidentified armed men killed a journalist in the municipality of Samaniego, Narino. No armed group has claimed the attack.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia; Journalists (Colombia)
NOTES: On June 17, unidentified armed men killed a former FARC member and journalist in El Palo, municipality of Caloto, Cauca. No group has claimed the attack.

On July 2, 2019, a group of journalists was attacked by unidentified men in the city of Medellin, Antioquia. The vehicle of the journalist received a pellet fire in the back window. No group has claimed the event.

On July 21, 2019, unidentified armed men killed a social leader and journalist in the town and municipality of Floridablanca in Santander. The victim was a recognized advocated of a natural reserved in the area. No group has claimed the attack.
On 18 October 2019, in Llorente, Tumaco, Narino, a journalist and broadcaster was shot dead by two armed men while on his work at a community station.

On 6 November 2019, in Barranquilla, a journalist was attacked and injured by the police and security guards from the president, in the entrance of a convention center. The journalist had questioned President Duque about the government air strike that killed eight children in Caqueta in August. The agents also told him to erase the material he had recorded.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Colombia (2018-) ESMAD: Mobile Anti-Disturbance Squadron
NOTES: Around 14 August 2020 (as reported), in a rural area of Corinto municipality, Cauca department, two Nasa indigenous men were killed by military forces and ESMAD officers, in the El Barranco community. The attack occurred when security forces were evicting a group of people from a private property in the community. One of the victims was also a journalist. Two individuals, including a former governor, were injured. 2 fatalities.

On 16 December 2020, in Chinchina, Caldas department, unidentified armed individuals shot at the house of a local journalist. The victim had reported several cases of gender-based violence cases in the municipality. No fatalities or injuries reported.

On 21 December 2020, in Santiago De Cali, Valle Del Cauca department, unidentified armed individuals shot dead a journalist and injured another person in a drive-by shooting. The victim had previous threats due to his work as a journalist. The victim died in the hospital two days later after the attack. 1 fatality.

On 20 April 2021, in Santiago De Cali, Valle del Cauca department, unidentified armed individuals injured a journalist in a drive-by shooting. Perpetrators shot at the victim while he smoked in front of his house. According to the victim's testimony, the men called his name before opening fire.

On 4 May 2021, in Neiva (Huila), three unidentified armed militants on motorcycles used a sub-machine gun to attack a journalist, killing one of his bodyguards in a drive-by shooting. The identity of the perpetrators is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 8 June 2021, in Medellin (Antioquia), eight unidentified armed individuals attacked a journalist and director of a local radio station in the city. The armed men opened fire on the victim's house. Perpetrators failed to break into the residence. The victim was uninjured.
Around 5 July 2021, in Suarez (Cauca), unidentified armed individuals shot death a journalist and host of a local radio station. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 1 fatality.

Around 19 July 2021, in Yumbo (Valle del Cauca), in a drive-by shooting unidentified armed individuals shot dead two youths who had gathered in a local store. One of the victims was a journalist. The area is known for the presence of armed groups. 2 fatalities.

On 19 September 2021, in Tulua (Valle del Cauca), unidentified armed individuals killed a local journalist in the La Esperanza neighborhood. The perpetrator broke into the store and opened fire on the victim several times. Subsequently, he fled the area on a motorcycle. 1 fatality.

Around 2 October 2021, in the rural area of Tulua (Valle del Cauca), unidentified armed individuals opened fire on the car of a political activist in a drive-by shooting. Perpetrators shot at the victim's vehicle when she had recently abandoned the car, nevertheless, the driver and a journalist were still inside. Both fled unharmed from the attack. There were no fatalities.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident - 33rd Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (33rd Front)
NOTES: Around 5 December 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of Campo Dos corregimiento (Norte de Santander), members of the dissident front 33 of the FARC abducted for several hours a group of journalists covering a report on the armed conflict in the area. The perpetrators forced the team to move almost 20 kilometers away from the populated area. The armed group later released the men on the same day.
On 13 November 2021, police officers (gendarmerie) hit the motorcycle of a journalist from ORTC in Mutsamudu (Mutsamudu, Anjouan), injuring her.
Ninjas attacked a private radio station. Fatalities: 4 civilians

NOTES: 3 French journalists attacked

ACTOR1: Police Forces of the Republic of Congo (1997-)

NOTES: Journalists in Brazzaville came to meet with the lawyers of a prisoner, but were arrested and beaten by security forces wearing civilian clothes at the HQ of The African Week. Shots and injuries were sustained.

NOTES: On 16 February, a journalist was abducted from a Brazzaville clinic where he was hospitalised. He was reported to have been taken by the director of the Brazzaville prison.

RCD accused of beating and arresting human rights activists and journalists in DRC

NOTES: Armed intruders break into a journalists home and threaten him.

NOTES: A journalist working with the RTNC was shot dead by 2 armed men in Keshero district of Goma.

2 Congolese Al-Jazeera journalists were kidnapped by unidentified assailants in the Nyanzale area. They were later released. One of the journalists claimed their kidnappers were Rwandan Hutu rebels associated with the Nyatura Mayi Mayi militia. They were both admitted to hospital after their release for injuries sustained at the hands of their captors.

NOTES: 4 journalists working for Radio Veritas were arrested on Wednesday 29th, and since then were tortured by the National Intelligence Agency, according to Journalists in Danger (JED).

NOTES: On June 2, the radio Grand Tam-Tam from Lodja was pillaged. The emission is currently down. The assailants destroyed material, stole some, and beat up a human rights activist that was finishing an emission.

Rodrigue Ndakazieka, a journalist from Radio Mwinda (owned by a member of the Lamuka Coalition) was detained by police who provide security to Antoinette Ipulu, the National Deputy of the FCC. SOURCE: RFI; BBC News; Actualite; 7 Sur 7; Bunia Actualite
NOTES: On the evening of 2 November 2019, attackers believed to be Mayi Mayi Mazembe militiamen raided the house of journalist and Ebola response worker Papy Mumbere Mahamba in Lwemba city in Babila-Babombi chieftaincy, Ituri, and stabbed him to death with machetes and seriously injured his wife, also an Ebola response worker, before setting fire to their house. Two suspects were later arrested. Mahamba was coming back from a talk show on Lwemba's community radio in which he raised awareness on Ebola.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: On 9 January 2020, unknown armed persons attacked a journalist in Butembo.

The victim was chased and attacked by officials after showing his accreditation. The journalist suffered a broken leg and injuries to both his head and arm.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: On 9 May 2020, a female journalist was chased and abducted by unknown armed men in military uniforms in Kinshasa (Kinshasa). The police took her to the hospital.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
NOTES: On 9 May 2020, 4 journalists from a local radio were severely beaten and then arrested by the police in Mbuji Mayi (Mbuji-Mayi, Kasai-Oriental). The exact reason for the attack was unclear but they are believed to have been attacked because they had been critical of the Governor.

On 12 June 2020, 8 armed men from the Mayi Mayi Dragon militia abducted 2 journalists from a local radio in the area of Bapere (Lubero, Nord-Kivu), accused of not covering the militiamen's demands related to their recent disarmament. The rebels claimed that they handed over their arms that week but they were not given the support from the authorities corresponding to the disarmament and demobilization process.

NOTES: On 16 June 2020, suspected APCLS armed men kidnapped 3 local journalists in Kalembe (Walikale, Nord-Kivu), at the border with Masisi and Rutshuru territories. The victims were released 4 days after, following the payment of a ransom.

ACTOR1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
NOTES: Around 23 June 2020, suspected APCLS armed men shot and killed 1 journalist who had been kidnapped by these armed men in Kalembe (Walikale, Nord-Kivu) along with 2 other local journalists who were released. The kidnappers had asked a 5,000 USD ransom for the victim's release.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

ACTOR1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
NOTES: On 28 July 2020, police forces attacked 10 journalists who were due to cover a demonstration against the provincial governor in Kisangani (Tshopo). The police, who did not allow the march to begin, targeted the journalists by beating and robbing them and arbitrarily seizing their material.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

NOTES: On 19 October 2020, a group of FARDC soldiers on patrol arbitrarily arrested 1 journalist of a local radio in Mongbwalu town (Djugu, Ituri). He was then beaten and tortured by the military, who also took his belongings.

SOURCE: MONUSCO; BBC News; Radio Okapi; AFP; Actualite

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Labour Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: Around 30 September 2021 (as reported), 5 decapitated/buried bodies, who were killed by an unidentified armed group, were discovered in Ariwara (Aru, Ituri). One of the victims was a radio host and another one a mechanic. Several weeks earlier (date unknown) a police officer was killed by the same group and was buried in this location (coded as another event). Suspects were detained and admitted to killing 13 people - it is unclear whether the 6 victims mentioned above are part of the 13 killings, when they were killed, or whether the rest of the killings took place in Ituri province.
