ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNPACU: Patriotic Union of Cuba; Journalists (Cuba)
NOTES: On 23 July 2020, in Guantanamo, a number of UNPACU members as well as journalists were taken by the police. Police threatened to kill some of the detained people. Some were left barefoot and without clothes in the mountains miles from their homes. Another was beaten and his money and belongings taken from him before being left miles from home.

On 10 October 2020, in Habana, Habana, a pro-government militia attacked a journalists, ripping her coronavirus mask off her face and stealing her phone before bringing her to a police station. The journalist had placed a sign on her home, inviting passers-by to an opposition led event. The sign motivated the attack. [size=no report]
On 12 November 2020, in Habana, Habana, a YouTuber and journalist was detained by police officers and then verbally and physically assaulted by the officers. No fatalities.
On 12 November 2020, in Habana, Habana, police officers beat a journalist and then arrested him. No fatalities.

On 1 December 2020, in Camaguey, Camaguey, a journalist was beaten by police officers. They then arrested him and took him to the police station where he was threatened with more beatings and then fined. The police declared that the journalist was detained for his ties with members of the San Isidro Movement. No fatalities.
On 21 December 2020, in Habana, Habana, police officers violently detained a writer and journalist. He was then arrested and taken to a police station. His arms bores wounds . No fatalities.
On 18 March 2021, in Habana, Habana, police officers beat a journalists and then detained him. They also shouted slurs at him over his sexual orientation. No fatalities.

Around 10 May 2021 (between 30 April - 22 May), in Habana, La Habana, an activist and journalist arrested on 30 April 2021 during a demonstration in support of a hunger strike, was tortured by police officers. The officers prevented her sleeping and subjected the activist to night interrogations every five or ten minutes. The woman was placed in house arrest on 29 May 2021. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 14 November 2021, in Habana, La Habana, State Security agents shouted, threatened and beat accredited journalists who approached the house of the main promoter of the anti-government demonstration 'Civic March for Change' scheduled for 15 November, in the La Coronela neighbourhood, to interview him. Casualties unknown.

On 22 November 2021, in Sancti Spiritus, Sancti Spiritus, two members of the paramilitary group 'Rapid Response Brigades' beat and injured an independent journalist and coordinator of the National Council of the United Antitotalitarian Forum (FANTU). According to the victim, the perpetrators used an unspecified object to hit him, causing small injuries to his face and arms. 1 man was injured.

On 7 December 2021, in Artemisa, Artemisa, two hooded men entered the house of a female journalist and director of an independent media outlet and beat her, injuring her. Perpetrators did not take anything from the house and left after warning her. According to the victim, state security forces or people sent by them would be responsible for the attack. The beating of the journalist occurred only two days after state security agents raided her home (uncoded). 1 woman was injured.

On 2 August 2021, unidentified perpetrators beat the Editor-in-Chief of the Cyprus Real News Site in Northern Nicosia, who sustained very serious injuries. The attack took place outside his home. On the same night, unidentified perpetrators attacked the cameraman of the same news site, who was insulted and beaten, while he was on duty outside a police station.
Journalist killed by officer
two journalists beaten

'Four journalists were beaten, detained and later released by police. The journalists had published a letter from an underground police force that was meant for Benins head of police. The officers said the journalists were being unethical.'

ACTOR1: Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)
NOTES: On August 25 2019, in Boca Chica, Santo Domingo, a journalist was arrested by police forces for hours and beaten repeatedly because according to police forces he had parked incorrectly in public zones. ACTOR1: FARC Dissident - Oliver Sinisterra Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Oliver Sinisterra Front)
NOTES: Around 26 March 2018 (between 26 March - 11 April), in Mataje area (Esmeraldas), members of the FARC dissident group Oliver Sinisterra Front kidnapped and later shot dead two journalists and their driver with bullets to the back of the head, near the border with Colombia. 3 fatalities

On 27 January 2021, in Guayaquil, Guayas, a local journalist was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting by armed men on a motorcycle in Juan Tanca Marengo Avenue, while he was on his car. There is no report on the identity of the perpetrators or crime motivation. 1 fatality
January 17, 2019. In San Bartolome Perulapia, a journalist disappeared. The next day he was found dead from knife injuries. The reasons and perpetrators of the crime are still unknown.

January 21, 2019. In Soyapango, San Salvador, a journalism student was attacked by a group of armed men who shot her in the head. She was accompanied by another young man who was also shot. The journalist died and her friend is in critical conditions.

On 12 May 2019, in the La Carmenza neighbourhood, Hato Nuevo locality (San Miguel, San Miguel), 2 journalists from the Oriental Television channel covering the news over the killing of a gang member during a clash with the police forces were assaulted and beaten by 2 police officers. No further information is available.
As reported on 17 April 2020, in Nejapa (San Salvador), a journalist reported an attack by a police officer while she worked at the Integration Roundabout. Motive unclear.
On 27 April 2020, in Santa Rosa de Lima (La Union), the body of a Nicaraguan journalist was found in an agricultural land at the Albornoz neighborhood. Motive and perpetrators unknown.
On 31 July 2020, in Soyapango (San Salvador), a journalist was beaten by an alleged gang member as he covered a news report in a zone with intense gang activity. No fatality.

On 12 October 2020, in San Salvador (San Salvador), a journalist was attacked by four armed men who asked him to get down on the floor. The journalist escaped. The attack is allegedly linked to the victim's political positions against President Bukele, and according to some sources, may have been coordinated by someone working for the government. Neither injuries nor fatalities reported.
27 February. A critical journalist, Paysa Elo Eyoto, is tortured in Malabo Detention Center of Bioko Norte by military forces.
From the newspaper Ocala State Banner.
Reporter beaten unconcious
Offices of independent newspaper attacked

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Liyu Police
NOTES: On 11 May, a female rights activist was killed while being detained by Liyu Police paramilitaries in Kebri Dehar city. An Ethiopian Somali news outlet claimed pictures circulated showed wounds around her neck pointing to a death by hanging. It was said to be a punitive measure against her outspoken relatives of the Somali regional government. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]
14 September. Reuters TV journalist and cameraman were attacked in Addis Ababa while reporting a conflict. Their cameras smashed and confiscated by same youth group.
On 20 January 2021, security forces reportedly shot and killed a news reporter in Mekele city (Southern Tigray, Tigray), also killing the reporter's friend who was in the car at the same time.

ACTOR1: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Abba Torbee Splinter Faction)
NOTES: On 9 May 2021, a journalist from the state-affiliated Oromo Broadcasting Network (OBN) was shot and killed by suspected Oromo Liberation Front (OLF)-Shane and Abbaa Torbee militants near his residence in Dembi Dolo (Denbi Dollo town, Kellem Wollega Zone).
A well known journalist has died after 5 years in captivity. He is thought to have died of police brutality.

On 25 December 2018, two journalists were filming in a suburb in Cayenne. They were beaten and robbed by young people. According to the International Association of Francophone Journalists, these events are not unusual.

On 9 March 2014, Maydaneh Abdallah Okieh, the website editor of La Voix de Djibouti, was arrested at his home and charged with disturbing public order following his coverage of an opposition meeting. He was allegedly beaten by security forces while in detention
A reporter covering the protests in Balbala is arrested and severely beaten by the police.

In August 2014, journalist Mohamed Ibrahim Waiss was arrested and detained, in Djibouti City, and accused of 'incitement and publishing false news.' According to the Committee to Protect Journalists, he was beaten and denied access to medical treatment while detained at Hodan Balbala Police Station

Kadar Abdi Ibrahim, publication co-director of the Aurore newspaper, was arrested by police in connection with the publication of a photograph of a seven-year-old girl who died during the violent dispersal of a religious ceremony by the police and the Djibouti army on 21 December 2015. He was reportedly tortured in detention. He was later condemned to a two-month suspended prison sentence, while the publication of this monthly newspaper was also suspended for two months.

In early March 2017, the famous caricaturist Idriss Hassan Mohamed was arrested and held in an undisclosed location for five days. According to LDDH, his leg was broken during interrogation and detention. LDDH claims he was arrested in retaliation for an article he published criticising the regime
Around 26 October 2019 (as reported), in Goubetto, journalist Osman Yonis Bogoreh, was reported to be tortured for 48 hours by the Djiboutian police before his release.
A journalist was beaten by soldiers inside the presidential compound. The journalist was taken to the intensive care unit.
A gang armed with a hammer attacked the television station of Gabons main opposition leader Andre Mba Obame
Journalist Olivier Ndembi is interrogated by the General Directorate for Investigation regarding his research into the alleged involvement of Gabonese politicians in ritual killings

On 19 March, a group of Georgian March activists attacked a group of journalists belonging to Rustavi-2 network outside of the station's headquarters in Tbilisi. The fight was instigated by a religious joke said during a newscast.
On 28 November, reportedly, a journalist was attacked by members of Georgian Dream in Tbilisi while reporting on elections. This was one of the two attacks on journalists during the day.

On 23 October, a blogger was severely beaten in Sukhumi by unidentified people for his critical comments on Facebook about a wedding feast. The pictures showing his beating were uploaded on Facebook. The case got much attention in Abkhazian and Georgian media.
On 29 October 2020, Georgian Dream representatives reportedly attacked a journalist in Samtredia because they did not like the journalist's questions.

On 24 February 2021, three men attacked and beat a prominent journalist Vakho Sanaia in Tbilisi. The journalist said that the attack is the result of the government's aggressive rhetoric against critical journalists.

On 8 April 2021, unidentified people attacked the Formula TV crew's car and broke windows in Gamarjveba, Gardabani municipality. According to the TV station the attack is caused by the ruling party's ''aggressive rhetoric'' against journalists.
A journalist was attacked at the Yundum military barracks.
In October of 2003, a general commanded an attack be carried out on The Independent newspaper in Banjul.
There was an arson attack on the newspaper, The Independent. The arsonists attempted to lock the workers in and set them on fire but the workers managed to escape with only a few burns.
The house of a BBC reporter was set on fire by unidentified arsonists.
A Gambian newspaper editor was shot dead on his way home after legislation was recently passed that would tighten press freedom. Two other newspaper reporters were hurt in the attack as well.
A reporter from the Daily Observer, Ramatoulie Charreh, was harassed and beaten by police for trying to visit the site where Deyda Hydara of The Independent was killed.
A reporter of The Point, Njameh Bah, was severely beaten by an armed group.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Gambia (1996-2017) National Intelligence Agency
NOTES: Alleged NIA officers arrested Ebrima Manneh, a reporter for the Daily Observer, at the paper's offices just outside of Banjul. His whereabouts are still unknown and the Gambian government has repeatedly denied ever having him in custody
Two reporters for the Daily Express, Baron Eloagu and Abdougafar Olademinji, were attacked and severely beaten.
A journalist for The Independent, Momodou Justice Darboe, was stabbed on his way home. He did not die from th wounds.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Gambia (1996-2017) National Intelligence Agency
NOTES: Alagie Abdoulie Ceesay, manager of Taranga FM radio station, was picked up by NIA agents on July 2 and released July 13, without charge; he was reportedly severely tortured. Ceesay was seen forced into a car in Banjul four days later. He is on trial for sedition and has been refused bail

On 22 July, 2019, Malick Jatta disclosed that on 16 December, 2004, he took part in the assassination of journalist Deyda Hydara and that ex- Gambia president Yahya Jammeh had ordered and compensated the assassination.

At least five Israeli settlers Tuesday afternoon assaulted a Palestinian photojournalist with rocks and batons while he was driving on a road near the illegal Israeli settlement of Ofra in the occupied West Bank district of Ramallah.

On Jan 11, Israeli soldiers raided Bilin injuring a photojournalist with a rubber coated bullet as he was working. Israeli forces also fired stun grenades into a home causing the home to catch on fire.
On Feb 19 2019, Israeli forces attacked a vehicle of journalists near Yusuf's Tomb, east of Nablus. One Journalist was injured by a rubber bullet.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Palestine (2007-) Gaza Strip
NOTES: As reported on March 21 2019, a Palestinian journalist and his mother were beaten by Hamas security forces as they raided their home in Gaza. The journalist was arrested and his cell phone confiscated.

On October 24 2019, Israeli soldiers attacked Palestinian farmers as well as national and international volunteers whilst harvesting olives in the village of al Lubban al Sharqiyah. Soldiers beat them and hurled stun grenades in their direction. Israeli forces also seized the phones of journalists who covered the event.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Israel (2009-2021) Shin Bet
NOTES: On 1 December 2019, Israeli military forces and Shin Bet police forces broke into a house in Al Quds - Old City area (West Bank), inspected the house, and beat its civilian residents in an attempt to arrest a journalist.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Palestine); Government of Palestine (2007-) Hamas Government in Gaza
NOTES: On 17 December 2020, Israel soldiers opened fire at Palestinian journalists and people from the ministry of agriculture in Al-Fukhari area to the east of Khan Yunis. There were no injuries reported.
On 25 April 2021, a security patrol member of Hamas attacked a female journalist in Juhr ad Dik (Gaza City) with a tree branch for not wearing a headscarf. The journalists sustained slight injuries.

On 7 May 2021, Israeli military forces severely beat a Palestinian journalist and fired tear gas canisters towards other journalists and medics at the Salem military camp in Jenin (Jenin). The Israeli military forces also broke the camera of a Palestinian Television channel and closed down the area following the recent attacks.

SOURCE: PLO Negotiations Affairs Department; Ma'an News Agency
NOTES: On 18 October 2021, 10 Israeli soldiers physically assaulted Palestinians, including Palestinian journalists, after chasing them at Damascus Gate (Bab al Amoud) in Al Quds - Old City (Al Quds, West Bank). Soldiers also fired stun grenades at them. The Israeli military forces continuously attack Palestinians at the Damascus Gate, which is considered the main entrance to Al Aqsa Mosque.

On 21 November 2021, Israeli military forces beat a Palestinian female journalists and a youth during their raid into the assailant's house in Al Quds - Mukhayyam Shuafat (Al Quds, West Bank), who conducted an armed attack against Israelis today in Al Quds.
On 17 February 2020, an unknown man attacked an Iranian journalist, who spoke two days earlier at a protest, by pulling his hair and threatening him with a knife in Munchen - Au-Haidhausen.
On 1 May 2020, a police officer hit a journalist in the face in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg. The female journalist had to be treated medically. The reason is unclear.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: The Right (Germany); NPD: National Democratic Party of Germany
NOTES: On 23 October 2021, a group of neo-Nazis, including members of The Right and NPD, pushed, shoved, kicked, and threw unidentified projectiles at a journalist filming in Hildesheim. Attackers tried to intimidate the journalist and make him leave the premises.
Police attacked two journalists who were known for stating their position on land owning rights and private companies.

Police attacked a journalist who was accompanying an abused woman to police headquarters to report a crime. Police detained the journalist after beating him. The police were cited as mistrusting the journalist.
Four journalists were attacked by NDC supporters at a voter registration drive where the journalists were reporting.
NDC attack journalists

A journalist in Ghana has been apparently assaulted by security operatives while covering a police raid in Ho, the capital of the Volta region. Four unidentified police officers assaulted the reporter before stealing his camera. One of the dead dealers, the target of the raid died.
NPP supporters attack journalists of a local radio station.

Two journalists reported being assaulted by military police officers when they attempted to take photographs of President John Mahama who was meeting with chiefs and leaders of political parties at a parade ground.
Police forces assault, arrest, and hold for several hours a group of journalists covering a story about a church.
Three police officers and one civilian severely beat and tortured with electricity a cameraman from TV3 television in order to collect a debt owed to the civilian

A photographer was assaulted by a military officer after he tried to take pictures of a confrontation between military personnel and some youths of the area. His camera was destroyed and some of his equipment was seized.
A senior reporter with Oman FM was on Monday reportedly beaten by two military guards from the Flagstaff House at Ashaiman in the Greater Accra Region.

Joy News' camera technician who was covering the election of the DCE for the Ada East District Assembly in the Greater Accra Region Friday was locked up after a scuffle broke out. The cameraman was arrested by some heavily built men, numbering more than five and was bundled into a room outside the auditorium. Joy News' Maxwell Agbagba who was also at the venue reported some police officers prevented him from filming the process.

On 27 August 2018, a journalist was abducted and taken to the residency of a local opposition politician (APC) in Bawku (Upper East municipality). The journalist alleged that he was beaten by his abductors on the instruction of the politician, before being rescued by police (who had received a tip-off as to the journalists location). The politician acknowledged the journalist had been brought to his house, but denied arranging for his abduction, or giving instructions for him to be beaten.
On December 28, in Accra city (Accra, Greater Accra), policemen attacked a journalist who was covering the BHIM concert, leaving him hospitalized.

On January 16, an investigative journalist was shot in the neck and chest by unknown assailants while he was driving in Accra. The attack is thought to be politically motivated as a member of the Ghaninan parliament recently criticised his work and pointed him as a target.
07 March (or around). Two journalists were kidnapped by workers of a gold mine while investigating at Apampatia village. Police forces rescued the journalists

14 March. Three journalists filmed a police officer on an unregistered motorbike involved in a traffic accident. They got engaged in an argument and were later pounced and assaulted by a team of 10 police and military officers. The journalists were rushed to the hospital for treatment.
29 September. A woman journalist was beaten by NPP militias (invisible forces militia coded as NPP is condiered by one of them) when covering parliamentary primaries in Tamale.
On 20 March 2020, a journalist was attacked by two youths in Damongo (West Gonja, Savannah) and urged to stop reporting on cattle theft in the area.

On 5 April 2020, a Ghanaian journalist of Deutsche Welle was beaten and assaulted by a soldier of the Ghana Armed Forces while recording an interview in the outskirts of Kumasi (Kumasi, Ashanti). The soldier was a member of a patrol team responsible for the enforcement of coronavirus restrictions.
On 12 August 2020, a military officer has beaten up a journalist in Accra (Accra, Greater Accra) for filming a clean-up exercise at a bus station.

On 11 May 2021, a broadcast journalist with Citi FM/Citi TV was assaulted by National security operatives (Police) who arrested him for filming some abandoned cars at the Ministry of National Security in Accra city (Greater Accra).
On 28 January 2018, early in the morning, two unidentified perpetrators wearing helmets attacked a journalist in Athens, punching him repeatedly. He was transferred to hospital.

On 6 April 2019, three members of Golden Dawn attacked two photo reporters in Exarchia in Athens-Central Athens. They kicked their legs to make them kneel on the ground while they were insulting them and punched them in the face with ringed fingers. One of the photo reporters believes that him and his colleagues are being targeted for covering the demonstrations against the Prespes Agreement regarding the North Macedonia name dispute and also that this was an organised attack to send a message that Golden Dawn can operate in Exarchia that has a strong anarchist presence.

As reported on 26 April, earlier this week five people - allegedly far-left activists - assaulted a writer, who uses the pseudonym Mr L and whose work has been published in far-right magazines, at a cafe on Botasi Street in Exarchia.

On 26 April, a group of masked men attacked with batons 15 Turkish refugees including a female journalist, as well as a pregnant woman and children, who crossed the border to Greece near Soufli in Evros, and pushed them back to Turkey.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Greece (2019-) Units for the Reinstatement of Order
NOTES: On 29 August, two riot police officers stationed at the archaeological museum near Exarchia assaulted in a homophobic attack a gay couple, one of which is a well-known editor of an LGBT magazine. One of the police officers referred to the couple in a derisive way and when they confronted him, he hit them on the head and the other officer kicked them away at which point they reported the incident to the police and the case will be examined by a Public Prosecutor.

On 27 July 2020, early in the morning, a hooded assailant shot and injured in the neck and torso a journalist and publisher of a fringe newspaper outside his home in Vrilissia in Athens-North Athens, while he was parking his car. The shooter had two accomplices and they all fled the scene. The journalist was hospitalised in intensive care.

On 9 April 2021 a veteran crime reporter, was shot dead outside his home in Alimos, Athens - South Athens, by 2 attackers riding a small motorcycle with which they escaped. The attackers used a 9mm gun with a silencer and shot the journalist at least five times, first while still on the motorcycle and then closer for the final hit. According to police the execution-style killing of the journalist is linked to organized crime.
On 28 January 2018, two journalists were found dead in Mazatenango after being shot. The journalists were traveling for work and they disappeared on the 28.

On 1 February 2018, in Santo Domingo, Suchitepequez, two journalists were found dead. The bodies had the hands and legs tied, presented signs of violence and firearm injuries. A source claimed the journalists had recently received threatening phone calls from people attempting to extort him.

On 21 June 2018, an unidentified armed group assaulted a group of journalists that were preparing to cover a protest in zone 10 of Guatemala City. The group stole cellphones and the material that the journalists had recorded.

As reported on 21 June 2019, in Zona 3, Mazatenango town (Mazatenango, Suchitepequez, Suroccidente), 2 journalists were attacked by unidentified armed actors. As a result, 1 of them was shot dead and the other one was unharmed. It is unclear whether the motive behind the attack was their work as journalists or a robbery.
On 27 February 2020, in Chiquimula, Chiquimula, a journalist driving a motorcycle was shot by unidentified perpetrators driving a car. The victim was seriously injured and passed away on 4 March.
On 10 November 2020, in Puerto San Jose, Escuintla, a journalist was shot and injured. He died four days later in hospital. 1 fatality.

On 7 May 2021, in Puerto Barrios, Izabal, two armed men on a motorcycle shot and injured a journalist and radio announcer in a drive-by incident. The Police say that the event could be related to a robbery. However, media associations called for the protection of journalists in the country. 1 injured.

On 30 July 2021, in Concepcion Las Minas, Chiquimula, a journalist was shot and injured by an unknown number of armed men in Los Conacastes neighborhood. He was taken to hospital but died moments later. The journalist was the owner of a local news website. According to the report, the victim had received death threats in the past. 1 fatality.

ACTOR1: RPG: Rally of the Guinean People
NOTES: Six journalists from privately-owned Espace FM and Renaissance FM on August 27, 2012, were severely beaten by a group of men believed to be supporters of the ruling Peoples Rally of Guinea (RPG)

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Guinea (2010-2021) Presidential Security Unit
NOTES: Journalists covering an event for people with disabilities near the presidency. They were physically beaten by the Presidential Guard, and photos were confiscated.
Local media journalist Abdoulaye Oumou was assaulted by police forces while covering a civil society protest against insecurity
Local media journalist Ibrahima Sory Diallo was seriously assaulted by police forces while covering a protest in Cosa

SOURCE: Media Foundation for West Africa; Aminata
NOTES: Anti-riot police in Guinea beat up Thierno Amadou Camara, the managing editor of the guineematin website on July 31 during a congress organised by the opposition Unity and Progress Party (Parti de lUnite et du progress-PUP)

ACTOR1: UFDG: Union of Democratic Forces of Guinea
NOTES: Violent clashes erupted at the UFDG headquarters in Conakry between supporters of Bah Oury and those of Cellou Dalein Diallo as Bah was denied access to a political meeting. A journalist was shot in the clash; Cellou Daleins body guard succumbed of his wounds three months later.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Guinea (2010-2021) Presidential Security Unit
NOTES: Presidential guards arrested, beat and threatened a journalist covering a meeting of the ruling party attended by President Conde in Conakry as he refused to hand over his camera. The police refused to record his complaint.
A rumour about the death of President Alpha Conde has resulted in a violent clash between gendarmes and journalists. 12 journalists were injured, their equipment and objects damaged.

On 26 Nov 2018, armed men burst into the home of the publishing director of Guinea Times and Africa Times in Taouyah area of Ratoma Commune, Conakry. Several members of the journalists' family were wounded.
On 26 December 2018, a journalist accused of criticising Guinean executives was assaulted by an unidentified armed group in Bambeto district of Conakry (Conakry).

ACTOR1: RPG: Rally of the Guinean People
NOTES: On 19 February 2020, unidentified individuals suspected to be supporters of the RPG (ruling) party attacked the headquarters of a media group (radio, and television) in Kankan town (Kankan-Centre, Kankan). They broke doors and windows, and took away a lot of equipment. Some journalists were reportedly injured in the process.
On 4 May 2020, the Gendarmerie forces beat and injured a journalist in Nzerekore town (Nzerekore-Centre, Nzerekore), as he was reporting on a local market fire.

On 3 February 2021, about 10 security officers (assumed Police Forces) severely beat up and injured a journalist at the Court of First instance of Kindia town (Kindia-Centre, Kindia) as he was covering a scam trial.

On 11 August 2020, in Lusignan, Demerara-Mahaica, the house of a famous social media commentator and political analyst was the target of shootings perpetrated by unknown individuals while he was inside with friends. No fatalities.
On 10 March 2018, in Miragoane, Nippes, four off-duty police officers and a journalist were injured by gunmen while they were attending a funeral. No fatalities.
On 14 March 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a photojournalist was shot and killed by members of an armed group in the Grand Ravine neighbourhood. 1 fatality.
On 14 March 2018, a journalist disappeared after going to report in the neighborhood Martissant in Port-au-Prince, Haiti. That neighborhood has been affected by clash between gangs.

SOURCE: Alterpresse; Loop News Haiti; Le Nouvelliste
NOTES: On 28 April 2018, in Cap-Haitian (Nord), unidentified men launched a toxic gas, some reports say tear gas, at a restaurant during a conference delivered by Senators on the Petro Caribe corruption scandal. One journalist died of suffocation and another person was injured as the crowd panicked to exit the place.

On 20 August 2018, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, two journalists were attacked by the security guards of the parliament when they tried to film a tense scene between the guards and Police officers. The guards were locking themselves into the Parliament to avoid an arrest in relation to a grenade attack on the parliament earlier that day. One journalist was injured and the equipment of another one destroyed.

On 10 June 2019, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a journalist at a privately owned radio station was killed by unidentified armed men while driving to his home in Portail Leogane neighbourhood. The journalist had a daily program reporting on the PetroCaribe embezzlement scandal, a regional energy program subsidized by Venezuela. Authorities reported that the radio station's staff regularly received threatening phone calls over their coverage on a range of issues. 1 fatality.
On June 10, 2019, in Leogane, a journalist of RSF was killed by an unidentified armed group when driving home in his car. His father later stated it was a targeted attack.

On July 16, 2019, at Delmas 60, Port au Prince, a journalist traveling by car was attacked by gunmen on a motorbike, who tried to make him stop the car and fired gunshots at it. The man did not stop and was not hit by bullets; only his car was. He claims he was attacked because of his journalism work.

On 27 July 2019, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Haiti, a graphic reporter was beaten up and injured by the police after the officers crashed with the reporter's motorcycle. The journalist was beaten in the face and taken to the hospital. No fatality reported.
August 6, 2019, in Leogane, a journalist was attacked by unidentified armed people who shot at him while he was in his car close to his house. The man had reported phone threats in previous weeks.

On 4 September 2019, a radio journalist was assaulted by 5 suspected police officers in the Turgeau area of Port-au-Prince. The police officers were in a vehicle with no doors and no license plates. They also stole 3550 gourdes from the journalist. No fatalities were reported.

On September 16, 2019, in Jacmel, two journalists were attacked by a group of three people, one of them stabbed with a knife in the back, the other one hit in the face, as they were reporting on the fuel shortage protests.
On September 20, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, a journalist was shot and killed, and two others injured, by unidentified shooters who came out of a car, fired shots, and left.

On September 23, 2019, in Port-au-Prince, two men were shot and injured by a senator from the North outside the Parliament, during the tensions around the ratification of a new prime minister. Of the two injured, one was a journalist and the other a Parliament employee.

On 25 September 2019, in Petion-Ville, armed individuals tried to set the house of a journalist from Radio Tele Kiskeya on fire. The brother of the journalist was at home at the time of attack, but was unharmed. The vehicle bearing the logo of the radio was vandalised.

SOURCE: Loop News Haiti; Haiti Press Network
NOTES: On 10 October 2019, in Mirebalais, Centre, a journalist was shot and killed, and his body was found on the same day of the killing in his car with at least two bullet wounds. Two people were arrested as suspects in the killing. Allegedly, the arrested suspects had relations with a senator who ordered the killing of the journalist. 1 fatality.
On October 22, 2019, in Carrefour, a journalist known as an opponent to the present regime was attacked and beaten when leaving his home.

On November 1, 2019, in Nazon, Port-au-Prince, a journalist was attacked by three armed individuals as he was covering an antigovernment protest. They pointed a gun at him, beat him and broke his camera, phone, and microphone.

On 1 November 2019, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, armed men shot at a radio station. Near the place of the attack, police officers were trying to remove some barricades on the road to Delmas. The officers did not intervene. Neither fatalities nor injuries reported.
On November 6, 2019, in Petit-Goave, a journalist and voodoo priest was attacked, kidnapped, threatened and robbed by three men with pistols and machetes.
On November 9, 2019, in Meyotte, Petion-Ville, a journalist was killed, shot several times by unidentified individuals on a motorcycle.
On November 10, 2019, in Berquin, Miragoane, a journalist was hit in the head with a rock thrown at him when he was on his way home from covering an anti-government protest.

On 8 April 2020, outside of Saint-Marc, Artibonite, the host of a political radio show was attacked by armed persons who threw projectiles at him. The same radio personality was arrested last week and released shortly after.
On 28 April 2020, in Demas, Ouest department, a journalist was severely beaten by police officers. The officers in question claim that the journalist hit them first, something the journalist denies.

Around 6 May 2020 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, seven journalists were kidnapped by members of gangs in the southern part of the city where they were covering the gang violence events. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.
On 6 May 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest department, a journalist was shot and wounded trying to cover the gang violence in the southern parts of the city. 0 fatalities.

On 28 July 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a journalist was attacked by armed men. This attack took place after the leader of one of the main gangs of Haiti has gone on the radio to threaten journalists. The Association of Haitian Journalists raised the alarm over attacks conducted by gangs and targeting the press in Haiti. No fatalities reported.

On 27 August 2020, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, the host of a daily radio programme in Haiti was shot and killed by armed individuals traveling in a car without a license plate in a drive-by shooting. 1 fatality.
On 29 August 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a journalism student was shot dead in the Canape Vert neighbourhood. 1 fatality.

On 19 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a well known television host and actress was kidnapped by 8 hooded and armed men. The men demanded a 2 million USD ransom for her release. On 21 September she was released unharmed.

On 23 September 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several journalists who were covering the visit of the Minister of Public Works to a court were physically attacked by police officers and forced to erase footage from their memory cards. No fatalities.
On 28 December 2020, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified gunmen attacked a journalist and another person. The journalist was injured while the other person was killed. 1 fatality.

On 2 February 2021, in Arcahaie, Ouest, police officers attacked residents to prevent them from protesting. A store was set on fire by police officers, and a journalist was attacked. Police officers shot at his motorcycle which bears the logo of the radio station he works for. Police reportedly opened fire at breast height. No fatalities.
On 4 May 2021, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, gang member attempted to kill a Radio of Haiti journalist who was going to present an edition of radio news.
On 25 June 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a journalist was shot and injured, while going back home by a group of armed suspects. Motivations of the attack are not known.

SOURCE: Le Nouvelliste; Haiti Press Network; Alterpresse; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
NOTES: On 29 June 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed men arrived in Christ-Roi and Delmas 32 neighbourhoods and started shooting at the residents, killing 19 people, among them a journalist of the radio Vision 2000 and a political activist. According to police authorities, the killing is linked to the assassination of a police officer perpetrated by armed men a few hours earlier. The authorities claim that police officers affiliated with the Fantom 509 might be responsible for the killings. 19 fatalities.
On 21 July 2021, in Gros-Morne, Artibonite, unknown gang members kidnapped four people in Ti Bwadom, including a journalist. The victims were released 48-hours later in exchange for a ransom.

Around 22 August 2021 (weekend of), near Gros-Morne, Artibonite, alleged gang members kidnapped 30 people, including a journalist, in a bus crossing the Ti Bwadom area on its way to Port-de-Paix. At least six of the victims, including the journalist, were released after a ransom was paid. The whereabouts of the other victims are unknown.

On 14 September 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, an unknown number of armed men attacked the Haitian Parliament, causing panic among employees, visitors and journalists inside the building. The motivations and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. Bursts of automatic weapons were heard in the area, no further details of the attack were reported. The attack led to the suspension of the presentation of the president of the senate, who claims to be the rightful president of the country. Casualties unknown.

On 23 September 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, alleged gang members kidnapped a female journalist at Christophe Avenue. No further details about the kidnapping were reported. The victim was released 2 days later, after a ransom was paid.

On 27 November 2021, near Malpasse, Ouest, 400 Mawozo Gang members kidnapped a known former radio presenter at the Haitian-Dominican border. The victim was released 8 days later after a ransom (unspecified) was paid.
On 26 November 2018, police fired on a journalist who was covering a demonstration in Tegucigalpa against the re-election of the president.

On 17 March, in La Ceiba, Nacaome, Valle, armed men attacked a journalist. The man died in the attack. The victim recently had stopped receiving protection from the National Commissioner of Human Rights after considering that he was no longer at risk.

SOURCE: HRD Memorial; La Prensa (Honduras); Once Noticias; ProtectDefenders.eu
NOTES: On 6 July 2019, in Puerto Cortez Town (Puerto Cortez, Cortes), a journalist member of the LGBT community was shot and killed by unidentified armed actors. The motive and perpetrators behind the attack are still unknown.
On 6 August 2019, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, police agents attacked a cameraman of a TV channel who was covering a demonstration. The victim was injured and taken to a hospital.
On 25 August 2019, in Concepcion Sur, Santa Barbara, hooded men broke into a house and shot dead a Christian pastor, owner of a religious radio station.
On 31 August 2019, in La Entrada, Copan, a hitman shot dead a journalist.
On 26 September 2019, in Tegucigalpa, a journalist was attacked by an unidentified armed man who tried to kidnap her. The National High Commissioner for Human Rights condemned the attack.

SOURCE: La Prensa (Honduras); El Heraldo (Honduras); ProtectDefenders.eu; La Tribuna (Honduras)
NOTES: On 11 October 2019, in Copan Ruinas, Copan, unidentified men shot dead a TV presenter outside his house.

On 31 October 2019, in Puerto Lempira, Gracias a Dios, men driving a motorcycle shot dead a journalist and his wife. The journalist was also member of the LIBRE Party. A minor was injured in the attack.
On 21 November 2019, in Catacamas, Olancho, a journalist was found dead, with signs of abuse and a bullet injury in her head.
On 25 November 2019, in Puerto Cortez, Cortes, a journalist was shot dead after leaving Channel 12 facilities. Unidentified men shot him from a car and escaped.

On 1 July 2020, in La Ceiba, Atlantida, several B-18 members driving a car intercepted and shot dead a journalist and a camera man in El Naranjal neighbourhood. Five B-18 members were arrested hours later for the crime. 2 fatalities.
On 28 September 2020, in Comayagua municipality, a journalist was shot dead by two men driving a motorcycle in Mata de Cana community. 1 fatality.
On 19 December 2020, in Dulce Nombre de Culmi (Olancho), a journalist was shot and killed during a drive-by shooting conducted by unidentified men on a motorcycle. Motive and perpetrators unknown.

On 16 September 2021, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, a journalist was attacked by police forces whilst being arrested by the latter. According to sources, the journalist reported to the police the wrongdoing of another driver on his way to cover an event. Minutes later, officials arrested the journalist and started beating him up and casting slurs on him. The journalist was released nine hours later and called for authorities to investigate the case.

SOURCE: Front Line Defenders; Chandigarh Tribune; ProtectDefenders.eu
NOTES: On 13 February, a journalist with a Hindi daily newspaper was fatally shot by an unidentified gunmen in Inayatpur area (Sultanpur district, Uttar Pradesh).

SOURCE: Hindustan Times; Front Line Defenders; Indian Express; ProtectDefenders.eu
NOTES: On May 12, a journalist was shot dead by suspected members of the Maoist splinter group Tritiya-Sammelan Prastuti Committee (TPC) at Dewaria (Chatra, Jharkhand). The exact cause of the killing is not known.

SOURCE: Front Line Defenders; ProtectDefenders.eu; Hindustan Times
NOTES: On May 13, a senior journalist and Siwan bureau chief of Hindi daily Hindustan was shot dead by unidentified assailants at Siwan (Bihar), allegedly because of his critical reports on local politics and crime.
Journalists were attacked by police forces in Srinagar, for reporting on police brutality in the ongoing protests against militant Burhan Wani's killing.

SOURCE: Jammu Kashmir Coalition of Civil Society, Srinagar
NOTES: On August 17, a journalist Sumaiya Yousuf and 3 shopkeepers were beaten with sticks by a group of police on the Jawahar Nagar route in Srinagar district.
Security forces fired tear gas canisters into the residence of senior journalist Qayoom Zulfi in Syed Ali Akbar in Srinagar injuring his wife and his daughter.
Several photojournalists were thrashed by government forces on Saturday in Batamaloo area of Srinagar while they were on their way to perform their professional duties

SOURCE: Jammu Kashmir Coalition of Civil Society, Srinagar
NOTES: Two photojournalists were seriously wounded by pellets fired by government forces (assumed police) as they were covering protests in Rainawari area, Srinagar town on 4 Sept 2016.
A journalist with the Hindi newspaper Dainik Bhaskar was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Bihar's Rohtas in wee hours on Saturday. This is third such incident in four months.

Two journalists of TV channels were detained in illegal custody, stripped, and thrashed by police in Amarpatan for broadcasting news against police in Satna district. The police in question were later sacked following protests by other journalists and their kin.

A local journalist, Baljinder Singh Bobby, was beaten and threatened on gun point by a local leader of the ruling SAD during a public meeting on Sunday. The victim was attending meeting of the local people where a police team of Jandiala Guru was also present.

SOURCE: Jammu Kashmir Coalition of Civil Society, Srinagar
NOTES: Two photojournalists were assaulted by the police on 16 March 2017 at a pro-freedom press conference at Syed Ali Geelani's residence in Hyderpora area of Srinagar town.

Several journalists, reporters, and photographers, covering the Left Front's agitation on Monday suffered serious injuries after being beaten up by policemen and some had to be admitted to hospitals following tear gas shells thrown around them.
A journalist was injured in an attack by an unidentified group in Chak Ashraf on 4 July 2017.
On 13 July 2017, RJD leader's bodyguards assaulted journalists inquiring about corruption allegations against him in Patna town (Patna, Bihar).

SOURCE: Jammu Kashmir Coalition of Civil Society, Srinagar
NOTES: On August 6, a group of police officers assaulted a journalist at Watergam town (Baramulla, J&K) after they stopped him and found out who he was.

SOURCE: ProtectDefenders.eu; Front Line Defenders; Gulf News (UAE)
NOTES: On September 5, Gauri Lankesh, a prominent female Indian journalist was shot dead at close range by unidentified gunmen at her residence in Bengaluru city (Karnataka).
A journalist (Pankaj Mishra) was shot at by unknown assailants in Arwal district, Bihar on Wednesday evening.
Senior journalist KJ Singh was found with his throat slit, while his mother Gurcharan Kaur, was strangled. Their bodies were found at their residence in Mohali, Punjab, on 9/23.

Senior journalist Sajeev Gopalan who was allegedly manhandled by Kerala Police, alleged that the cops thrashed him for publishing a news article against them. Gopalan, a journalist representing the Kalakaumudi newspaper, was assaulted by the police on September 24 near Varkala in Kerala.

NOTES: A journalist was fatally shot by a guard of the commandant of a Tripura State Rifles battalion. The incident occurred on 21 November 2017 inside the Tripura State Rifles headquarters in Agartala.
A journalist was fatally shot by an unidentified group in Bilhaur on 30 November 2017.
On December 12, in Pettah, three journalists were injured as they were attacked by police personnel for trying to take pictures of local youth in the area.

On 25 March 2018, late at night, two local journalists were killed when an SUV rammed into their bike near Nahsi village in Bhojpur district (Bihar) (district hq Arrah coded). The family of the victim alleged it was a murder and that a former village head was behind it.
On March 26, a journalist was hit and killed by a truck on a road in Bhind district (MP). The victim had investigated the sand mafia in the area and had informed the police of a threat to his life.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
SOURCE: Jammu Kashmir Coalition of Civil Society, Srinagar
NOTES: On April 11, a journalist and a driver from Greater Kashmir newspaper were stopped, dragged out of their car and beaten by CRPF troopers in Srinagar city (J&K).
Journalists were held hostage by TMC supporters in Kolkata city, West Bengal, on 23 April.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
SOURCE: Jammu Kashmir Coalition of Civil Society, Srinagar
NOTES: On June 2, a journalist was stopped and beaten by CRPF troopers on his way back from work at Rainawari square in Srinagar city (J&K).
On 14 Jun, the editor of the Rising Kashmir newspaper, Shugaat Bukhari, was shot dead along with his two bodyguards by suspected LeT militants at the Press Colony in Srinagar city (J&K).
A journalist was critically injured on 18 June after being attacked by the petroleum mafia in Dharmanagar town, North Tripura, Tripura. The journalist had done several stories on oil theft.

SOURCE: Jammu Kashmir Coalition of Civil Society, Srinagar
NOTES: On July 23, a journalist covering an ongoing protest in Srinagar city (J&K) was beaten up by police.
On Jul 29, three crew members of a news channel were injured in an attack by a mining mafia in Amir Khas village (Fazilka, Punjab) after they tried to film the illegal activity.
On August 11, a journalist was assaulted by a security guard at AIIMS in Bhubaneswar city, Odisha, while covering a story related to the ceiling collapse at the medical institute on August 10.

On 13 August, private security forces employed by Bishop Mulakkal allegedly assaulted a group of journalists outside the Bishop's house in Jalandhar city (Jalandhar, Punjab). The journalists were reporting on the investigation into the bishop for allegedly repeatedly raping a nun.

On 18 August, a Times of India photographer was attacked by unknown individuals on motorbikes, on Naria Road in Lanka (Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh). The reason for the attack was unclear and the photographer was not injured.
On August 27, in Kanyakumari town (Kanyakumari, TN), unidentified actors attacked a group of journalists for unknown reasons, leaving them seriously injured.
On 11 Sep, two journalists were assaulted by unknown persons as they attempted to carry out their work in north Kashmir (J&K).

On 18 September, a journalist for a vernacular newspaper in Jalandhar was attacked by unknown individuals at a vegetable market (presumably) in Phagwara town (Kapurthala, Punjab), and severely injured.

SOURCE: Jammu Kashmir Coalition of Civil Society, Srinagar
NOTES: On September 19, police assaulted a journalist covering Muharram processions in Srinagar city (J&K).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
NOTES: On 12 Oct, two journalists we assaulted by CRPF troops in the Ashajipora area of Anantnag district town (J&K) when they attempted to report on clashes between rioters and security forces.
On October 13, in Mumbai-Gamdevi in Mumbai City (Mumbai-City, Maha), unidentified actors attacked a journalist outside of his home for unknown reasons, leaving him injured.
On October 13, in Mumbai city (Mumbai-City, Maha), four unidentified actors assaulted a journalist and his friend for unknown reasons, leaving them injured.

SOURCE: Jammu Kashmir Coalition of Civil Society, Srinagar
NOTES: On October 17, a journalist accused forces (assumed police and military) of firing at his house in the opposite direction of an ongoing encounter in Srinagar city (J&K). His wife and daughter escaped as bullets were piercing through windows and walls.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Special Operations Group
NOTES: On 17 Oct, SOG policemen assaulted more than a dozen journalists covering a clash between LeT militants and government forces in the Fateh Kadal area of Srinagar city (J&K).

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
NOTES: On 19 Oct, a joint police and CRPF detained and assaulted three journalists in the Nawab Bazar area of Srinagar city (J&K). The journalists had just returned from covering the site of a riot when the assault occurred.

On October 19, a reporter with a local vernacular daily was assaulted by a group of people near a social club at Belonia city (South Tripura district, Tripura). He received cut injuries on his face and above his left eye and was admitted to a local hospital.
On October 19, a journalist was assaulted by a local resident at Rajnagar-PR Bari area (South Tripura district, Tripura). The reason behind the attack is not mentioned.

On October 29, a journalist was abducted and beaten to death in Baltharwa forest under Simaria police station (Chatra district, Jharkhand), months after he lodged a complaint of a threat to his life. The journalist's father accused a member of the Tritya Prastuti Committee.

On December 1, a journalist was attacked with a sharp weapon by an illegal liquor trader and his associates at Sudarshanpur village (Bhadrak district, Odisha). The police had earlier arrested the trader on the basis of a news reported by the journalist in the newspaper. The victim was admitted to hospital with serious injuries.
On December 3, in Chennai city (Chennai, TN), DMK activists assaulted a journalist over a dispute.

SOURCE: Arunachal Times; ProtectDefenders.eu; Front Line Defenders
NOTES: On December 9, an Adivasi community reporter was shot dead in Doranda area in Ranchi city (Ranchi, Jharkhand). He was known for covering the Adivasi community's resistance against abuses and exploitation by the local authorities and businessmen. The Reporters without Borders (RSF) called for an independent investigation.

As reported on December 27, four journalists from the Zee Tripura, a local TV channel of the state, were assaulted by unidentified men in the Railway Station at Udaipur city (Gomati, Tripura). The reason behind the attack is not reported.

On 3 January, a Punjabi journalist was allegedly thrashed by Congress supporters in Khilchain village of Amritsar (Amritsar, Punjab). Several locals who came to assist the journalist were also beaten. The journalist claims the assault was over an article he had written profiling the winning panchayat candidate from the village.

On January 9, a man armed with an axe attacked the residence of a journalist twice and barged into his compound in Tinsukia city (Tinsukia, Assam), in an attempt to attack the journalist. He damaged doors and windows. The reason behind the attack was a news item published against the attacker's son. The journalist's wife and child were at the house, although no one was injured in the attack.

On January 16, a journalist from a Kokborok language base local TV channel was assaulted and beaten by BJP workers in Belonia area (South Tripura, Tripura). The journalist had raised topics against the BJP-IPFT government.
On 18 January, a journalist working for a daily newspaper in Lucknow was shot and left seriously wounded in Sultanpur town (Sultanpur, Uttar Pradesh). No further details.

On 18 January, at least 15 people attacked a local journalist on his way to work, at Khingra gate near Adda Hoshiarpur (Hoshiarpur, Punjab). The group attacked him with rods and knives, leaving him seriously injured. The man claims it was revenge/intimidation for his work on gangs and drug violence in the area.

On January 18, a journalist was shot at and injured by unknown armed men near Pakri Chowk under Siwaipatti Police Station area (Muzaffarpur, Bihar). He was sent to the local Primary Health Centre for treatment. The reason behind the attack is not reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of India (2014-) Rashtriya Rifles
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force; Police Forces of India (2014-) Special Operations Group
SOURCE: Jammu Kashmir Coalition of Civil Society, Srinagar
NOTES: On 22 Jan, four journalists were injured when state forces allegedly targeted them with pellet fire, despite identifying themselves as journalists near the site of a joint RR, CRPF and SOG CASO in the Heff Shirmal village area (Shopian, J&K).

On January 27, a journalist was attacked by suspected drug peddlers in Sepahijala district (Tripura). The journalist was attacked when he was tailing a vehicle which the men were driving, loaded with cannabis. They beat him up, confiscated his mobile phone and destroyed his camera.
On January 27, a journalist was attacked by suspected drug peddlers in the Sonamura tehsil area (Tripura). A group of men dressed up as security personnel blocked his vehicle and beat him up.

On January 30, a journalist of a vernacular daily was attacked by a group of men with a sharp weapon in Kendrapara district (Odisha), over coverage of kidnapping news. The victim sustained critical injuries and was admitted to Pattamundai Community Health Centre.

On 14 Feb, in Srivilliputtur town (Virudhunagar, TN), mediapersons were injured in an attack by police personnel as the former attempted to question a suspect of human trafficking (Nirmala Devi) after a court hearing.

On 14 Feb, in Mumbai city (Mumbai city, Maha), four unidentified men attacked a Hindustan Times photographer and The Hindu photographer (Satish Bate and Prashant Waydande) while the journalists were taking pictures of an art installation at Bandra Reclamation. The source did not mention the nature of injury.

On 27 Feb, two employees of Ranchi University assaulted two journalists who went to the campus in Ranchi city (Jharkhand) to cover students' unrest over regular delays in opening the examination department counter.

On March 15, a journalist went missing and his body was found the day after in Ahmedabad city (Gujarat). He had been investigating the use of government funds in his locality. The police are investigating whether it was a suicide or murder.

On March 21, a television journalist was attacked and stabbed by a businessman and his supporters in Guwahati city (Kamrup Metropolitan, Assam), following a dispute over a news coverage in the city on March 20. Four people were later arrested.

SOURCE: India Blooms News Service; United News of India
NOTES: On April 25, a journalist working with a local newspaper was attacked with sharp weapons by a group of BJP workers at Mukalmua area (Nalbari, Assam). He was seriously injured.

On 6 May, in Viluppuram (Viluppuram, TN), a TV journalist of a Tamil channel was assaulted by two constables after the journalist attempted to stop the two constables from beating up a customer of a hotel at Villupuram four junction over a dispute.

On May 19, BJP supporters staged a protest on NH31 in Madaripur village in Islampur area (Uttar Dinajpur, West Bengal), seeking security to cast their votes for the bypolls of the Parliamentary elections. After they lifted the protest, they were attacked by suspected TMC workers, who hurled crude bombs at the polling booth and highway. A group of journalists was also attacked (protest coded as a separate event).
As reported on 27 May, police assaulted a journalist in Srinagar city (J&K). No further information reported.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Government Railway Police
NOTES: On 11 June, several journalists were assaulted by members of the GRP in Shamli city (Uttar Pradesh). There were reports of a male reporter being stripped and urinated on; no reported injuries.

On 14 June, police assaulted four journalists and confiscated their cameras as they attempted to cover an encounter with militants in the Brobandha (Braw Bandina) area of Awantipora tehsil (Pulwama, J&K).
On 19 June, a journalist was burned to death near the city of Sagar (Sagar, Madhya Pradesh). His family said that an official of Janpad panchayat and his supporters killed him.

On 9 July, two journalists were assaulted by timber smugglers with sticks and axes at a timber shop in Mahidpur town (Ujjain district, Madhya Pradesh), while covering a state forest inspection. They were hospitalized with injuries.

On 19 July, a journalist was manhandled by police in Dhanupali area of Sambalpur city (Sambalpur, Odisha) while covering a protest of parents of convent school students against a recent child molestation case. The journalist allegedly misbehaved and police used force to remove him.

SOURCE: Press Trust of India; Times of India
NOTES: On 28 July, a journalist was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Pandaul (Madhubani, Bihar) on his way to Hati village. The reason behind the killing is under investigation; the major suspicion is 'old enmity' between the journalist and his attackers.
On 28 July, a television journalist was killed by unidentified people in a hit-and-run attack at Silchar town (Cachar district, Assam).

On 13 August, a reporter and a camera person were assaulted by an aide of the INC general secretary in Unbha village in Sonbhadra district (Uttar Pradesh) after they tried to get her comments on the removal of Article 370. No injuries were reported.

On 18 August, a Journalist and his brother were shot and killed by a group of persons believed to be their neighbours in the Madhavnagar area in Saharanpur city (Uttar Pradesh). The attack is believed to be connected to a dispute over littering garbage and cattle waste in the neighbourhood.
On 28 September, a man physically assaulted a female journalist during news coverage in Guwahati city (Kamrup Metropolitan district, Assam). Later, the man was arrested by Paltanbazar police.

On 28 September, a journalist was beaten up with canes by a masked men in Lahar (Bhind, Madhya Pradesh) in another suspected attack by the 'mining mafia' in the area. The journalist suspected the men were sent by a minister from the ruling party. A veado of the attack went viral.

On 4 October, a reporter and a cameraman of a news channel were abducted and assaulted by the younger brother of a local Bharatiya Janata Party leader and his associates at Kunvarsi village under Danta Taluka (Banas Kantha, Gujarat), when the journalists were reporting a scam run by the local BJP leader at government-aided ashram schools. The reporter was hospitalized with multiple injuries.

On 9 October, unidentified assailants armed with sharp weapons attacked a 'News Today' TV Channel Editor in Agartala city (West Tripura district, Tripura). The victim of attack was admitted to hospital with critical injuries.

On November 22, a senior journalist renowned for his reporting on environment and wildlife was allegedly assaulted on his way home in Guwahati city (Kamrup Metropolitan, Assam). He died of his injuries on December 9.
On 17 December, police attacked three journalists covering a demonstration at Hawal (Srinagar district, J&K).

ACTOR1: AIADMK: All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam
NOTES: On 3 March 2020, a journalist in Sivakasi town (Virdhunagar, TN) was attacked by two alleged AIADMK workers with an iron rod for writing an article about infighting in the AIADMK. [size=2]
On 23 Mar 2020, a journalist was stopped and beaten up by police in Indore city (Indore, Madhya Pradesh) during the coronavirus lockdown for an unknown reason. Three police officers were suspended.
On 25 Mar 2020, a journalist was beaten up by police officers in Thane district (Maharashtra), while reporting on lockdown in the district in response to the coronavirus.

On 25 Mar 2020, police officer beat a journalist in Kalimela town (Malkangiri, Odisha), covering voluntary distribution of masks to poor people during the coronavirus lockdown. The reason for the attack was unknown.

On 22 April 2020, a journalist of an Odia newspaper was beaten up by a police sub-inspector in Kendujhar town (Kendujhar, Odisha), while he was taking his sick child to a hospital and was stopped during the coronavirus lockdown.

On 27 April 2020, a journalist from Republic Studio and his wife were assaulted by unknown group in Mumbai city (Mumbai City, Maharashtra), while they were returning from work. The journalist said he was attacked by people hired by INC, as he had accused Congress Interim President of being silent on the mob lynching incident, which took place in Maharashtra's Palghar on 16 April. Two people were arrested, but their political affiliation has not been revealed.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: Around 29 April 2020, BSF personnel allegedly assaulted a correspondent of an Assamese daily while performing duty in an unspecified location in the State. The reason of the attack was not reported.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Government Railway Police
NOTES: On 8 May 2020, a journalist was assaulted by a Government Railway Police (GRP) official at a railway station in Dimapur city (Dimapur district, Nagaland) while returning home after covering an event in the ongoing lockdown amid coronavirus pandemic.

On 20 May 2020, a group of villagers, who were reportedly part of a night vigil group against the increasing number of theft in the region, attacked a journalist in Kozhikode city (Kozhikode, KL) who was returning home after work for reasons not clearly known. [size=no report]
On 20 July 2020, unidentified assailants shot and critically injured a journalist, in Ghaziabad (UP). The motive for the attack is being investigated. The journalist later died due to injuries.

On 22 July 2020, a group of seven men shot dead a journalist near Putri Khera village (Niwari district, MP) over a land dispute. The victim had posted a video on social media two months ago, anticipating a threat to his life and naming three men, who had allegedly threatened to kill him.
On 15 September 2020, a journalist was assaulted by Indian security forces at Marwak village in Pulwama district (J&K), while covering an ongoing gunfight at Marwal village in Pulwama district
On 19 September 2020, police allegedly assaulted a journalist at a police station in Srinagar city (J&K) over a story covering intimidation by cyber police.
On 11 October 2020, two people attacked a journalist, in Dhamnagar area of Bhadrak district (Odisha) for reasons unreported. 2 arrested.

On 11 November 2020, unidentified armed assailants allegedly attempted to kill a journalist in a hit-and-run case in Kakopathar (Assam). The journalist died the next morning. Two persons were arrested for interrogation.

On 10 December 2020, three journalists were assaulted by policemen at Sirigufwara city (Anantnag district, J&K) after interviewing a candidate while they were covering district development council elections.
On 25 December 2020, military personnel assaulted three journalists at a function in Baramulla city (J&K) over interviewing the chief guest of a function.
On 5 March 2021, police assaulted two journalists who were covering the demonstrations at Nowhatta town (Srinagar district, J&K).
On 10 May 2021, police assaulted a journalist in Srinagar city (J&K) while he was on duty amidst the coronavirus pandemic.

Around 19 May 2021 (as reported), assailants attacked a senior journalist in Tezpur (Sonitpur district, Assam) in which the journalist sustained serious head injuries. Reason behind the attack is not reported. Police arrested 1 person.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Home Guards
NOTES: On 19 May 2021, police personnel including Home Guards attacked and injured a fruit seller in Puri city (Odisha), while they were trying to shut down his stall which was opened in alleged violation of coronavirus protocols. Police also attacked and injured a journalist who tried to intervene.

Around 10 June 2021 (as reported), president of BJP Kisan Morcha Mandal physically assaulted and threatened with death a photo journalist in Santirbazar (South Tripura district, Tripura) when he reached the community hall to shoot the dilapidated condition of the Community Hall.

On 17 July 2021, an independent journalist and human rights activist was assaulted by police in the Anantnag district, while he was on the way to his home. The police allegedly targeted and beat him up while clearing routine traffic congestion in the district.
On 8 August 2021, a policeman and his brother attacked and killed a journalist in Nandyal town (Kurnool, AP) for writing about illegal activities of policemen in the district.
On 17 August 2021, police baton charged and assaulted several journalists during an ongoing Muharram procession in Srinagar city (J&K). Their equipment was left damaged in the act.
On Jan 25, a newspaper editor on Indonesia's Sumatra island was shot dead by unidentified armed men in Bandar Lampung, Lampung province. Reason for attack is unknown.

On 9 May 2015, the regent of Biak Numfor hit a journalist at the SKB Rigge Residential Estate in Biak city, Biak Numfor regency, Papua province, in anger over the journalist's article on a fire at the local market since it didn't sufficiently appreciate the local governments efforts to help the victims.

On 1 December 2015, five police officers ill-treated a Papuan journalist at the Heroes cemetery in Nabire city, Papua province, after he was approached for taking pictures of police officers who were conducting vehicle checks. They forced him to delete his pictures, kicked him from behind and escorted him out.

On 1 May 2016, a police officer struck a journalist that was taking pictures of KNPB members detained at the district police station in Fakfak city, West Papua province. They punched him on the chin because he was wearing a hat inside the station.
On 2 June 2016, members of the Islamic Defenders Front humiliated and intimidated a female journalist while she was covering an anti-communist symposium held in Jakarta city.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Indonesia (2014-) Mobile Brigade Corps
NOTES: On 1 July 2016, members of the Brimob maltreated a journalist in Sugapa city, Intan Jaya regency, Papua province, by punching him and threatening him at gunpoint after he was reported by civil servants for belligerency.

On 15 August 2016, two journalists in Sari Rejo subdistrict, Medan district, North Sumatra province, were injured during a land dispute between residents and the Indonesian Air Force. Soldiers beat them with logs, sticks, spears, and a long barrel as well as confiscated their cell phones, wallets, and a handy-cam.

Covering the Indonesia Open Badminton Tournament 2017, Ricky Prayoga, an Antara journalist, fell victim of a violence committed by some Indonesian Polices Mobile Brigade personnel at the Jakarta Convention Center in Jakarta on Sunday. The violence against Prayoga was recorded by a video, which later became viral in social media. From the video, Prayoga was seen dragged and smothered by some members of Mobile Brigade Police to a certain place, but he managed to release himself.

On 5 November 2017, a Papuan journalist while waiting for a friend was stopped by a military officer who accused him of being drug user in Wamena city, Jayawijaya regency, Papua province, and punched him repeatedly in the face.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Indonesia (2014-) Mobile Brigade Corps
NOTES: On 5 November 2017, a journalist was attacked by a military member in Jayapura city, Papua province, and another journalist was ill-treated by police officers.

On 11 November 2017, six police arrived at a known meeting spot for local Papuan journalists and approached one and brought him into a traffic control post in Mimika district, Papua province, where they repeatedly punched him to the head and upper body.
On November 22, police near Timika in Papua have charged eight officers from the Mimika District Police with torturing a journalist from online news site Okezone.
On March 29, 2018, an unidentified armed group assaulted and intimidated two journalists in Ambon city, Maluku province. The perpetrators are related to a governor candidate and his campaign team.

On 5 May 2018, during an organized political debate between politicians running for Deiyai Regency in Nabire city, Papua province, a man tried to access a front yard and was collectively beaten up by police officers. A Papuan journalist was then subsequently attacked and beaten to attempt to prevent him from covering the ill-treatment.

On August 3, 2018, a female journalist was assaulted when she was reporting on an event of Asian Games torch relay in Telanaipura district, Jambi city, Jambi province. She was suddenly hit on her chest by a security officer of the event. Another male journalist was pushed by another officer.

On February 21, 2019, an unidentified armed group assaulted and intimidated a few journalists at a mass prayer event in Malam Munajat 212 in Central Jakarta city, Jakarta province. The perpetrators deleted videos and photos from journalists' camera during the event coverage.
On Jan 20, 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked a journalist in Meulaboh district, West Aceh Regency, Aceh province. The attack is allegedly related to the journalist's reportage.

On 11 February 2021, an unidentified armed group, allegedly construction workers, attacked a group of residents, human rights activists, and journalists during an eviction process in the Tamansari sub-district, Bandung Wetan District, Bandung city (West Java province). The residents had resisted eviction since last year. The armed group brought weapons, including wooden sticks and crowbars. They destroyed the residents' garden and blockaded access to the neighborhood with iron sheets. An activist was pushed and kicked; his head was smashed against a wall and bled. Several perpetrators verbally harassed female residents and journalists. The attackers were allegedly hired by a construction company involved in a land dispute with the residents.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Indonesia (2014-); Private Security Forces (Indonesia)
NOTES: On 27 March 2021, Indonesian police, military, and private security forces allegedly assaulted a journalist in Surabaya city (East Java province). The victim was attending a wedding held by a corruption suspect at Samdura Bumimoro building, Krembangan district, when a group of bodyguards took him to be interrogated. He was hit and brought into a hotel for two hours for questioning.

On 19 June 2021, a bar owner and an accomplice shot dead a journalist who was driving on Huta 7, Pasar 3 Nagori, Karang Anyer sub-district, Gunung Maligas district (Simalungun Regency, North Sumatra). The perpetrator claimed the victim regularly asked for money and drugs as a bribe to not report drug circulation in the bar.

On 25 July 2021, a group of people, led by the owner of a sports center, threw acid at the editor-in-chief of an online media at Simpang Selayang on Jamin Ginting Road in Medan city (North Sumatra province). The victim reportedly blackmailed the perpetrator and asked for a monthly bribe. The victim sustained a serious injury.

SOURCE: Iraqi News; Press TV; Xinhua; Al Jazeera
NOTES: On January 12, unknown gunmen shot down a reporter (Saif Talal) and a cameraman (Hassan an-Anbaki) in Abu Saidia.
On 23 May 2016, IS executed an Iraqi journalist, 5 months after arresting him, and returned his corpse to his family in Mosul, Ninewa.
On 23 May, an Iraqi reporter was killed during the fightings with IS in Al-Karmah as he was covering the battle on the army side.
On June 9, an Iraqi war photographer was shot dead by a presumed Islamic State sniper while covering the battle of Falluja.
On 10 June 2016, an Iraqi war journalist working for Eda news agency, was killed presumably by IS during a battle near Fallujah.

On 14-July-2016 it was reported that an Iraqi photojournalist and correspondent were attacked by unidentified militants in al Qayyarah, Hatra, Ninewa province. The photojournalist was killed and the correspondent was wounded. The attack was blamed on Daesh but no group claimed responsibility.

On August 13, a Kurdish journalist Mr. Widad Hussein Ali was abducted by unknown armed people in Dohuk city. He was found on the side of the road hours later unconscious and later died as a result of injuries.
On August 14, it was reported that unknown gunmen had kidnapped a journalist in Dahuk, tortured, killed him and dumped him on the road between Dahuk and Sumel.

SOURCE: All Iraq News Agency; Al Maloomah
NOTES: On August 14, Islamic State militants presumably killed a photographer and wounded a correspondent who were covering Peshmerga operations along the Khazar axis.

On Oct 21, a Turkmen news broadcaster was killed by IS militants in Iraq's northern city of Kirkuk, while covering a string of recent attacks.
On Oct 22, Al-Sumaria satellite announced the death of one of its cameramen (Ali Resan) while covering Shura battles south of Mosul.
On Oct 22, a team of Anadolu Agency journalists covering the clashes in Kirkuk came under IS sniper fire but no injuries were reported.
On November 21st, 2016, 1 IS journalist was killed by the 8th Armored Infantry Regiment of 9th Armored Division in Mosul city, Ninewa. Total fatalities coded 1.

On December 12 2016, Islamic State militants executed Hashim Faris, a photojournalist, in central Mosul. 1 fatality reported.
Saturday 17th of Dec 2016, Unidentified gunmen beat a journalist, north of Baghdad, causing him injuries and bruises in the face and head.

SOURCE: National Iraqi News Agency; Radio Nawa; All Iraq News Agency; Al Maloomah
NOTES: On the 27th of December, an unidentified armed group of 15 member kidnapped a journalist from her house in Al Sayadia in south of Baghdad. No fatalities were reported.

A military photographer Hassan Naji al-Abidi who was accompanying Iraqi forces in operations to liberate Hadar city (Hatra) was killed by suspected Islamic State militants.
A cameraman for the channel Kurdistan was stabbed to death by group of five unknown assailants in a village in the Daquq district south of Kirkuk.

SOURCE: Al Sumaria TV; Al Baghdadia TV

27 March. Police officers assault and injured a journalist covering the attempted deportation of Miguna Miguna, a prominent ODM/NRM attorney and opposition activist. The assault took place at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport.

The personal assistant of Governor Okoth Obado has been arrested for allegdly orchestrating the kidnap and murder. Obado was himself charged with aiding and abetting the murder on September 24th.

SOURCE: Nairobi News; HRW; Washington Post; New York Times

Dozens of people were injured, including a journalist. A boda boda driver died from his injuries after police officers assaulted him following the start of coronavirus curfew.

On 28 March 2020, three police officers whipped women during the enforcement of coronavirus social distancing at the Mitunguu market in Imenti South (Central Imenti, Meru). A journalist who captured the event was also assaulted after refusing to delete the footage of the assaults.

On 13 April 2020, ten men, armed with crude weapons, stormed the house of a People Daily journalist in Tente, near Nyamira (West Mugirango, Nyamira). Neighbours alerted police, one suspect arrested after neighbours caught and assaulted him. Reports indicate the ambush was over a news story involving political figures.

On 18 August 2020, two online journalists were detained and attacked by police after they were reportedly lured to a hotel in Upper Hill, Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi). The journalists had been working on a report on alleged corruption at Kenya Rural Roads Authority (KURA) and were taken to four different police stations.

On 18 October 2020, an armed agent for the Tigania West MP agent (assumed police officer) attacked a royal media services journalist at Urru stadium in Tigania town (Tigania West, Meru). The Muuga FM reporter was beaten as he interviewed residents.
