On 28 April, armed militiamen kidnapped Mahmoud Al-Farjani, correspondent for Al-Arabiya, seizing him in the Saudi-owned networks office, which lies across the street from the Foreign Ministry.Al-Farjani was held for seven hours. His kidnappers beat him repeatedly and threatened to kill him. Before the kidnapping, the journalist had already received numerous threats arising from his work.

At the same time, an Iraqi journalist and a Turkish technician for the IHA Turkish network were taken by another armed group, apparently one not linked to the militia involved in the Al-Farjani kidnapping. The two were re-leased after several hours and were not mistreated.

Armed men stormed the main state-run al-Wataniya TV channel, forcing its employees out. Live shows were cancelled, and al-Wataniya was airing only archive video on Sunday. Similar to those outside the Foreign Ministry, the men were demanding the removal of Gadhafi-era officials from the station.
a presenter on the satellite TV station al-Hurra was shot yesterday. Three gunmen opened fire on his car, fatally wounding him with six shots, before fleeing.
A Brega-based journalist was shot in the hand on Saturday as he walked to a cashpoint outside the Commerce and Development Bank in Ajdabiya.

A Libyan journalist narrowly survived an assassination attempt in Benghazi on Monday. She told Libya Herald that she was driving in Sidi Khrebish when a motorist pulled up beside her and started shooting.

Two weeks ago, on 4 September, Al-Wataniya TV chief Tareq Al-Houni and two of his journalists were insulted and hit by members of a local militia who were supposed to be providing security at the TV stations headquarters in Tripoli during a visit by parliamentarian Mohamed Younes Al-Toumi. The militiamen insulted and attacked Toumi before turning on the three journalists.

A freelance journalist who works for the Shuruq Libya newspaper and the Tadamoun news agency, was abducted at a military checkpoint near Martyrs Square on 14 September. After being stopped at the checkpoint for an ID check and identifying himself as a journalist, he was taken to a secret prison and tortured for about 12 hours.

The Benghazi-based correspondent of privately-owned Al-Nabaa TV, was attacked yesterday morning while driving to Benghazi airport in the TV stations vehicle. Two men stopped him, insulted him and hit him with steel bars.

Taher al-Turki, the editor of Al-Rawasi, a newspaper based in the northwestern city of Zintan, was driving with his wife, daughter and brother from Swani to Zintan on 27 September when gunmen fired at his car, injuring him in the leg, and then kidnapped him. His brother, who sustained gunshot injuries, died after being taken to hospital.
Shots were repeatedly fired at Radio Zawiya, a radio station based in the northwestern city of Zawiya on 29 September, damaging the office of its manager, Amar Sultan, but causing no injuries.
Two journalists escaped an assassination attempt on Tuesday when gunmen opened fire on them from a speeding car.
Reporters Without Borders condemns the murder of the owner and manager of radio Tripoli FM , whose body was found in the east Tripoli suburb of Ghut Roman. He had been shot four times.
The six-year-old child of a Benghazi newspaper editor was kidnapped by four unidentified men, which came after threats to blackmail him.

SOURCE: Libya Herald; Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
NOTES: Three 'Fezzan' TV Channel crew were kidnapped and beaten whilst covering the events at Tamenhunt airbase.
A reporter for Fassania, a state-run newspaper was killed on January 19, 2014 in Sebha in southern Libya while covering deadly clashes in the south of the country.
The president of the Journalists Syndicate in Sabha, was assassinated.
A popular radio broadcaster, and former spokesman for the Benghazi Joint Security Room, survived an assassination attempt in Benghazi.
A cameraman from (state-owned) Al-Wataniya [Al-Wataniyah] TV channel was seriously injured yesterday whilst covering fighting in [the southeastern city of] Al-Kufrah.
On Tuesday, unidentified gunmen abducted a journalist for Tripoli-based channel Al-Assema, and held him for several hours.
Unconfirmed reports of an attack on Libya Awwalan [Libya First] channel workers in Benghazi.
On Sunday, five journalists from Libya Al-Wataniya, the state network in the southern city of Sabha, were abducted on their way from the Tripoli airport to the city.
Gunmen kidnapped a reporter for Libyas state media, but released him a day after in the latest attack on journalists in the North African country.
Three Libyan TV journalists went missing while travelling from Sabha to Tripoli.
The son of a Libyan doctor and journalist was assassinated after his father received death threats directed at him and his children.

When protesters stormed the General National Congress (the interim parliament) on 2 March, four protesters armed with knives kidnapped a satellite TV station Al-Nabaa reporter who had been there to cover a parliamentary session.

The same men who attacked Libyas official television station also stormed the Information Ministry demanding salaries and support for the station. The outlawed group attacked the headquarters with light and medium weapons and opened heavy gunfire in front of the ministry building. No reported casualties.
A journalist with two newspapers, Febrayir and Yefren Times, was abducted while on his way to Yefren on 6 March. He was stopped at a checkpoint 50 km south of Tripoli at Al-Azizia.
A photographer working for the Benghazi-based Libya First TV station, was injured in an attempted assassination in Benghazi.
A cameraman for Libyan Awalan channel received gunshot wounds to the leg
A Libyan poet was shot dead in Bengahzi, in on-going violence against media activists, politicians, artists and military officers.

The editor of the privately-owned Libyan newspaper Al-Watan, was kidnapped from outside his home in the Tripoli district of Salah Al-Din by an armed group on 26 March and was held for three days, during which he was mistreated and was subjected to torture, including electric shocks and whipping.

Libya al-Ahrar TV reported that its correspondent in Benghazi was targeted by an attempt on his life at the 'Gulf Company' intersection on the morning of 5 May. Unknown gunmen shot at him and then fled the scene, but he was unhurt, according to the report.
Gunmen in a car shot a newspaper editor dead as he got out of his own car in Istiqlal Street in Benghazi.

Authorities found the corpse of a prominent female journalist, in the southern city of Sabha. Her body was found together with her fiances in the cities northern Al-Hay Al-Jadida district. Her throat had been cut and she appeared to have been tortured.
Journalists were attacked while reporting on a car bomb explosion outside the headquarters of the constitution drafting commission in Al-Baydah.

SOURCE: Reporters Sans Frontieres; Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
NOTES: Unknown assailants abducted the crew of 'Al-Asima' Libyan channel on Friday evening 1st of August. They were believed to have been held at the Mitiga air base, controlled by Misrata-allied Islamist forces. They were understood to have been tortured and had their heads shaved by their abductors.

SOURCE: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information; CPJ
NOTES: Unknown people shot a man who works at 'Al-Asima' Libyan channel, in a failed attempt to assassinate him.
A five-member TV crew from Ajdabiya were kidnapped while returning from Tobruk. Ansar al-Sharia are suspected of being involved.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: Five staff members of the satellite station Barqa TV in Ajdabiya were abducted near Derna on their way back from covering an out-of-town story. The militiamen indicated they were members of the national army under Haftars command, however their identity cannot be confirmed.
Directors for the state-run Libya International Channel Television, were abducted on August 19 by an unknown militant group at a checkpoint in Janzur, west of Tripoli.
The Alassema TV station in Tripoli was attacked on August 23 by a group of militias under Libya Dawn. No reported casualties.

SOURCE: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
NOTES: On Sunday, August 24, the militias of Fajr Libya Group raided the headquarters of 'Alassema TV' in Tripoli, kidnapped its workers and damaged its contents.
Three journalists and media workers affiliated with Al-Asimah TV were abducted on Monday [25 August] from different locations around Tripoli and Benghazi.
Three journalists and media workers affiliated with Al-Asimah TV were abducted on Monday [25 August] from different locations around Tripoli and Benghazi.
Libya Dawn militias on August 25 raided a company because of its connection to Alassema TV, seizing two civilians who are both still missing.

Libya Dawn militiamen attacked the home of Alassema TV and the home of his brother, in Tripolis Gurji area on August 25. Militiamen beat the families housekeeper, fired shots in the house, broke into a safe, and took personal documents and photographs.
Two Tunisian journalists were abducted in Brega near Ajdabiya.
On 8 September 2014, two Tunisian journalists were abducted in Brega near Ajdabiya. Islamic State militants later claimed responsibility for their execution in a forest. They were buried in Derna.
A youth activist and blogger and his friend were killed when unidentified armed groups opened fire on them in Benghazi.

One of the founders of privately-owned satellite TV station Tuareg Tumsat, was killed on the road between Ghat and Obari, in southwestern Libya on 5 October. It is believed the attack was linked to his journalistic work.
An Al-Watan radio presenter was shot and killed in Benghazis Salmani district.

A TV presenter with Alassema TV station was reported to have been seized in Tripoli by an armed group dressed in military uniform and taken to an unknown destination. A poet was also reported to have been kidnapped but released several hours later.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Journalists (Libya); Health Workers (Libya)
NOTES: The local Red Crescent Secretary Nasir Muhammad Daw al-Alwani and a journalist were abducted in Tripoli.

A freelancer was abducted in Tripoli on 29 October 2014 by a militia affiliated to Fajr Libya on the grounds that he was said to have been a supporter of the former Gaddafi regime. It is reported that he is still held in Misrata.
A Libyan journalist was kidnapped by Ansar Al-Sharia , then killed by two bullets in the Sabri area of Benghazi.

The President at Tripoli University's College of Arts and Media was abducted in the morning but later released in the late evening. On the same day, the bodies of three killed by unknown perpetrators were found in Tripoli.
The Libyan branch of the Islamic State (IS) on Thursday claimed to have executed two Tunisian journalists who had been abducted in Ajdabiya.
In January, Islamic State militants in Libya killed two Tunisian journalists kidnapped last year. They were reportedly buried in Derna.

On February 24, 2015, the body of Intissar al-Hassaeri, a political activist and founding member of the sociocultural movement Tanweer (Enlightening) was found killed in the trunk of a car in Tripoli along with the body of a female relative. No investigation of the deaths was ever concluded, and there is no clarity about whether al-Hassaeri's killing was linked to her work as an activist
The Al-Wataniya TV and Radio stations in Sabha were attacked. No one was reported injured.
A Libyan television journalist involved in coverage of fighting between Islamist militias and pro-government forces in the second city of Benghazi was assassinated.
Five crew members from a private Libyan TV network were found dead near the city of Bayda after two members of the Islamic State (IS) were captured and confessed to the killings.
A young social media activist who was openly critical of Libya Dawn militias was found murdered in the Drebi district of Tripoli.
Islamic State gunmen seized a Sirte social media activist and executed him in public, leaving his body tied to the bottom of an advertising hoarding.
Two journalists were injured when a Libyan TV crew came under fire when they were reporting from the front line in Benghazi's Leithi district.

A senior executive at Sebha-based Fezzan TV is reported to have been kidnapped in the latest assault on the television station. He was released three days later but no details were given about the circumstances.
A journalist was kidnapped in Tripoli on 9 September.
A Libyan cameraman working for the Chinese newsagency Xinhua has disappeared and is feared to have been kidnapped. Neighbours reported seeing him being bundled into a black 4X4 vehicle.

A civil society activist and journalist as well as the manager of the Waddan hotel were kidnapped in Tripoli. The head of the organisation 'For the good we gathered' was seized in Dahra district just behind the Supreme Court while hotel manager Walid Tantush was seized when men stormed the hotel. It is not known who was responsible for the latest abductions although Rada ('deterrence') forces, under the control of Abdul Raouf Kara, are being accused.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: In January, a correspondent of the Libya HD television channel was kidnapped in Benghazi by LNA forces.

An Italian security guard assaulted two Libyan photojournalists at Mitiga airport on 9 March. The photographers from Reuters and AP news agencies had been on the tarmac to film the departure of an Italian transport aircraft bearing the bodies of the Italian oil workers killed last week in Sabratha.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: A widely-followed blogger and social activist disappeared from his Marj home along with two friends on 28 March. It is being claimed that the trio were seized by three armed men in military uniforms who drove them away in a black Chevrolet. At the time an army spokesman denied that the authorities had arrested the young men. It was suggested that they had travelled to Ajdabiya to be with Ibrahim Jadhran.

A Misratan journalist was kidnapped on his way to a press conference called by Faiez Serraj at Tripoli's Bu Sitta naval base. He was released a day later. The family reported that his car was later found abandoned near a base of a Haithem Tajouri's Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade. When relatives approached the brigade, they claimed they were told that the man had been released but then been picked up by militiamen belonging to Abdul Ghani Kikli (aka Ghneiwa). When this militia was in turn approached, this was reportedly denied.

A former TV presenter survived an attempted assassination in Beida on 16 April. The journalist, who had worked for Libya Awlan (Libya First) TV channel and is now working in radio, was hit by at least one bullet and is now in hospital.
23 June. A journalist was killed by Islamic State in Benghazi.

TV reporter Abdulgader Fassouk, was killed today while covering the fighting in Sirte. He was shot by an Islamic State (IS) sniper. He was the second Libyan journalist to killed in action in a month. Khaled Zintani, was shot dead, also by a sniper, exactly four weeks ago, while covering fighting in Bengahzi's Gwarsha district.
21 July. Islamic State combatants killed a news photographer in Sirte.
A photographer was abducted, allegedly by Rada (Deterrence) forces, while he was covering anti-Presidency Council demonstrations in Tripoli on 29 July.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Government of Libya (2016-2021) Government of National Accord
NOTES: An armed group linked to the GNA's Interior Ministry abducted Jabir Zain, a Tripoli-based human and civil rights activist and blogger, from a cafe in the capital, and subsequently forcibly disappeared him, on September 25, 2016. His whereabouts are unknown.

Three Iraqi Kurdish journalists travelling back from the front line at Sirte toward Misrata were kidnapped when their vehicle was intercepted. It is not known which militia grabbed them. They were released 30 hours later.
A television journalist was kidnapped in front of his Tripoli home on 5 February. The abductors told his wife that they wanted him for 'investigations'.

A 218 TV channel photographer was seized on 25 February and released a day later. It is reported that his capture was a 'misunderstanding'. His freedom said to have been secured by Hashem Bishr after he was allegedly taken by men loyal to Abu Sleem commander Abdul Ghani Ghneiwa.
Three reporters from 218 TV Channel were abducted on 17 March but were released a day later.
Misrata TV was attacked on 19 March by militants who threatened staff. The local radio station was also targeted.
Unknown gunmen kidnapped the head of the media unit in Ajdbiya. He was released some days later.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: On 13 November 2017: Libyan National Army affiliated fighters raided Libyan Al-Watan television station and seized equipment in Benghazi. They briefly detained and harmed two journalists as well. No casualties reported.
The Shura Council of Darna Mujahedeen kidnapped a sports journalist.

On 19 March, militiamen belonging to the Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade abducted the director of the former TV-channel Al Asimah, Jumaa al-Asti, and his brothers in the capital of Tripoli. His brothers were released three days later. He was released a week later.
On July 31, unknown gunmen shot dead a local journalists near his home in Sebha.
On March 30, unknown gunmen abducted a journalist in Tripoli.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: On May 2, LNA forces abducted two journalists between Aziziyah and Alasaba (coded as Alasaba at geoprecision 2).

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
NOTES: On October 9, two journalists were wounded after being targeted by LNA forces in Al Twaishah.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Libya (2014-) Internal Security Device
SOURCE: News24 (South Africa); Al Wasat (Libya); Ean Libya Limited
NOTES: On 14 December 2019, Libyan intelligence services reportedly abducted a Libyan journalist at the Mitiga Airport in Tripoli.

On 17 December 2019, an alleged smuggler abducted a journalist in Tobruk for covering his arrest while the journalist was embedded with a security patrol two years earlier, the journalist was subsequently released following negotiations between the families of the two.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Libya (2014-) Internal Security Device
NOTES: On 18 December 2019, security services abducted a female Sudanese journalist in downtown Tripoli and took her to an unknown destination, she was released on the outskirts of Tripoli seven hours after her family published the news about her abduction.
On 22 November 2021, an unidentified armed group stormed the offices of the Al Hayat newspaper and kidnapped a journalist in Benghazi (Benghazi, East).
Military forces reportedly assaulted a journalist attempting to cover their search of a politicians home.
18 May. 3 police officers attack journalists in Mahamasina of Antananarivo Renivohitra during a university basketball game.
On 28 February 2021, a fokonolona militia attacked and injured 2 journalists and some others in Milenaka (Toliara II, Atsimo Andrefana) after they refused to pay some fines imposed on them.
Heavily-armed soldiers raided the offices of an opposition newspaper the Daily Times, beating up staff and wrecking equipment in anger over a report about AIDS in the army
Young Democrats, UDF supporters, break into the Chronicles offices, abduct a reporter, assault staff
Reporter killed, unclear if linked to his profession or not. Ongoing attacks against journalists
Reporter abducted, editor-in-chief and staffers of The Chronicle assaulted
Photojournalist attacked
Daily Times reporter assaulted
Attempted attack on Home Affairs Minister Uladi Mussa, attackers injured police and reporter instead
Malawian police injure journalist trying to cover Madonnas visit
Police harass and chase journalist away from covering presidents visit

Police attack a photojournalist outside the National Assemble building in Lilongwe. The journalist was attacked as she was taking pictures of Consumer Association of Malawi Executive Director, John Kapito, after he presented a petition to the Speaker of Parliament.
In Nsanje, during a political rally, some Democratic Progressive (DPP) youth cadets assaulted Gaka Community Radio reporter.

On 22 January 2021, a group of at least 7 police officers attacked a journalist with pipes and sticks in Old Town, Lilongwe (Lilongwe, Central) when he asked to take photographs of the group enforcing coronavirus-related measures by assaulting civilians.

Journalist, Cheik Omar Konare, was attacked by a group who called themselves 'Adema Liberation Army' who kidnapped, gassed, and bound Konare. During the kidnapping, Konare was asked why he opposed the current regime. He survived the attack. Earlier in t

Soldiers displeased with the Tuareg rebellion in the north and how the Malian government is handling the situation fire their weapons into the air and storm the offices of a state broadcaster. The government sealed off the presidential palace in response, due to fears of a coup.

ACTOR1: MNLA: National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad
NOTES: A radio journalist was violently attacked and then arrested by MNLA agents following an unfavorable broadcast. Widespread looting reported throughout the town.

ACTOR1: MUJAO: Movement for Unity and Jihad in West Africa
NOTES: MUJAO rebels burst into a radio studio and allegedly took Mr. Akoumega, the editor outside the city to be subjected to severe torture.

ACTOR1: Mutiny of Military Forces of Mali (2002-2012)
NOTES: A journalist was abducted and severely beaten by members of the security forces.
Armed, masked assailants abducted and beat a veteran journalist in Mali on Thursday, leaving him with a broken hand and other injuries.

ACTOR1: MUJAO: Movement for Unity and Jihad in West Africa
NOTES: MUJAO rebels burst into a radio studio and allegedly took Mr. Akoumega, the editor outside the city to be subjected to severe torture.

ACTOR1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
NOTES: On 2 November 2013, AQIM militants abducted 2 French Radio France Internationale journalists in Kidal (Kidal, Kidal). The two journalists were killed about 10km from Kidal on the road towards Tin-Essako. The attack was claimed by AQIM.

SOURCE: RFI; Media Foundation for West Africa
NOTES: Malian blogger Madou Kante opposing constitutional reform was shot and wounded by unknown men while driving in Bamako on 25 July.

On June 3, Dozos (Dogon Amassagou) attacked a group of Fulani civilians travelling from Bankass toward Diankabou, one civilian was killed while two children of the group managed to escape and reach Bombou, ten others went missing, no news about their fate.
On November 29, a Malian army colonel and his guard corps assaulted a journalist and subjected him to torture-like methods in Bamako.

ACTOR1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
NOTES: On December 27, presumed Katiba Serma (JNIM) militants abducted a journalist between Nokara and Boni (coded as Nokara at geoprecision 2).

On 23 May 2020, a group of youths equipped with batons and machetes entered a local radio station in Gao (Gao) and assaulted and severely wounded a well-known local radio personality and his nephew. The incident is believed to be linked to a judicial dispute.
On 26 September 2020, Dozo militiamen abducted Hama Nialibouly, a municipal councilor and journalist from Douentza, in Mandio (Mopti, Mopti).

ACTOR1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
SOURCE: Studio Tamani; GardaWorld; Jeune Afrique; aBamako; RFI; AP
NOTES: On 8 April 2021, JNIM militants abducted a French journalist near the city of Gao (Gao, Gao).

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
NOTES: On 18 April 2021, presumed Katiba Serma (JNIM) militants abducted a local journalist in the town of Boni (Douentza, Mopti).
An attack carried out by unknown people, against Ahmedou Ould Wedia, the director of 'Assiraj' newspaper who is also the vice-chairman of the Mauritanian media owners association (RPM).
On October 8th, police forces beat and detained a photo journalist covering protests outside the parliament in Nouakchott.
On 6 January 2018, in Ciudad de Mexico-Coyoacan, Ciudad de Mexico, a journalist was shot and killed by an unidentified armed group.

On 13 January 2018, in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, an unidentified armed group attacked a journalist. The man died in the attack. According to reports, days before the attack the journalist had published articles denouncing attacks against freedom of expression. Six suspects were arrested for this case.

On 22 January 2018, in Ostula village near Aquila city (Michoacan), journalists that were in the caravan of the presidential candidate Marichuy were assaulted by an armed group, a militia set to fight organised crime in the area, that forced them to give all their equipment. No injuries were reported.

On 22 January 2018, a journalist disappeared in Matias Romero city (Oaxaca). His car was found abandoned. He had recently denied to declare in favour of some detainees in a case of arms seizure he had reported.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2012-2018) Federal Police
NOTES: On 29 January 2018, in Cancun, Quintana Roo, journalists claimed that federal police forces assaulted them in the city claiming that they had guns and because they had no helmets while riding motorcycles.

On 5 February 2018, in Acapulco, Guerrero state, a female satirist, blogger and journalist was shot dead by two assailants. It is believed that the Cartel Independiente de Acapulco is behind the attack.

On 15 February 2018, in Colonia Lomas La Amistad, Tijuana, Baja California, authorities found a dead body in an advanced state of decomposition, in a private residence. According to reports, the deceased is a journalist who, in the past, denounced corruption. 1 fatality.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
SOURCE: Riodoce; La Jornada; La Prensa de Monclova
NOTES: On 21 March 2018, in Gutierrez Zamora, State of Veracruz, a journalist was shot and killed by unidentified armed attackers in the Renacimiento neighborhood. Reports suggest that the journalist had previously received life threats for holding information against former authorities of the municipality of Tecolutla.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 21 March 2018, in Gutierrez Zamora, Veracruz state, a female journalist and editor was shot dead inside her home.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 22 March 2018, in Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz, a journalist was working at his second job selling tacos in front of his home in Colonia Renacimiento de Gutierrez Zamora when armed people shot at him from a motorcycle (drive-by). The journalist had received death threats before. 1 fatality.

On 5 April 2018, in Tijuana, Baja California, journalists that were covering the eviction of the Corona del Mar neighbourhood were beaten by Municipal police officers. One journalist was arrested during the attack.

On 5 April 2018, in Tijuana, Baja California, three journalists were assaulted by the police when they were documenting how nearly 60 municipal police officers armed with anti-riot equipment used excessive force against people who opposed an evacuation of land. Two journalists reported being beaten by the police.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 12 May 2018, two journalists were attacked with knives by an armed group who believed the journalists were about to cover their arrest in Las Choapas. They were rescued by local residents who spotted the attack.
On 15 May 2018, in Villahermosa, Tabasco, a journalist was shot and killed while driving his car in Rancheria Zapata. There is no information on the number of attackers. 1 fatality.
Around 24 May 2018 (as reported), Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, a journalist was killed and her body was found at her home. She was beaten and stabbed to death.
On 25 May 2018, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, a journalist was beaten to death in her house in Colonia del Paseo Residencial. 1 fatality.
On 29 May 2018, a journalist was beaten and threatened to death by two men in Chilapa de Alvarez. He was released later on.

Around 29 May 2018 (as reported), in Ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas, a 40-year-old journalist who covered political and criminal topics was killed and his body found after he had gone missing the night before. He had been beaten to death.

ADMIN2: Heroica Ciudad de Juchitan de Zaragoza
SOURCE: AFP; El Universal (Mexico); La Jornada; El Proceso
NOTES: On 2 June 2018 in Juchitan de Zaragoza, State of Oaxaca, three people were shot and killed by at least two armed attackers. The victims were a photo journalist, as well as a local council candidate for the coalition All for Mexico under PRI and her driver. 3 fatalities.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 4 June 2018, in Veracruz, Veracruz, a former sports journalist was shot and severely injured in a drive-by shooting by two armed men on a motorbike in the city centre.

Around 8 June 2018, a TV reporter was physically threatened by police forces in Tlaquepaque as he was filming a traffic accident. Police forces twisted his arm and put him on the ground; two other journalists suffered the same treatment as they were recording the same scene. No fatality or casualty reported.
On 23 June 2018, the police forces arbitrarily detained three journalists, hit them and took away their equipment in Ocampo as the journalists covered the mobilisation of police forces in the city.

On 25 June 2018, in Moroleon, Guanajuato state, armed men in a car attacked the director of the informative portal ''La Bandera Noticias'' in a drive-by shooting and left him injured with at least three impacts in Boulevard Torres Landa. No fatalities reported.
On 29 June 2018, in Felipe Carrillo Puerto, a 35-year-old journalist for an online journal (Playa News) was shot dead by an unknown individual.

On 1 July 2018, in Cosala, Sinaloa state, journalists from the Radio News ''Linea Directa'' were deprived of liberty for two hours and threatened by armed men as they were covering the programme for election day 2018. After two hours, more armed men arrived in several cars. The journalists were released and ordered not to come back in the area. No fatalities or injuries reported.
On 1 July 2018, a reporter for a digital magazine was shot to death in the community of Felipe Carrillo Puerto, Quintana Roo. The reporter was at a bar when he was attacked by an unknown suspect.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 3 July 2018, in Orizaba, Veracruz state, a journalist and human rights defender was victim of intimidating acts, arbitrary detention, threats and psychological torture by elements of the Orizaba municipal police. No fatalities or injuries reported.

On 8 July 2018, early morning, two journalists were beaten up by police officers in Mexico city while reporting on drug related arrests in a difficult neighborhood of Mexico city. A police commander was suspended.

On 8 July 2018, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, a journalist from Reforma newspaper and a woman were beaten in Colonia Doctores by police officers from the Security Secretary of Mexico City while he was trying to cover an event. No fatalities reported.

On 10 July 2018, in Iztapala, Ciudad de Mexico, an armed group attacked a journalist inside his house and set his residency on fire in Colonia Ejercito Constitucionalista. The journalist died in the attack.
Assumed on July 23, a journalist was found dead with weapon marks inside his house that had been set on fire in Iztapalapa town and colony in Mexico city.

SOURCE: Expansion; Front Line Defenders; El Universal (Mexico); AFP
NOTES: On 24 July 2018, in Playa del Carmen, the director of the digital site News Playa Playa del Carmen was executed at a hotel spa. He had been reporting news linking officials to organized crime.
On 24 July 2018, in Playa del Carmen, Quintana Roo state, a male journalist was shot dead in front of a bar.

Around 24 July 2018 (as reported), in Iztapalapa, Ciudad de Mexico, a journalist, announcer, and social activist was murdered and burned in his home. Two suspects entered his home to murder him by a blow to the head and afterwards set fire to his home.
On 5 August 2018, a photojournalist was executed while riding his motorcycle in Valle de Santiago town and municipality of Guanajuato state. Motive unknown.
On 5 August 2018, a photo-journalist was killed in Valle de Santiago, Guanajuato.
On 6 August 2018, in Valle de Santiago, Guanajuato, a photo journalist that worked for ''Dia Siete'' and ''Nuevo Milenio'' journal'' was shot dead. Motives of the attack and information unknown.

On 29 August 2018 in Cancun (State of Quintana Roo), a reporter and cameraman for Channel 10 was executed in Cancun town in Benito Juarez municipality of Quintana Roo state, along with a person accompanying him. 2 fatalities.

On 2 September 2018, police officers from Ciudad de Mexico entered a restaurant during a security operation taking out people, a journalist who was present rejected the actions of the police and for that reason, the police beat him and took him on the patrol. There was no report on injuries.
On 21 September 2018, in Yajalon, Chiapas, a male journalist was attacked by two armed men in front of his house and died of his wounds. He had received threats before.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Mexico (2012-2018) State Police
NOTES: On 2 October 2018, in Zamora de Hidalgo, Michoacan, the director of the news agency Alerta Michoacan was reportedly arrested and tortured by members of the state and municipal police.

On 3 October 2018, in Tuxtla Chico, Chiapas, a former journalist was killed. The State Prosecutor General's Office discarded the work he was carrying out as a motive for the crime and said he was investigated for his alleged participation in the murder of a member of the Mara Salvatrucha on 28 August.
On 3 October 2018, in Cacahoatan, Chiapas, a journalist and activist was shot to death by unknown attackers while eating together with his wife in a restaurant.
On 22 October 2018, in Los Mochis, Sinaloa, an unknown armed group kidnapped a journalist from the newspaper La Noticia, his son, and four other youths in Fraccionamiento Urbi Villa del Bosque.

SOURCE: La Prensa de Monclova; El Universal (Mexico)
NOTES: On 24 October 2018, in Puerto Marques, Guerrero, a journalist and another staff member from the Radio and Television of Guerrero were shot dead by unidentified armed actors. The motive and perpetrators behind the killing are unknown.

On 17 November 2018, in Tijuana, Baja California, a journalist was kidnapped in the Misiones del Pedregal neighbourhood by unknown perpetrators who forced him into a van. Motive unknown. No fatalities were reported.

SOURCE: Front Line Defenders; El Universal (Mexico); Xinhua
NOTES: On 21 September 2018, in Yajalon, Chiapas, members of a gang militia on board of a motorcycle attacked a journalist. The journalist died in the attack. The journalist had received death threats on previous occasions.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 23 November 2018, in Tepetzintla, Veracruz, armed people shot a journalist, wounding him. Motive unknown. No fatalities were reported.

On 1 December 2018, in Tepic municipality, Nayarit state, a male journalist was found killed on the Tepic-Pantanal highway. He was working on a report about the ties between drug cartels and politicians for the Orion Informativo news. The victim has also run for MORENA party in previous local elections.
Around 3 December 2018 (as reported), in Pantanal, Xalisco, Nayarit, a journalist was killed and his body was found bearing bullet injuries. Motives of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 4 December 2018, an armed group attacked a journalist in the neighborhood Jardines de Morelos in Ecatepec. The journalist who was working for the Periodico Morelos de Ecatepec died in the attack.

On 20 Jan 2019, in Santa Rosalia, Mulege, Baja California, an unidentified armed group attacked a journalist who was directing a community radio station Radio Kashanay. The man died in the attack. The victim had been threatened on previous occasions.

On 28 January 2019, in Ciudad Constitucion (Baja California Sur), a group of unidentified persons attacked a journalist with bats. The journalist is a critical voice against the elected mayor of Comondu and is under recovery. Perpetrators unknown.

On 29 January 2019 in Comondu (Baja California Sur), at the neighbourhood Centro, a journalist was attacked by men with baseball bats as he left his car to enter his residency. The journalist writes for a local newspaper which is critical towards the mayor of Comondu, who might be linked to the attack. He is now under recovery and perpetrators are unknown.

On 29th January 2019 in Ciudad Constitucion (Baja California Sur), a journalist was attacked and injured by two masked men with bats. The journalist is known for his political opposition to the municipality's mayor. Perpetrators unknown.

On 1 February 2019, in Santa Ana Ahuehuepan, Hidalgo, a male journalist was attacked, beaten and taken into interrogation for 30 minutes by about 10 assailants in 4 trucks. His head was covered with a bag and he was photographed as well as threatened with death. He was released, no report about injuries. His research was on fuel theft.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 8 February 2019 in Cordoba (State of Veracruz), armed attackers kidnapped a US male journalist alongside a Mexican woman who was later sexually abused by her kidnappers. The victims claimed that an organized crime group was behind the incidents. Additionally, other 12 people were allegedly kidnapped alongside the mentioned victims (10 women and 2 men). The two men were executed (tortured and burned to death), while the women were raped. 2 fatalities.

SOURCE: Yucatan a la Mano; Independiente de Hidalgo; La Jornada
NOTES: On 9 February 2019 in Emiliano Zapata (State of Tabasco), a radio journalist was shot and killed while he was having breakfast at the restaurant of a local hotel. One version claims he was shot by a single armed attacker while another version suggests he was shot by 3 unidentified armed attackers. 1 fatality.

On 10 February 2019 in Ciudad Nezahualcoyotl (State of Mexico), as journalists were covering a homicide incident in the area, police officials attacked them to interrupt their work. The policemen sprayed the reporters with pepper gas and also tried to destroy their equipment (cell phones). No fatalities, nor people injured were reported.

On 11 February 2019 in Chicomuselo (State of Chiapas), a radio broadcaster was attacked and shot at while he was at his car, and was taken to the hospital. He showed support to the rural and indigenous communities in Chiapas. No reports of fatalities. 0 fatalities.

On 16 February 2019 in Hermosillo (State of Sonora), two journalists were attacked at gunshot while they were driving, resulting in the fatality of one of them. The other journalist was injured. Recent reports suggest the motives and the identity of the perpetrators might be related to organized criminal groups.1 fatality.
On Feb 18th 2019, a local journalist was allegedly abducted and beaten by unidentified persons in Saltillo city (Coahuila de Zaragoza). He was found injured later in the same day.

SOURCE: El Universal (Mexico); El Economista; Metro Mx; Sin Embargo
NOTES: On 20 February 2019 in Amilcingo (State of Morelos), a social communicator and community leader, and journalist, was shot and killed near his house. Reports suggest that the killing might be related to the victim's opposition to an energy project (hydroelectric plant) taking place in that region. The gang militia _omando Tlahuica_left a message next to the body, claiming responsibility for the homicide. 1 fatality.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
NOTES: On 26 February 2019, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, a journalist was hit and detained by the Civil Guard, in an attempt to prevent him from taking pictures.
On March 15th, in San Luis Rio Colorado Tamaulipas, a journalist was murdered with a fire arm in front of his residence.
On 20 March 2019, in Salina Cruz (Oaxaca state), a journalist was attacked by an armed man on a motorcycle who shot him in the back and in the arm. He was taken to the hospital and survived.

On 24 March 2019, in the region of Evora (coded Guamuchil, Sinaloa), a sports journalist was shot dead by armed suspects. Neither the identity of the perpetrators nor the reasons behind the crime were reported. No arrests reported.

ADMIN2: Heroica Ciudad de Juchitan de Zaragoza
NOTES: On 2 May 2019, a man, in Heroica Ciudad de Juchitan de Zaragoza, Oaxaca, a teacher and journalist for the community radio El Cafetal de San Agustin Loxicha, was shot dead by unidentified armed actors. The motive and perpetrators behind the killing are still unknown.
On 16 May 2019, an armed group attacked a journalist in Playa del Carmen. The man died in the attack. The journalist had protection measures after he had reported threats against his life.
On 17 May 2019, a journalist was found dead in a hotel in Iztapalapa. The body present injuries in the head. The journalist covered sports news.

On 20 May 2019, the director of a digital media was arrested and beaten by police forces in Uman. Police forces tried to obtain information on two individuals who were previously arrested. Neither fatality nor injuries reported.
On 08 June 2019, in Ciudad Acuna, Coahuila, a journalist was beaten by three persons as he was covering events at a social security clinic. Neither fatality nor injury reported.
On 11 June 2019, in Huimanguillo, a journalist investigating crimes was killed at the door of her house. 1 fatality.

On 12 June 2019, in Coyoacan, Ciudad de Mexico, private security of the UNAM assaulted two journalists who tried to cover an incident where a student attempted to kill herself jumping from a window of the university building. Neither fatality nor injuries reported.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 12 June 2019, in Xalapa-Enriquez, a journalist was kidnapped and held in Boca del Rio by unidentified armed men. He was freed by the police a couple of days later.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 12 June 2019, in Boca del Rio, a journalist was kidnapped.
On 18 June 2019, in Ciudad Victoria, an attack was registered resulting in the injury of the head of the newspaper Expreso. No fatality, 1 injury.
On 27 June 2019, in Los Reyes, La Paz, Mexico, an unidentified armed group attacked a journalist. The man survived the attack.

On 10 July 2019, between Calexico and Mexicali, Baja California, a civil servant prevented the access of a journalist trying to investigate the work of the Federal Bridge. The journalist said he was hit and pushed.
On 16 July 2019, in Tijuana, Baja California, a security guard of Plaza Galerias used excessive force to prevent a journalist from covering a double homicide that took place in the mall.
On 21 July 2019, in Silao de la Victoria, Guanajuato, a journalist was beaten by a police officer who was forcing him to leave the Guanajuato Bicentenario Park. Neither fatality nor injury reported.
On 23 July 2019, in Marquelia, Guerrero, armed men riding a motorcycle attacked a journalist. The man was injured in the attack.

On 26 July 2019, in Colonia CNOP, Chilpancingo, Guerrero police officers attacked a group of journalists who were covering a murder that happened in that Colonia. Neither fatalities nor injuries reported.
On 30 July 2019, in Cuernavaca, Morelos, a journalist was found dead in the trunk of a car. The body bore signs of violence. 1 fatality.

On 31 July 2019, in Hidalgo del Parral, Chihuahua, armed men looted the offices of the newspaper Monitor de Parral, throwing Molotov cocktails and bombs. Three persons had to be rescued from the flame. Neither fatality nor injury reported.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
SOURCE: AFP; Animal Politico; Yucatan a la Mano
NOTES: On 2 August 2019, in Bocanita, Actopan, Veracruz, armed men attacked a journalist from the Grafico de Xalapa. The victim had received threats against his life in the past. The journalist died in the attack.
On 2 August 2019, in Zihuatanejo, Guerrero, armed men attacked a journalist who was also the director of Commercial Activities and Public Events of Zihuatanejo city hall. The man died in the attack.

On 24 August 2019, in Rincon de Ugarte, Tejupilco municipality, Mexico, a journalist was found dead with stab wounds near the Cerro de Cacalotepec. The journalist denounced days before having received death threats made by the mayor of Tejupilco. 1 fatality
On 29 August 2019, in Tlaxcala, armed men driving a vehicle shot at the house of the director of the newspaper La Prensa. Neither fatalities nor injuries reported.

On 07 September 2019, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, a journalist was forced off his motorbike and beaten by municipal and transit police forces in colonia Obrera. During his arrest, the police forces asked the journalist questions about his work and recorded him on a phone. When the journalist disclosed his profession he was beaten. Neither fatality nor injury reported.

On 11 September 2019, in the village Alfredo V Bonfil, on the road between Acapulco and Barra Vieja, armed men attacked a journalist who worked for Discovery Channel. The man died in the attack. According to police officers, the attack was related to an attempt of robbery, however, the Journalists Association said that it could be related to a direct attack against the victim.

On 04 October 2019, in Chihuahua, Chihuahua, four armed men entered a house located in Fraccionamiento Valle de los Olivos and shot while four journalists were interviewing an alleged drug-dealer. The interviewee died and a journalist was injured. 1 fatality, 1 injured

On 9 October 2019, in fraccionamiento Ciudad del Valle, Tepic, Nayarit, a man stabbed a journalist. The journalist was seriously injured. The victim, who is a lawyer and a journalist, had been attacked on previous occasions.

On 11 October 2019, in Apizaco, Tlaxcala, police officers attacked a journalist from La Prensa who was covering a security operation. The officers beat the journalist and took the phone with which he was recording the events.

On 23 November 2019, in Cancun, Quintana Roo, police officers arrested a journalist who was trying to cover an event where the officers were bribing a person. The journalist was tortured while he was detained.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
ADMIN2: Nanchital de Lazaro Cardenas del Rio
NOTES: On 23 November 2019, in Nanchital, Veracruz, a group of armed men kidnapped a journalist and another man. Both victims were released and rescued by the authorities hours after the kidnapping.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police
NOTES: On 04 December 2019, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, at least 3 ministerial police officer attacked 4 journalists who were covering a story and took away their equipment.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
NOTES: On 12 December 2019, in Ciudad del Carmen, Campeche, officers of the state police attacked a journalist who was covering an event. The journalist was injured after having been beaten.

SOURCE: El Proceso; La Voz de Michoacan; La Verdad
NOTES: On 20 December 2019, in Los Mochis, Sinaloa, two armed men attacked a journalist. The man was injured.

On 6 January 2020, on the road that connects Lucas to Huetamo, Michoacan, a journalist from 'La Ke Buena' radio station was found dead. The body presented firearm injuries. The victim was reported as disappeared.

On 9 January 2020, in Chimalhuacan, Mexico, police officers attacked two journalists who were covering a car accident. One of the journalists was injured after being beaten and the other one was arrested and the police tried to destroy his equipment.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
NOTES: On 20 January 2020, in Uruapan, Michoacan, state police officers attacked three journalists who were covering an armed clash. The officers beat and tortured the journalists and destroyed the recorded material. Two of the journalists were arrested.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard
NOTES: On 12 February 2020, in Cancun, Quintana Roo, National Guard officers attacked and destroyed the recorded material of two journalists who were covering an armed clash. The journalists were injured after having been beaten and detained for 40 minutes.
On 19 February 2020, in Ciudad Juarez, Chihuahua, a female journalist was shot dead in Colonia El Barreal. There is no information about the cause of death.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
NOTES: On 19 February 2020, in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, state police officers attacked a journalist who was covering a truck accident. The officers destroyed the recorded material of the journalist and arrested him.
On 25 February 2020, in Iguala, Guerrero, a radio journalist and his wife were found dead in his hose in Colonia El Paraiso. There is no information about the perpetrators.

On 29 February 2020, in San Jose del Cabo, Baja California Sur, armed men kidnapped a journalist who works for Sin Censura newspaper. During the time the journalist was detained the armed men beat him and recorded a video showing him saying to which media he worked for. The journalist managed to escape. According to reports, Sin Censura received threats in January and the administration of the newspaper demanded the journalist to avoid certain publications.
On 1 March 2020, in Morelia, Michoacan, a radio journalist was shot dead in Colonia Hermanos Lopez Rayon. There is no information about the perpetrators. Fatality 1.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 11 March 2020, in Veracruz, Veracruz, a female journalist was stabbed and injured. The events were reported by the Human Rights Commission and the perpetrator is reported to have threatened to kill the woman if she continued with her journalistic work.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 30 March 2020, in Papantla de Olarte, Veracruz, a female journalist was shot by at least two armed individuals in a drive-by incident. The woman died in the hospital from her injuries. 1 fatality

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 2 April 2020, in Veracruz, Veracruz, journalists that were covering an event in which a house was set on fire, were attacked by state police officers who physically assaulted them to prevent them from recording what was happening. The officers forced the journalists to leave with the threat of arresting them. Neither fatalities nor injuries reported.

On 8 April 2020, in Acapulco, Guerrero, a journalist who was the director of Punto x Punto Noticias was found dead in Colonia Ciudad Renacimiento. The victim was beheaded. The victim was reported as disappeared since 2 April. 1 fatality.

On 14 April 2020, in Iztapalapa, Ciudad de Mexico, police officers attacked a journalist from Notimex and another one of El Universal who were covering an event. After the attack, the officers arrested the journalists. Neither fatalities nor injuries reported.

On 11 May 2020, in Motul, Quintana Roo, a man called at the door of a journalist's house and attacked him beating him and threatening him to stay quiet and do not criticize the ones in power. The journalist who works for the journal De Peso had recently criticized the mayor of this municipality accusing him of corruption. The victim was injured. 1 injured.

Around 22 May 2020 (as reported), in Cuauhtemoc area of Mexico City, about a dozen undercover police officers beat and threatened reporters who recorded the arrest of five men in Colonia Transito. According to the report, the journalists were forced to erase the video.

On 27 May 2020, in Hermosillo, Sonora, a journalist was attacked when a molotov cocktail was thrown against his vehicle in fraccionamiento Albatorre. The victim survived the attack. The journalist is the owner of the digital newspaper Ciudad Obregon sin Censura and has been attacked on previous occasions. There is no information about the perpetrators.

On 5 June 2020, in San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi, police officers attacked a female journalist who as covering a protest. The officers violently took her phone with which she was recoding and threatened her.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Mexico); Former Police Forces of Mexico (2018-)
NOTES: On 11 June 2020, in Ciudad Obregon, Sonora, a male journalist and owner of the 'Prioridad Maxima' news portal was killed in Colonia El Campanario. Some reports indicate that he was stabbed and others that he was shot. The victim also was a former auxiliary police. 1 fatality
On 17 June 2020, in Cancun, Quintana Roo, a male journalist was shot dead in Supermanzana 259. 1 fatality
On 17 June 2020, in Matias Romero Avendano, Oaxaca, a journalist was shot and injured in a drive-by incident in Barrio Juarez Sur. He was also head of social communication at the Town Hall.

On 20 June 2020, in Benito Juarez municipality, Quintana Roo, police officers unlawfully detained a journalist from the newspaper Descontento Ciudadano. The journalist was beaten and threatened by the officers who also took away the journalist's panic button used as a protection mechanism. The journalist was released after having been injured.
On 13 July 2020, in Santo Domingo Tehuantepec, Oaxaca, a journalist was shot in Morro Mazatan neighborhood. There is no information about the perpetrators. The journalist was injured. 1 injured.

On 16 July 2020, in San Martin Texmelucan, Puebla, around eight police officers attacked a journalist from el Sol de Puebla, who was covering an eviction of vendors. The journalist was beaten and took to a police station where he was threatened. 1 injured.

On 17 July 2020, in Ecatepec de Morelos, Mexico, while recording the arrest of people for drinking in the street, a reporter from El Heraldo de Mexico was beaten and detained by municipal police in Colonia San Agustin. The journalist was released the same day and according to the report signed an agreement with the municipal government not to press charges for his assault.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
NOTES: On 6 August 2020, in Ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas, at least four state police officers attacked a journalist of Periodico el 5 who was recording a video of a car accident that involved a police officer who was off-duty. The state officers proceeded to beat the journalist, confiscated his phone, and arrested him. 1 injured.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 28 August 2020, in Papantla, Veracruz, state police officers arrested and proceeded to beat a journalist who was recording a security operation in Santa Cruz neighborhood. The journalist was injured.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: Around 9 September 2020 (as reported), in Motzorongo, Veracruz, a journalist was killed and his body was found beheaded near the train rails. 1 fatality.

On 15 September 2020, in Ciudad Acuna, Coahuila, around six police officers physically assaulted a female journalist who was covering the commemoration of Independence Day. The officers prevented her from accessing the area of the event and forced her to leave. Neither fatalities nor injuries reported.

On 16 September 2020, in Cancun, Quintana Roo, a group of police officers prevented a journalist from recording an event in which the officers were confiscating a vehicle. The officers broke the journalist's phone and detained and threatened him. Neither fatalities nor injuries reported.

SOURCE: AFN - Tijuana; Entorno Informativo; Zeta Tijuana
NOTES: On 4 October 2020, in Tijuana, Baja California, armed men attacked a journalist who ran a blog Tijuana Sin Censura. The victim who had criminal records after having been accused of extorting businessmen died. According to reports, he had reported previous threats against his life. 1 fatality.

On 28 October 2020, in Zacatecas, Zacatecas, an independent reporter was beaten by six municipal police officers after he tried to record on video the behaviour of some of the officers towards a neighbour. The officers took out their baton and broke his cell phone. Then he was beaten and sent to the municipal cells for two hours without an explanation.
On 29 October 2020, in Ciudad Juarez, Chihuahua, a journalist from Telediario in Multimedia Television was shot and killed inside his car in Colonia Hidalgo. 1 fatality.
On 2 November 2020, in Ciudad Obregon, Sonora, a journalist owner and director of ''Zarathustra Prensa'' and ''El Shock de la Not'' news was shot and killed in Colonia Los Amaneceres. 1 fatality.

SOURCE: Diario Contra Poder en Chiapas; Imagen del Golfo; Tabasco Hoy; El Siglo de Durango
NOTES: On 9 November 2020, in Salamanca, Guanajuato, a male journalist was shot dead in Colonia Villas Salamanca 400 by a pair of armed individuals that made him get out of the car he was in. The car had the logo of the news portal ''El Salamantino''. The journalist was covering the discovery of a dismembered body. 1 fatality.

SOURCE: Riodoce; Diario Contra Poder en Chiapas
NOTES: On 14 November 2020, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, a photojournalist from the newspaper Noroeste was kidnapped along with two other people from a house in Colonia Venustiano Carranza. The kidnappers gagged a woman inside the house from which the journalist was taken. All three people were found alive.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 18 November 2020, in Poza Rica de Hidalgo, Veracruz, a journalist was shot while driving by two armed men in Colonia las Valentinas. He was not injured and only his car was hit by bullets. No fatality reported.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 20 November 2020, in Poza Rica de Hidalgo, Veracruz, armed men on a motorcycle open fire against the facilities and vehicle of the media ''Presente de Poza Rica'' in Colonia Prensa Nacional. No fatalities or injuries were reported.

On 9 December 2020, in Jerez de Garcia Salinas, Zacatecas, a journalist was shot and killed by armed individuals after he took pictures of corpses lying on the street in Colonia Guadalupe who had been killed by the same individuals. 1 fatality.

On 27 December 2020, in Cancun, Quintana Roo, a journalist of the ''Descontento Ciudadano QR'' news portal was injured and arrested by at least two police officers after he was trying to cover a news of a possible abuse of authority in Colonia Villas Otoch Paraiso. The police officers threw him to the ground and stripped him of his phone while erasing the device's memory including the recording he had just made. Later, he was taken in the patrol and arrested. After a few hours, he was released but he was threatened.

Around 6 March 2021 (as reported), in Zaragoza, Coahuila, a broadcaster of a Christian radio station was killed and his body was found inside his house beheaded with a note by the side signed by the Cartel del Noreste (CDN) in Colonia Manantiales. 1 fatality.

On 21 March 2021, in Cancun, Quintana Roo, early morning, armed men shot at the facilities of the television station Televisa located inside a Mall on Bonampak Avenue. No fatalities or injuries occurred.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 31 March 2021, in Boca del Rio, Veracruz, a journalist was physically assaulted and threatened by a municipal police officer after he tried to cover the report of a car accident.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
NOTES: On 9 April 2021, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, a female journalist was physically assaulted, arrested and injured by the state police after she tried to covered a news report of a robbery in Colonia Santa Lucia. The state police took out her phone and threatened her to give them her password to see the pictures she took. She was handcuffed, arrested and was taken to the San Bernabe police station for 30- 40 minutes. Her colleague was also pushed and not allowed to record her arrest.

On 30 April 2021, in Encarnacion de Diaz, Jalisco, two journalists from Aguascalientes of the Infolinea de Fiesta Mexicana news channel were beaten up and threatened by three armed men while they were trying to report on armed attacks registered in the city. The perpetrators told them to go away, threatened them, took away their cell phones, and hit them with their weapons in the face, limbs and back. Both journalists were injured.

SOURCE: Hoy Tamaulipas; El Norte; Entorno Informativo; El Proceso; La Jornada
NOTES: Around 3 May 2021 (as reported), in Morelia, Sonora, a journalist of Noticias Xonoidag was killed and his body was found on the San Luis Rio Colorado-Sonoyta highway with a message by the side. He was reported missing since 2 May. His body was found on 3 May. 1 fatality.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 14 May 2021, in Cuitlahuac, Veracruz, armed men shot at the campaign house of the Podemos party in Colonia El Jovito. The media coordinator who is also a former journalist of Cordoba was shot and injured.

On 21 May 2021, in Penjamo, Guanajuato, a journalist was stabbed and injured by an armed individual. It is being investigated whether the attack is related to his journalistic activity on the Penjamo Biz 2.0 news site.

On 21 May 2021, in Ciudad de Apizaco, Tlaxcala, elements of the Special Operations Group (municipal police) detained, beat and threatened a journalist of the Notiredtlax portal after he was covering the arrest of some people aboard a vehicle. The journalist was detained for more than four hours and was released after paying a fine of 1240 pesos. The journalist was arrested without being informed and justifying the cause of the arrest.

On 25 May 2021, in Silao de la Victoria, Guanajuato, a journalist of 'Noticias Breves de Silao' was beaten up by two men. The perpetrators allegedly left a message stating that this was 'for being against the Morena party'. The perpetrators could be members of organized crime groups. No fatalities.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: PVEM: Ecologist Green Party of Mexico; Journalists (Mexico)
NOTES: On 1 June 2021, in Puruandiro, Michoacan, while returning from a rally, PVEM party supporters were shot at by two individuals on two motorcycles (drive-by incident). Journalists covering the rally were also attacked. No injuries nor fatalities occurred.

SOURCE: Riodoce; La Jornada; Tiempo; Tabasco Hoy; Quadratin Oaxaca
NOTES: On 16 June 2021, in Morro de Mazatan, Oaxaca, a journalist of the Policiaca del ISTMO portal was run over and then shot dead while being with his son. According to investigations, the attack was related to his journalistic work during the last elections. The victim suffered another attack in July 2020. 1 fatality.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Mexico); Taxi/Bus Drivers (Mexico); Former Government of Mexico (2018-)
NOTES: On 16 June 2021, in Metepec, Mexico, a journalist was shot dead in Barrio San Sebastian while commuting in a taxi. The victim worked as head of the Department of Social Communication in the Secretary of Security of the State of Mexico, as Coordinator of Social Communication in the Municipality of Tenango and as Head of Logistics in the Government of the State of Mexico. Some reports indicate that the attack may be related to an assault. 1 fatality.

SOURCE: Zeta Tijuana; Milenio; Borderland Beat; Hoy Tamaulipas; Colima Noticias; Riodoce
NOTES: Around 22 June 2021 (as reported), in Ciudad Acuna, Coahuila, a journalist was killed and his body was found inside the trunk of his car with several stab wounds. The journalist was part of Noticias en la Web and La Voz communication channel. Two people were arrested. 1 fatality.

SOURCE: Hoy Tamaulipas; Entorno Informativo; Tabasco Hoy
NOTES: On 19 July 2021, in Morelia, Michoacan, a journalist was killed in a drive-by shooting incident, outside a gym, in Madero avenue, in the Colonia Nueva Valladolid. According to the report, the journalist was in the gym's parking when an unknown number of armed men in a car opened fire and killed him. A bystander was shot and injured. Three men were arrested moments later. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

SOURCE: El Blog del Narco; El Norte; Hoy Tamaulipas; Entorno Informativo
NOTES: On 22 July 2021, in Heroica Guaymas, Sonora, a journalist who was the director of Info Guaymas was shot and killed in the parking lot of the mall Marsella. The victim had reported threats against his life. There is no information on the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
SOURCE: Sintesis; La Jornada; Imagen del Golfo; Zeta Tijuana
NOTES: On 19 August 2021, in Potrerillo Pueblo, Veracruz, a journalist and radio host was shot and killed while driving a vehicle labelled with the legend 'press' by armed men on boulevard Reforma. Around 13 November 2021 (as reported), three people were accused of participating in the killing. 1 fatality.

SOURCE: Entorno Informativo; Milenio; Diario de Morelos; El Siglo de Durango; Borderland Beat
NOTES: On 28 September 2021, in Cuernavaca, Morelos, a man was shot and killed while eating in a restaurant by two armed men around colonia Lomas de la Selva and colonia Patios de la Estacion. The victim was a journalist of the news 'Portal Morelos' and a candidate to mayor for Emiliano Zapata municipality of the recent created Citizen Welfare Party. 1 fatality.

On 14 October 2021, in Mexicali municipality, Baja California, allegedly a journalist was attacked, pushed and threatened by two men with a bat after he took pictures while covering a news report in La Puerta community. The men tried to take his camera.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 18 October 2021, in Rio Blanco, Veracruz, a former candidate for mayor of the Podemos party was kidnapped by armed men inside his house in Colonia Agraria. His body was found later in la Colonia Venustiano Carranza. The victim was also a former journalist of El Sol de Orizaba and Diario Imagen. 1 fatality.

SOURCE: Entorno Informativo; Sintesis; Tabasco Hoy; La Verdad; Diario Contra Poder en Chiapas; El Proceso; E-Consulta
NOTES: On 28 October 2021, in San Cristobal de las Casas, Chiapas, a journalist was shot and killed by an armed man outside his house in Colonia Las Rosas. During the last election on 6 June he was the representative of the Citizen Movement party before the municipal council of the Institute of Elections and Citizen Participation (IEPC). 1 fatality.

SOURCE: La Jornada; La Silla Rota; Imagen del Golfo; Hoy Tamaulipas; El Sol de Acapulco
NOTES: On 29 October 2021, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a journalist was kidnapped inside his house by armed men in Colonia Loma Bonita. He was later released and left at his house with gunshot wounds and injured. He died at the hospital on 31 October. 1 fatality.

On 4 November 2021, in Chivit, Chiapas, members of communal militias from Santa Martha, Chenalho attacked and shot residents and journalists while they were walking through the area to cover the mass displacement of communities due to continuous attacks perpetrated by this communal militia. The attack is related to a land dispute in which members of the Chenalho municipality claim to own lands that being used by residents of the Aldama municipality. There were no fatalities.

SOURCE: El Sol de Hidalgo; Milenio; News Hidalgo; Sintesis
NOTES: On 10 November 2021, in Tepeji del Rio de Ocampo, Hidalgo, unidentified armed men shot at the private vehicle and house of a female journalist in Colonia San Mateo. The journalist is the director of the a local media outlet. She was on her day off. There were no casualties. According to the source, a day before she received a threatening message by a criminal group on facebook after she published a journalistic note referring to the alleged cattle theft in which they were mentioned.

SOURCE: Jurnal; Moldova.org; Newsmaker.md; Ziarul de Garda
NOTES: As reported on March 5th, a two-person filming crew of JurnalTV was beaten by the guard of the businessman Iurie Luncasu while conducting an investigation in Chisinau.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Russia (2000-) Operational Group of Russian Forces in Moldova
NOTES: On 21 July 2020, two Moldovan journalists were assaulted by three Russian peacekeepers near Molovata Noua of the Dubasari district, after being refused the right to film and obliged to cross the Nistru river.
On May 8, 2018 in Montenegro's capital Podgorica an unknown attacker shot investigative reporter Olivera Lakic in her right leg in front of her home.
On June 5, 2018 in Niksic, Montenegro, journalist Gojko Jovanovic was assaulted by an unknown perpetrator, who has later been identified and arrested.
On June 6, 2018 in Niksic, Montenegro, journalist of the public broadcaster RTCG was assaulted by unidentified assailants.
On July 9, 2018 in Bela Crkva, Montenegro, journalist Stefan Cvetkovic was assaulted.
On 27 March 2021, a man assaulted, first verbally, then physically, the editor of the independent weekly magazine 'Monitor' in Podgorica, Montenegro. The man has since been arrested.

SOURCE: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
NOTES: Unknown attackers attacked a projects official in the Moroccan Association for Investigative Journalists (AMJI), while he was going out of a hotel in Rabat. He was immediately taken to the hospital.
Unknown gunmen killed a photojournalist for the state-run Maghreb Arabe Presse at his home in Temara. Police later arrested five suspects.

On 18 April, a journalist from Akhbar al-Youm, Fatima Zohra Rajmi, was hit and injured by a lawyer in the court of appeal in Casablanca while covering the trial of Taoufik Bouachrine, the director of Akhbar al Youm.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Morocco (1999-) Auxiliary Forces
NOTES: On 15 January 2019, a journalist was brutally assaulted by a member of the Auxiliary Forces in Casablanca while performing his professional duty of covering of the fire on a public transportation bus.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Morocco (1999-) Auxiliary Forces
NOTES: On 5 May 2020, an Auxiliary Force officer assaulted and harassed two journalists of the TV Channel Al Amazighiya during their coverage of the market opening in Tiflet (Khemissate), for not having an authorization.
Journalist attacked
Prominent journalist Carlos Cardoso gunned down
Journalist attacked
Victim was prominent writer Heliodoro Baptista
Ibraimo Assane, Mediafax correspondent for Angoche attacked
Radio Mozambique journalist Salvador Januario abducted and held for 3 hours
Victim was Damiao Trape, reporter with AIM
Violence against journalists
Victim was journalist Jeremias Langa, head of news at the private television station STV
Nacala Community Radio reporter attacked upon entering RENAMO HQ due to perceived anti-RENAMO bias
Journalist attacked
Members of Mozambiques main opposition party, the former rebel movement Renamo, on Wednesday beat up two journalists of Mozambican Television (TVM) in the northern city of Nampula.
Police assault a film crew from STV attempting to cover a demonstration in the Inhagoia neighbourhood of Maputo city

Residents wanted the military to leave their area. In response, the military fired shots in the air. Military beat up and detained two journalists who were going to investigate military abuse of one village near Matola.

On March 27, journalist Ericino de Salema was kidnapped in the centre of Maputo, tortured and beaten, before he was found again. His kidnapping came after he made comments against the president on national TV. Civil society harshly criticised the event.
Around Jan 25th (exact date not specified), the journalist Amede Aboubakar, jailed in the Mueda military base, was reportedly denied food, repeatedly beaten and made to sleep in handcuffs.
On Oct 17th 2019, in Quelimane, a journalist covering Mozambique's election was tortured and threatened with death by unknown people. No fatalities reported.
On December 31 2019, three armed men attempted to kidnap a journalist in Maputo (Kampfumu, Maputo City). The journalist managed to flee his aggressors thanks to street hawkers who were close by.

On or before 15 March 2020, a contributor of the Sekelekani media network and an associate of the land rights organization, CTV: Centro Terra Viva, was abducted by unknown people in Palma (Palma, Cabo Delgado).

On 11 April 2020, a journalist working for the Palma Community Radio was abducted by an unknown armed group in Palma (Palma, Cabo Delgado). Before his disappearance, the journalist sent a text to his colleagues saying, he was 'surrounded by soldiers.'

On 13 September 2020, a journalist was attacked by unidentified individuals in Nampula (Nampula, Nampula). The perpetrators took his camera, which was later left in a police station with pictures that showed suspected members of the Frelimo Party who infiltrated an event of the opposition party, Renamo, deleted.

On 13 September 2020, a journalist was kidnapped, tied-up, beaten and injured by unidentified individuals, and left in a beach in Maxixe (Cidade de Maxixe, Inhambane). The perpetrators stole his identity documents, two mobile phones and a tape recorder, and threatened him.

SOURCE: Lusa; AIM; BBC News; Carta de Mocambique
NOTES: On 31 October 2020, members of an Islamist Militia beheaded at least one man during an attack in Muambula (Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado). A community radio station was looted, with 9 journalists fleeing to the forest. According to sources, the group is controlling the village.

On 24 November 2020, 2 journalists were injured and their equipment damaged by unidentified individuals in Muatala neighborhood, Nampula (Nampula, Nampula). The motivation for the attack was unknown/not reported.

SOURCE: Club Mozambique; O Pais; Cabo Ligado; Mozambique Bulletin Subscribe; Twitter
NOTES: On 30 March 2021, members of an Islamist militia ambushed a convoy transporting journalists in Palma (Palma, Cabo Delgado). The group of journalists (local and international) were airlifted from Afungi to Palma to verify Government claims that the Mozambican Security Forces regained control. Journalists were taken back to Afungi. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

SOURCE: Twitter; Carta de Mocambique; VOA; Club Mozambique
NOTES: On 29 June 2021, a group of four journalists in Nampula (Nampula, Nampula) were beaten by police officers, as they tried to confirm rumors about an alleged illegal detention of three young people from 'Mentes Resilientes', a civil society organization. One journalist had his camera stolen.

On 27 July 2021, police officers in the district of Barue Manica [coded to Catandica (Barue, Manica)] attacked two journalists from Radio Catandica as they covered some sellers contesting the pressure and modality of those members who were charging them taxes. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
Men assault journalist who had written negative article concerning one of them

Police assaulted local journalist Santosh Subedi on 13 Feb for no apparent reason. Subedi was seriously injured and was taken to Ram Kumar Uma Prasad Memorial Hospital in Lahan. Subedi, who had gone to the main street in front of his house where a dispute was going on, was beaten by security personnel.

Media publisher Arun Singhaniya was murdered by an unidentified group in Janakpur on 1 March. The Terai Janatantrik Madhes Party, Janatantrik Terai Mukti Morcha, and the Terai Army are all claiming responsibility on the grounds that the chairman of Janakpur Today Publications was 'defaming the Madhes protest through his media'.

According to the Federation of Nepali Journalists, police arrested Manoj Ghartimagar, special correspondent of Janadisha Daily, at 10:30 on 6 May from his office in Kathmandu and took him with them. He was handed over to journalists after one hour of torture, which left him badly bruised all over.

Two unidentified men attacked journalists from Makalu Television Pabitra Pandey in Itahari after they were taking part in a convention of district reporters on 22 April. No other details were reported.
A journalist was attacked by a police officer outside the American Recreation Centre in Kathmandu city, Bagmati, Central, on 26 April.
2 journalists were injured during police intervention at a press meeting in Birganj, Narayani, Central, on 4 Dec. No other details were reported.

ACTOR1: NEFIN: Nepal Federation of Indigenous Nationalities
NOTES: The general strike called by Nepal Federation of Indigenous Nationalities (NEFIN) demanding the names and territory of the federal states in the new constitution crippled the life across the country. The bandh enforcers attacked over 30 reporters and journalists and their vehicles. Locals said that bandh enforcers also torched some 60 copies of Kantipur Daily and TKP in the capital area.

ACTOR1: NEFIN: Nepal Federation of Indigenous Nationalities
NOTES: Attacks on journalists and media houses continued on the second day of the three-day nationwide shutdown enforced by Indigenous Nationalities Joint Struggle Committee in different parts of the country. Irate shutdown enforcers attacked three journalists from Mountain Television and another of the Abhiyan Daily with iron rods while they were covering news at Gwarko Chowk in Lalitpur. One was seriously injured. Two other journalists reported being attacked by NEFIN activists in the district as well.
Activists of SSN attacked journalists at the office of Nepal Republic Media in Kathmandu city, Central, on 20 Dec. Police arrested some of the attackers.

On 1 March 2013, activists of the CPN-UML-aligned Youth Association Nepal (YAN) stormed the office of Adarsha Nepal, a local daily published from Pokhara city (Kaski), and assaulted journalists. They also burned several copies of the daily that carried a controversial front page story about a 'binge drinking' party that reportedly took place during the recent YAN convention.

Enforcers of a five-hour Valley bandh attacked journalist Lila Ghimire of Karobar Daily in Kathmandu on 14 March, who was taken to a hospital. Demonstrators also torched a car belonging to the Chhauni Museum on the charge of defying the strike. The bandh was called by the CPN-Maoist and 21 other opposition parties to protest the formation of the Chief Justice-led government.
A journalist was attacked in Banepa town, Central, for defying a CPN(M) bandh on September 15. Police arrested over 6 CPN(M) rioters.
In Bhojpur, journalists were beaten by the police while trying to capture the scene of a clash between security personnel and demonstrators during their protest on Tuesday.
The police manhandled journalist Jagat Rai in Birgunj on Monday [31 August] while he was covering the clash between the agitators and security personnel.
A journalist was injured in an assault by an unidentified group in Kalikot on 6 October 2017.
On 7 February 2018, police charged baton on a journalist in Pokhara city (Kaski district), while collecting the news in front of a campus. The journalist was injured in the attack.
On August 9, a group led by an inebriated construction entrepreneur attacked and injured two journalists in Chhamarke village, Parbat district, West. No specific reason for the assault was mentioned.
