On 9 Nov, in Rukum district (Rapti), cadres of the ruling NCP attacked a Nepal Press Union member and Nagarik daily journalist (Lokendra Khanal) with knives while he was on his way to a ceremony. The journalist suffered head injuries which needed stitches. The source did not mention the reason for the attack.
On December 13, police assaulted and arrested a female photojournalist from the President's office in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district, Bagmati), while she was capturing photos for the news.

On 10 May 2020, police assaulted and arrested a journalist in Birganj City (Parsa district). The eyewitness to the incident stated that the journalist was dragged to the police van because he parked his motorcycle in the pavement.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Nepal); FNJ: Federation of Nepali Journalists
NOTES: On 20 April 2021, police assaulted a journalist of FNJ Mahottari branch at the area police office in Gaushala municipality (Mahottari district), while the latter was collecting news regarding an altercation that had occurred between two groups within the premises of the area police office.

On 3 July 2021, police officers charged batons at a photo journalist in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district), while the latter was covering a report of a torch rally organized by the students of five-party alliance. The victim sustained injuries on his knee as a result of the assault.

On 18 August 2021, at night, 2 perpetrators threw several molotov cocktails inside the house of a well-known journalist in Groningen, who was at home at the time. The attackers were identified as activists against the coronavirus regulations.
On 24 November 2018, in Managua (Managua), a journalist was attacked and beaten by three police officers who forced him to hand his telephone to them.

Around 25 November 2018 (as reported), in La Paz de Carazo (Carazo), a journalist was stopped and attacked and beaten by police officers. He could escape with injuries. The attack was motivated by the journalist political leanings against the regime of President Ortega.

On 14 December 2018, nine policemen arrived armed with rifles to the offices of the Nicaraguan newspaper Confidential in Managua. They attacked the owner and other journalists. The police also occupied the offices of civil and human rights organizations whose legal registration had been withdrawn.

On 31 January 2019, in Managua, unidentified men threw a Molotov Cocktail to the car of the family of a journalist. The attackers left a threatening message against the journalist, who is working from the exile in Costa Rica.

On Mar 1, police officers entered and assault workers at a radio station located in Bluefields, in the Caribbean of Nicaragua, just as journalists discussed the situation of freedom of expression in Nicaragua.

On 15 September, in Camoapa (Boaco) a community radio station, Radio Camoapa, was attacked. The radio journalists are opposed to the regime of President Ortega and the act is allegedly based on political reasons. No fatalities nor injured reported and perpetrators are unknown.

On 16 September, in Camoapa (Boaco) a community radio station, Radio Camoapa, was attacked for the second day in a row. The radio journalists iare opposed to the regime of President Ortega and the act is allegedly based on political reasons. No fatalities nor injured, perpetrators unknown.

On 10 November 2019, in Managua, at the Metrocentro Mall, at least two journalists were reported to have suffered from violence by supporters of the Ortega regime, while they were reporting a protest that demanded the release of so-called political prisoners. [size=no report]

On 15 November 2019, in Matagalpa, unidentified armed men conducted a drive-by shooting against the television media Notima TV, in Matagalpa. The attack is linked to the dismantling of dissent and/or opposition in media by the regime of President Ortega and his supporters. No reports of persons injured.

On 5 December 2019 in Matagalpa (Matagalpa) reportedly a police officer attacked a journalist covering a trial on the murder of a United States' citizen killed in September 2019 in Matagalpa. The police officer broke the journalist's mobile phone. The media channel for which the journalist works for is known for its opposition to the regime of President Ortega, what might be linked to the attack.

On 23 January 2020 in Managua (Managua), a police officer attacked a journalist as he was covering an event at a hotel in Managua. The motive is linked to the journalist's opposition to President Ortega's regime.

On 3 March 2020, in Managua (Managua), at the Cathedral of Managua, an unidentified group of armed men attacked participants and the journalists at the funeral of the poet Ernesto Cardenal. At least seven journalists were attacked, according to multiple reports. Some of them also reported robberies by the attackers. Ernesto Cardenal opposed the Ortega regime, and many of his close friends are also known opposers to the regime. Perpetrators unknown.

On 6 March 2020, in San Juan de Nicaragua (Rio San Juan), an unidentified group of armed men attacked the participants in the urn burial of the poet Ernesto Cardenal. He and his circle of close friends opposed the Ortega regime. At the end of the ceremony, Ortega supporters attacked participants and journalists of the burial. Perpetrators unknown.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Nicaragua); UNAB: National Unit Blue and White
NOTES: On 11 October 2020, in Masaya (Masaya), pro-government militia attacked a journalist and a spokesperson for the UNAB: National Unit Blue and White.
On 13 December 2020, in Managua (Managua), police officers broke and entered the house of a journalist and opponent to the Ortega regime. They attacked and beat him. No reports of serious injuries.

On 26 December 2020, in Masaya (Managua), unidentified men on a motorcycle threw a bomb at the house of a journalist and political opponent to the regime of President Ortega. The opponent believes the attack was organized by the local chief of police, although he presented no evidence corroborating this hypothesis. No injuries reported.

On 6 January 2021, in Masaya, Masaya, a so-called parapolice officer stopped a journalist from Trinchera Online during a live transmission on school material prices and attacked and injured him with coups. The journalist was taken to a security center, where he was interrogated about his job as a journalist. The journalist has suffered multiple attacks for reporting on issues the government does not want coverage on, such as protests.

On 19 April 2021, in Bluefields, Bluefields, the director of the radio station 'La Costenisima' was physically assaulted and hit by police officers when she attempted to leave her home. At least one dozen police officers were stationed in front of the director's home. Colleagues arrived to pick the radio station director up for work and were forced to get out of the van. The van was seized by police officers. Dozens of members of the opposition and activists have denounced similar attacks prior to the third anniversary of the April 2018 protests.
Moshood Abiola a pro-democracy magazine editor has beaten and arrested by police in the Ikeja district of Lagos.
A Nigerian journalist was killed by armed robbers who raided his home in Lagos.
Abdul Rahma Maliki, a journalist with Kwara State Television, was beaten by a detachment of policemen while attempting to cover a student protest, reported an advocacy organiization for press freedom
Four journalists covering the pro and anti-Abacha rallies were severely beaten with horsewhips by policemen, reported IFEX an press advocacy organization
Abuse in custody of journalist Biodun Ogunleye, reports press advocacy group
Police assault a journalist , killing him (unintentionally), reported a press advocacy group
Four armed men attack the editor of 'The News'
State security services raid and attack news weekly
PDP faction members attack government and journalist offices
PDP faction members attack government and journalist offices
PDP faction members attack government and journalist offices
PDP faction members attack government and journalist offices
Security forces attack journalists at PDP meeting
Armed youths attack newspaper publisher
Prison Guards beat journalists covering prison riot
Prison Guards beat journalists covering trial
Islamic militants attack a private radio station.
A journalist for the Nasarawa State Broadcasting Service was killed by unknown assailants.
A reporter for the African Independent Television (AIT) network was murdered by a gang.
Two South African journalists employed with M-Net Super Sport and two Nigerians were kidnapped from their bus while en-route to Lagos. One victim was shot and wounded during the ordeal.
Christian youths attack and wound a Muslim journalist covering the mass burial of victims following religious strife.
A Muslim militant group kill two journalists working for the Christian magazine the Light Bearer.
Unknown gunmen break into the home of a journalist, killing him.
Gunmen shoot and kill yet another journalists, despite protests.
A television cameraman operating out of Cross River State is murdered by a group of unknown individuals.

Labour leaders in Adamawa State attacked the state-owned ABC Yola radio station, abducting a local presenter, Mallam Adamu Tanko popularly known as Katakore, over alleged inciting comments against labour unions.

Thugs loyal to the AC attacked journalists monitoring the progress of the state House of Assembly re-run election into 13 units of ward 7 in Oghede, Ovia North East constituency II of the state. The rampaging thugs numbering over 30 and led by the state chairman of the Committee on the Protection on Pipeline Protection and Vandalism, Osakpamwan Eriyo, had stormed the Primary School and venue of the rerun election considered as PDP stronghold.

Suspected 'political thugs' attacks a group of journalists travelling with Governor Gabriel Suswams (PDP) convoy along the Makurdi-Gbajimba State road, near Makurdi. A political oprative and a bus driver were hit with bullets. Though it is unclear if the shots were fatal, Chief Press Secretary to the Benue State Deputy Governor, Mr Ejembi Ogwuche was injured w a bullet lodged in his head, while two other bullets were lodged in his right hand; driver of the bus had four bullets lodged in his body. One of the bullets was confirmed lodged near his heart, under his left shoulder

Prior to national assembly elections, unknown assailants attacked Daily Trust correspondent Joseph Hir outside his home in Lafia, Nasarawa State. He previously had written an article criticizing politicians. The extent of the victims injuries are not known.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawati wal-Jihad
NOTES: Members of Boko Haram attack and kill a newspaper reporter, claiming full responsibility in the following days.
The body of a radio reporter is found under a bridge. Nothing of value was taken from him, leaving authorities to believe this was a targeted assassination due to his political views.
A television reporter shot and killed.
Three police guards assault an executive of a newspaper and his driver for unknown reasons.
Soldiers seized the cameras of two journalists covering a controversial story.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawati wal-Jihad
NOTES: Six journalists were attacked by unidentified assailants, believed to be Boko Haram while they were covering a local election.

A journalist with the newspaper Zion Nationale, was arrested by an officer of the State Security Service, for having exposed a case of corruption involving the ex wife of the former governor of Delta State. Upon his release from jail the reported has received death threats from unidentified callers.
Police and soldiers reportedly attack and beat journalists covering a presidential political event.
A journalist is kidnapped near his house and held for N10 million ransom, but escaped is captors a few days later.
Gunmen kidnap a journalist in the Delta region.
A journalists home is attacked after an unfavorable article is published. The assailants are unknown, but the victim is certain it was not Boko Haram.
Unidentified kidnappers abduct a journalist near his home.
During a protest of pensioners, members of Nigerian Immigration Services assaulted several journalists covering the protest.
Unknown men assaulted a journalist in the presence of police, who did nothing to help.
A gang known as the Area Boys attacks a journalist.
Six unidentified men attack journalists on a train.
A journalist for the Nigeria Guardian claims to have been attacked by police and security forces for taking photographs of a cabinet ministers car stuck in mud.
Unknown gunmen kidnap a journalists wife and two children at their home. It is unclear if the attack was motivated by ransom or politics.
Government House security attack a journalist outside the Akwa Ibom State House.
Assassins shoot and kill the Editor of a newspaper, Anambra News, Mr. IK Udendu for unknown reasons.
A group of journalists and PDP leaders are attacked by unknown persons at a party headquarters.
The body a journalist is discovered in Kwangila, Zaria. The events leading to her death are not known.
Seven officials of the Nigerian Immigration Services allegedly assault two journalists in at a wedding reception in Ilorn. Reasons for the attack are not known.

Suspected members of an unidentified APC faction attack a group of mainline APC residents and journalists in Leme, Abeokuta, Ogun State following a raid on a PDP party secretariat to stop a meeting of the members of the party's Harmonisation Committee scheduled to hold at the building. The raiders snatched cameras belonging to the correspondents of the Galaxy Television and MITV, Kunle Ojo and Taofeek Lawal, respectively. No reported causalities. Additionally, several cars at a dealer's shop near the APC state secretariat were vandalised.
A photojournalist with the News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) is shot by unknown gunmen in Abuja.

The Special Adviser on Media and Publicity to the Governor of Plateau State narrowly escaped death during the evening hours when unidentified gunmen in military uniform stormed his house while he was holding a meeting with a group of church elders. The motive for the attack is not known.
Unidentified persons attacked the editor and deputy editor of Newspoint Newspaper in Owerri. The reason for the attack is not known.

Armed gunmen attacked a boat conveying three Dutch nationals and Nigerian journalists attached to an international non-governmental organisation known as Hope For Niger Delta Campaign. The attackers were not identified. The incident occurred at 5pm on the Dodo River along the Letugbene axis of the Ekeremor council as they were returning to Warri in Delta State from Amatu on the Atlantic fringe after they were conducted round a hospital. The reason for the attack is not known. Several days later the captors released their Nigerian prisoners, while keeping the Dutch, who were themselves later released. It is believed the Dutch are oil employees.
A journalist is abducted in Abia State, location unknown. The man was later released.
The bureau chief of several national newspapers is assaulted by PDP youths while taking photographs of a rally in support of Governor Oshiomhole (PDP).

Unidentified gunmen bomb a FM radio station the evening of 27/04 in Okene, killing no fewer than five people. The gunmen gained entry into the station through the hilly rear, gunned down the two security men before throwing an explosive into the building housing the station.
While covering a clash between police and Okada riders in suburban Lagos a reporter is assaulted by police.
Journalists narrowly escape a deadly attack by 'political youths' during ward elections in the area. Extent of injuries not known.

An unidentified armed group attacked the campaign office of Senator Shehu Sani (APC) representing Kaduna Central Senatorial District and attacked members of the Senators social media team. The attack may have been related to APC infighting.
Soldiers assault newspapers sales reps, arrest 2 vendors in Aba over the sale of pro-Biafra newspapers.
A journalist is killed in Yenagoa by suspected hired assassins on 16/04, reasons unknown.
Unidentified gunmen assassinated a journalist at his home in Yenagoa.

In Kaduna, 'armed thugs' wounded two journalists and held the representatives of the central and northern senatorial districts of the state, Shehu Sani, Suleiman Hunkuyi (APC) and others hostage. The APC blamed 'disgruntled elements within the party' for the violence, citing past instance in Yola (no date provided).

Soldiers invaded the Secretariat of the Abia State Council of Nigerian Union of Journalists at No. 1 Aba Road Umuahia and assaulted some journalists over articles written critical of the military. The soldiers held the journalists hostage for 10 minutes.
A cameraman with the Anambra Broadcasting Service (ABS), Mr Ikechukwu Onubogu, has been found dead four days after he was declared missing. The date of death and perpetrators not known.
A journalist is shot and killed by unknown assailants 'at the weekend' while on a hunting expedition in Ekiti East LGA.
Four unidentified perpetrators attack and injured a journalist working for the Sun Newspaper. The attempted assassination occurred in the victim's residence.

About seven officers attached to the Imo State Anti-Robbery Squad (SARS) in Aba, Abia State were violent towards the Abia State correspondent of The Nation Newspapers, Sunny Nwankwo, tearing his cloth and injuring him. The incident happened in front of the Aba Area Command Headquarters. SARS personnel attacked him with their AK-47 rifles, machetes and other weapons. The reason for the attack is not known. One suggests the officers may have been inebriated.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: FRSC: Federal Road Safety Commission; Journalists (Nigeria)
NOTES: An official of the Federal Road Safety Corps, FRSC, was killed when suspected kidnappers abducted the wife and child of a reporter with the Voice of America, VOA.
16 July. Suspected armed 'thugs' attacked a group of journalists covering an APC press conference. The secretary of the Nigeria Union of Journalists was 'terribly beaten.'

ACTOR1: NSCDC: Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps
NOTES: 14 December. Members of the Civil Defense Corps beat up two journalists who were at the pension bureau in Lafia for an investigation. The attack was ordered by the Information Officer at the bureau against one of the journalist and when the second journalist attempted to intervene he was assaulted as well.
22 January. Unknown gunmen killed a journalist of Radio Nigeria in Gwagwalada
04 February (or around). A photojournalist was assaulted and robbed in Benin City
28 February. Police disrupted a press conference in Lagos and fired warning shots to disperse the journalists
09 March. Journalists were attacked, injured and robbed by unknown actors at Zonkwa.
On 23 March 2019, unidentified gunmen assaulted observers and journalists at polling unit in Kano.
02 November 2019. Unidentified gunmen killed a radio journalist and another civilian in Makurdi.
On 16 November 2019, unidentified gunmen attacked journalists covering the election process and stole ballot boxes in Ajatechi in Dekina LGA (no location found, coded as Dekina).
On 16 November 2019, unidentified actors attacked a polling unit in Anyigba and threw stones at journalists. A group of suspected attackers in fake police uniforms were later arrested by SARS forces.
On 14 January 2020, unidentified gunmen abducted and killed a radio journalist in Yola.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Nigeria); NUJ: Nigerian Union of Journalists
NOTES: On 1 April 2020, a journalist (and Delta State NUJ chairperson) was beaten by members of the State Task Force while monitoring the coronavirus lockdown in Asaba (Oshimili South LGA, Delta).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Nigeria (2015-) Special Anti-Robbery Squad
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Nigeria); NUJ: Nigerian Union of Journalists
NOTES: On 2 April 2020, a unit of Police SARS stormed the Adamawa State secretariat of NUJ in Yola (Yola North, Adamawa) and beat journalists at the facility for allegedly breaching the coronavirus lockdown. The journalists were arrested and later released.
On 14 April 2020 (or around), a journalist was beaten by police officers in Umuahia (Umuahia North LGA, Abia) for filming police operations related to coronavirus restrictions.

SOURCE: Premium Times (Nigeria); Vanguard (Nigeria); Daily Independent (Nigeria); Nigeria Punch; Sun (Nigeria); Daily Post (Nigeria)
NOTES: On 4 May 2020, unidentified gunmen abducted a radio journalist in Umuahia (Umuahia North LGA, Abia). She was released later that week.
On 9 May 2020, unidentified gunmen abducted a blogger from his home in Yenagoa (Yenagoa LGA, Bayelsa).

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Nigeria); NTA: Nigerian Television Authority; Women (Nigeria)
SOURCE: Sun (Nigeria); Daily Post (Nigeria); Premium Times (Nigeria); Daily Independent (Nigeria); New Telegraph
NOTES: On 27 May 2020, unidentified gunmen abducted an assistant manager of the Nigeria Television Authority in Aba (Aba South LGA, Abia). She was later released.
On 28 May 2020, suspected APC militias beat up a journalist at the APC office in Owerri (Owerri LGA, Imo).
On 30 May 2020, unidentified gunmen abducted a journalist from his home in Awba-Ofemili in Awka North LGA (Anambra).
On 16 June 2020, suspected PDP militias beat up a journalist at the Assembly building in Owerri (Owerri LGA, Imo).

SOURCE: Daily Post (Nigeria); Premium Times (Nigeria); HumAngle; Daily Leadership (Nigeria); Nigeria Punch; Sun (Nigeria); Sahara Reporters
NOTES: On 3 August 2020, suspected Nasarawa communal militias attacked villagers in Washo village in Nasarawa-Eggon LGA (Nasarawa-Eggon, Nasarawa), killing a journalist. Conflicting reports suggest a potential second fatality.

On 3 August 2020, policemen attached to the Osun State Joint Task Force attacked and beat residents, including one journalist, around the Old Garage area in Osogbo LGA (Osogbo, Osun) while enforcing coronavirus policies. Injuries reported.

On 5 September 2020, policemen attacked PDP delegates and journalists with tear gas and fired shots at the PDP Cross River North Senatorial By-election primaries in Ogoja (Ogoja LGA, Cross River). Two reported injuries.

On 11 October 2020, Nigerian police attacked and injured a journalist covering the #EndSARS protest in Abuja (Abuja Municipal LGA, FCT) over interviews conducted on the reaction of Nigerians on the disbandment of the Special Anti Robbery Squad.

ACTOR1: NSCDC: Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps
NOTES: On 17 October 2020, Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps with personnel of the Port Harcourt Electricity Distribution Company assaulted a Punch Newspaper Journalist at his residence in Uyo (Uyo LGA, Akwa Ibom) over the non-payment of a bribe, inflicting serious injuries on the victim.

On 22 October 2020, policemen attacked and injured a journalist in Warri (Warri South LGA, Delta) over the coverage of the #EndSARS protest. Police operatives additionally vandalized the journalist's vehicle.

On 23 October 2020, Nigerian police forces attacked a journalist in Udu LGA, Delta over the enforcement of the state-wide curfew despite the journalist being on an official assignment. No reported fatalities.

On 26 October 2020, security operatives reportedly attacked and shot a journalist in Lokoja (Lokoja LGA, Kogi) over the coverage of the #EndSARS protests in Lokoja. Police sources report that the journalist was shot by looters and not by police forces. No reported fatalities.

On 26 October 2020, Nigerian police forces assaulted and tortured journalists in Port-Harcourt (Port-Harcourt LGA, Rivers) alleging that the media were carrying fake news against the police. No reported fatalities.

ACTOR1: NSCDC: Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps
NOTES: On 6 January 2021, an officer of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps assaulted three journalists at the National Identity Management Commission (NIMC) in Abuja (Abuja Municipal LGA, FCT) over their coverage of events at the NIMC headquarters. No reported casualties.

On 4 February 2021, unidentified gunmen abducted three people, including a journalist at Kubwa (Abuja Municipal LGA, FCT). Gunmen demanded ransom. Victims were later released. Unclear whether ransom was paid.

SOURCE: Daily Independent (Nigeria); EONS Intelligence; Vanguard (Nigeria); Daily Champion; Guardian (Nigeria)
NOTES: On 9 February 2021, unidentified gunmen abducted a female journalist at Woji (Obia/Akpor LGA, Rivers). Reason for abduction unknown. Victim was later released.

Around 11 February 2021 (as reported), unidentified armed men associated with the brother of the Imo state governor beat a journalist to a coma on Port Harcourt Road in Owerri (Owerri-Municipal LGA, Imo) over his alleged breach of a newly renovated road workspace.

On 21 February 2021, unidentified gunmen abducted a lecturer with the University of Port Harcourt along Andoni-Ogoni Road (Tai LGA, Rivers). Unidentified gunmen also abducted three journalists in the same area. Reason for abduction unknown.
On 28 February 2021, a journalist was beaten by members of the State Task Force while monitoring their activities along the Apapa-Oshodi expressway (Apapa LGA, Lagos).
On 19 March 2021, Nigerian police attacked and tortured a journalist at Onipanu (Mushin LGA, Lagos) for recording the harassment and forceful arrest of a resident in the area. No reported fatalities.
On 4 May 2021, kidnappers abducted a female journalist in Mbamba (Yola-North LGA, Adamawa). Gunmen demanded ransom. Kidnapped victim was later released. Unclear whether ransom was paid.

On 19 May 2021, Nigerian police operatives attacked and injured two journalists in front of the State Secretariat of the Nigeria Union of Journalists in Yenagoa (Yenagoa LGA, Bayelsa) for capturing the demolition of a signpost of the state council and for questioning their indecent behavior.

On 10 June 2021, Nigerian security operatives attacked and assaulted a journalist in Abuja (Abuja Municipal LGA, FCT) over the media's coverage of the security situation in the country. No reported fatalities.
On 19 June 2021, unidentified gunmen attacked and killed a journalist who is also a disk jockey in the Oluyole area of Ibadan [coded as Agoro Ibadan] (Akinyele LGA, Oyo). Unknown reason for attack.
On 19 September 2021, a police officer assaulted a journalist in Ibadan (Ibadan North West, Oyo). The reason for the assault is unknown.

On 6 November 2021, unidentified armed individuals attacked and killed a journalist in Calabar (Calabar Municipal, Cross River). The police claim the assailants could be militia members pursuing robbers or the robbers themselves.

On 6 November 2021, suspected IPOB militants attacked four journalists and three domestic election observers in Orkija (Ihiala, Anambra). The victims were beaten, robbed and their vehicle was burnt. There were no fatalities.
The SHO at the Qazi Ahmed Police Station allegedly tortured and imprisoned a journalist after the journalist attempted to register a case at the station.
A journalist was allegedly tortured by police after he came to the district jail hoping to cover a protest by prisoners there.

During a protest against power outages, police allegedly threw stones at vehicles of the media to attempt to stop them from covering the events. At least 3 journalists and 1 lawyer were injured in the protests.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Former Government of Pakistan (2008-2013); Journalists (United Kingdom)
NOTES: 2 former ISI members and a British television journalist heading to FATA to interview Taliban leaders are believed to have been kidnapped by LeI militants in the North Waziristan region (specific location not given).
2 employees of a Sindh daily newspaper were kidnapped by about 15 armed men and severely tortured. They were later left outside the Taluka police station.
Suspected Taliban militants injured a journalist belonging to a local tribe and his sister during a failed kidnapping attempt.
Police allegedly severely assaulted/tortured a bureau chief of a local news channel, leading to a boycott of coverage of police actions by the journalists of Quetta.
In Kotri, a few unidentified men attacked journalists with sticks and three journalists sustained critical injuries.
Unidentified assailants shot a senior journalist and his driver on 25 July 2010 in Hyderabad. They were rushed to the hospital.
Unidentified assailants killed President of Hangu Union Journalist (HUJ) in Hangu on 14 Sep 2010.
Journalists were tortured by area police on the directives of NBP officials outside the NBP Kotri Branch on 27 Sep 2010.

The Jacobabad police attacked a journalist, the President of the National Press Club Jacobabad in the NADRA office which resulted in injuries to the journalist. The journalist was shifted to the Civil Hospital Jacobabad on 1 October 2010.
On 19 Oct 2010, an unidentified armed group attacked two Mehrabpur journalists at their houses in Mehrabpur city (Naushahro Feroze, Sindh).
Local police detained and tortured journalists over a parking issue on 10 November 2010 in Lahore, at an event for Balochistan students. The policemen involved have been apprehended.
Wali Khan Babar, a journalist from Zhob, Balochistan, was killed by armed men near Liaquatabad, Karachi on 13 January 2011. His killers are on death row as of 2015.
Unidentified armed men attacked a reporter of a private TV channel, shooting him in the face on 20 Apr 2011. He was admitted to the hospital in critical condition.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: HRCP: Human Rights Commission of Pakistan; Journalists (Pakistan)
NOTES: Two more bullet-riddled bodies of Baloch missing persons, including a journalist-cum-activist of Human Rights Commission of Pakistan (HRCP) were recovered from Ormara area of Balochistan on 28 Apr 2011.
A journalist was shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Khuzdar.

A journalist's body was found was found dumped in Khuzdar, about 300 kilometers south of Quetta. Hisname was added to the list of more than 10 journalists whose bodies have been found tortured and dumped in Balochistan.
Renowned tribal journalist was gunned down by unidentified gunmen at a mosque in the Shabqadar area of district Charsadda.

An influential man of Khaskheli community along with his armed men opened indiscriminate fire on a journalist namely Aziz-ul-Hassan Siddiqui and his brother over the ownership of residential plot in Old Nawabshah in the jurisdiction of the B-Section Police Station. The indiscriminate firing resulted in severe injuries to the journalist and his brother, who were rushed to a local hospital.

Unidentified armed men opened fire at the house of a senior journalist, Bureau Chief Pakistan Press International (PPI) Quetta Javed Akhta. Unknown six gunmen riding two motorcycles came and opened fire at his house in Nawan Killi area of the provincial capital.
A Journalist of Dawn magazine has been tortured and killed on April 19 in Karachi of Sindh by unidentified men.
The bodies of a journalist and his friend were found tortured in Lyari of Karachi, Sindh on May 9.

A leader of BNM and journalist, Razaq Gul was killed in Turbat area of Balochistan. The Police said that unidentified armed men had taken him to an unknown destination on Friday night and threw his body in Sangsani Sur area of Turbat after killing him.

At a Baloch Hotel of Baldia Town in the Saeedabad police limits, gunmen opened fire and injured two MQM activists - Khurram and Saleem Iqbal - while they were having dinner. SHO Saeedabad Chaudhry Muhammad Irshad told media that the deceased were activists of the MQM's Unit-13.
TTP militants attacked the television channel Aaj TV for not covering their perspective in Karachi of Sindh on June 25. 2 people have been injured.

The Pakistani Taliban claimed responsibility of the attack on a private television station in Karachi. Two people were injured when gunmen on motorbikes fired at Aaj headquarters. A Taliban spokesman told the BBC it was a response to critical comments by Aaj about the militants and its failure to accommodate Taliban views.
A few unidentified armed men attacked the home of a senior journalist and former Vice President of the Sindh Sahafi Sangat District Larkana injuring one.

As reported on Oct 1 by various media, NATO forces fired at Pakistani civilians from Afghanistan near Chaghi (coded Chagai) of Balochistan killing 2 people and took 10 people as prisoners. NATO denied these allegations.

A few unidentified armed men attacked the house of a local journalist namely, MD Khokhar in Hyder Shah Muhalla, Shikarpur and as a result, her 30-year-old niece died on the spot. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]
A reporter of the local Urdu newspaper, Syed Raza Ali Shah was killed in a targeted attack at Khadda Market area within Baghdadi police remits, Karachi.
The columnist and human rights campaigner was attacked by gunfire on Nov 2 in Islamabad and survived the attack.
In North Nazimabad area, two journalists were killed by an unidentified bike-borne attacker in Karachi.
Two journalists belonging to a local weekly newspaper were killed in a targeted attack by unidentified armed men in Karachi.
Unidentified armed men attacked senior journalist Muhammad Malick in Lahore. He survived the attack.
Five persons including a journalist were shot dead in Dera Bugti and Panjghoor by unidentified militants.
Unknown motorcyclists gunned down a private TV channeljournalistt and reporter Rehmatullah Abid in Panjgur.
Two unidentified motorcyclists shot dead a reporter and journalist of a private TV channel in Gujranwala.
Unidentified armed men killed a senior journalist in Kalat.

Unidentified armed men shot a famous television talk show host Hamid Mir, a host on the private television broadcaster Geo, was wounded in the attack near Karachi's airport.No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
TV anchor and journalist Hamid Mir was wounded in an attack on Saturday in Karachi. Mir was on his way to his office in his car when he was attacked by unidentified gunmen near Shahrah-e-Faisal.
A reporter from a local monthly magazine, also associated with a local NGO, was shot dead by unidentified armed men in Gulshan-e-Hadid, Bin Qasim Town on 3 May 2014.
A local journalist was shot at and injured by Elite Force personnel for not stopping at a picket here on 10 June 2014. He was seriously injured and rushed to Lahore General Hospital.

Suspected TTP militants open fired on a journalist and his brother in Saidu Sharif on Friday. The militants launched the attack as the journalist and his brother were about to enter their residence. The militants fled the scene. The motive behind the attack remains unknown.
On 10 March, two assailants attacked the house of a journalist at Iqbal Town (Lahore); the journalist and his family remained unhurt in the attack.
Journalists allege manhandling and being kept from reporting by police.
4 unidentified militants gunned down a Shia journalist/mass communication lecturer at Karachi University while he was on his way to the university to deliver his lectures
A journalism professor at Karachi University was killed by 4 unidentified assailants riding motorcycles who opened fire on his car, leading to various protests by KU and journalism groups.
A journalist was injured and taken to hospital after he was injured by police. The circumstances surrounding the attack were not clear.
Journalists covering a visit of the Chief Minister to a hospital in Burewala claim to have been assaulted ('subject to torture') by police.
Police attacked on May 23 media personnel stationed outside the Sindh High Court as former provincial home minister appeared at the registrar's office.
Unknown armed men shot dead a local journalist in Usta Mohammad area of Jaffarabad, they forcibly entered the house of Zafrullah Jatak and opened indiscriminate fire, leaving him dead.
On September 8th, a technical engineer of Geo News was killed when his van was attacked by TTP militants in the Bahadurabad area of Karachi.

Senior Journalist Aftab Alam was targeted by unknown assailants right outside his house in Karachi as he was on his way to pick his children up from school. He was a former Geo News employee who was currently working independently. This is the second targeted killing of a journalist associated with Geo News in two days
Senior Tribal Journalist Abdul Azam Shinwari was attacked and shot at in Peshawar, he survived the attack.
Journalists who were at Karachi University to cover a protest were roughed up by security guards, with some seriously injured, and detained for several hours.

On November 3, unidentified gunmen on motorcycle fatally shot a senior tribal (Pashtun) journalist and a 'monitor' for Human Rights Commission of Pakistan (HRCP) who advocated for civil and political rights, when he was travelling from Gomal Bazaar to Tank town (Tank, KP).
Residents of Wazirabad accused police of torturing some journalists and a lawyer, leading to protests.
A journalist working with Online News Agency was abducted by unidentified assailants in Shahbaz Town of Quetta city.
A TV journalist was killed by unidentified assailants in the outskirts of Kohat town.

Unidentified gunmen attacked a Dawn News DSNG van in the Essa Nagri area of Karachi injuring one staff member. Attackers riding motorcycles fired straight shots at the DSNG van, leaving the technician severely injured.
Reported on 6 Jan, a few unidentified armed men attacked the home of journalist Fattah Shaikh on Daro Road in Dadu.

On 16 January, TTP shot dead journalist Muhammad Umar near Niazi Chowk, Dera Ismail Khan city (Dera Islmail Khan, KP). Umar sustained critical injuries and died on arrival at the District Headquarters Hospital.

Journalists led by the president of the Dera Murad Jamali Press Club, Manthar Khan Mangi, were visiting a piece of land allotted by the Revenue Department for the Journalist and Labour Colony in town when a group of men armed with sticks attacked them. They also pelted the journalists with stones.

SOURCE: News International (Pakistan); Front Line Defenders; ProtectDefenders.eu
NOTES: On May 7, gunmen fatally shot a journalist and rights activist who was the Blogger and Editor of Let Us Build Pakistan and his friend a religious scholar in what appeared to be a sectarian attack in Sector-11B of North Karachi in New Karachi town (Karachi, Sindh). Both the victim and his friend were Shiites.

SOURCE: Iranian Government News; Daily Regional Times (Pakistan)
NOTES: On Jan 12, a journalist for a local Urdu newspaper was killed by unidentified gunmen in Kalat district (Balochistan).
Unidentified attackers shot dead a journalist in Balochistan's Qalat district, close to Afghan and Iranian border, police said
An assistant camera person working with Samaa TV was killed near Karachi's KDA Chowrangi. The TTP claimed responsibility for the attack.
In June 2017, unidentified gunmen shot and killed the bureau chief of a private Urdu newspaper near Lora Chowk in Haripur district (KP).

On October 12th, a journalist, Haroon Khan, was shot dead in Swabi outside his home by armed gunmen. Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan later claimed responsibility, stating that they believed Khan to be spying on the Taliban for inteligence agencies.

Unidentified masked men stopped a journalist in his car, took him out, and assaulted him on June 6 near the Allama Iqbal International Airport in Cantonment, Lahore City. He was carrying information regarding a massive corruption case involving the Model Town incident.
Unidentified armed men broke into the house of a female journalist and attempted to slit her throat in Islamabad, as reported on June 13. She resisted and the attackers fled.
Unidentified armed men from the Chang community shot and killed the brother of a well-known journalist, some time on or before June 15, in the Bitshah area of Matiari tehsil/district, Sindh Province.
On Sep 9, unidentified gunmen injured a local journalist in a drive-by shooting in Daska city (Sialkot, Punjab). 3 people were later booked in a FIR.
On Sep 10, unidentified gunmen shot and killed a journalist in Abdul Hakeem village (Kabirwala, Khanewal, Punjab). It is unclear if it was a robbery or targeted killing.

A few days prior to Sep 20, policemen in DG Khan town (Punjab) assaulted and arrested a journalist, Sher Afgan Buzdar, for recording an incident in which the police tried to arrest a man without a warrant and clashes occurred between the police and civilians.

On Sep 25, journalists covering a protest against a demolition project on the Gojra-Samundri bypass road in or near Toba Tek Singh city (Punjab) were shot at by a sub-engineer involved in the demolition. He opened fire on a TV cameraman to try to get him to stop filming. No one was injured.

On Oct 16, a journalist, Sohail Khan, was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Hattar village (Haripur, KP). He had recently published a report on drug trafficking. The motive is unclear; police also suspect a family dispute.
On Oct 29, policemen under the DSP tortured and robbed 3 journalists of their phone in Bhan Syedabad town (Sehwan, Jamshoro, Sindh).
Prior to Oct 30, policemen detained and tortured a local journalist in Larkana town (Sindh) for his reporting within the Market Police Station jurisdiction.
As reported on Nov 6, 12 armed men attacked the office of a local Urdu daily newspaper in Peshawar city (KP) and beat up its crime reporter for his police-related reporting.
On Nov 8, dozens of plainclothes policemen barged into the Press Club in Saddar town (Karachi, Sindh) and harassed the journalists inside.

On December 3, unidentified armed men fired at a vehicle in Sarband area of Peshawar city (Peshawar, KP) killing a reporter and injuring one cameraman. As reported on January 20, the injured cameraman succumbed to his injuries at the Lady Reading Hospital, Peshawar.
On December 8, unidentified armed men opened fire at senior journalist's car in G-8 sector of Islamabad city (Islamabad, Federal Capital Territory). No injuries or fatalities reported.

On December 17, private security personnel of former prime minister Nawaz Sharif assaulted a news cameraman in Islamabad city (Islamabad, Federal Capital Territory) reportedly for attempting to take footage of the former prime minister outside Parliament House.
On January 5, unidentified armed men shot and injured a journalist at Khadim Ali Road in Sialkot city (Sialkot, Punjab).
On January 14, armed men attacked and injured a cameraman working for a local TV channel at Customs Chowk in Peshawar city (Peshawar, KP).
On April 18, men armed with axe and sticks attacked and injured a local journalist and his brother in Baloch Para locality of Lalchandabad, a suburb of Mirpurkhas city (Mirpur Khas, Sindh).
On April 30, armed men shot dead a local journalist and Chairman of Paroa Press Club on the way to Lunda village in Paroa tehsil (Tehsil hq code) (Dera Ismail Khan, KP).
On May 4, an armed man attacked the Padidan Press Club in Padidan town (Naushahro Feroze, Sindh) killing a journalist who was also an office-bearer of the press club.

On May 29, policemen assaulted and arrested two journalists while they were trying to cover PPP leader Bilawal Bhutto's appearance before NAB in Islamabad city (Islamabad, Federal Capital Territory). They were later released after the intervention of the President of National Press Club. Two policemen were suspended on June 1 over the incident.

SOURCE: Front Line Defenders; Express Tribune (Pakistan); Dawn (Pakistan)
NOTES: On June 16, unidentified attackers fatally stabbed a social media activist and blogger, who tweeted and talked about sensitive political issues, and injured his uncle in G-9/4 area of Islamabad city (Islamabad, Federal Capital Territory).
As reported on June 16, police claimed unidentified attackers killed a senior journalist working for various Sindhi newspapers in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Sindh).
As reported on July 17, unknown men fired shots at Talhar Press Club in Talhar town (Badin, Sindh). No fatalities or injuries reported.
On August 15, an armed man fatally shot a PTI worker and reporter of a tribal newspaper in Toori-Bangash Colony locality of Orangi town (Karachi, Sindh).

On August 25, contractor and security staff of BRT project manhandled and injured a team of reporters from Samma TV and Hum News while they were doing coverage on BRT project in Peshawar city (Peshawar, KP).
On August 28, unknown armed men shot and critically injured the senior sub-editor of Daily Azadi Quetta and member of Quetta Press Club on Kirani Road in Quetta city (Quetta, Balochistan).
On August 30, unknown armed men fatally shot a local journalist at the entrance of his house in Puran village (Gujrat, Punjab).
On 16 February 2020, a journalist was killed by unidentified armed group in Naushahro Feroze district (Sindh).
On 26 Feb 2020, unidentified armed men fatally shot a journalist in Matta town (Swat, KPK). No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

On 7 April 2020, police officers attacked and tortured a journalist in Gilgit city (Gilgit, Gilgit Baltistan) for reporting during the lockdown due to coronavirus, despite journalists being authorized to report during the lockdown.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Balochistan Levies
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On 20 June 2020, two journalists were detained and assaulted by Balochistan Levies and Frontier Corps personnel in Chaman city (Killa Abdullah, Balochistan).

On 21 June 2020, a few unidentified men attacked a journalist with sticks and tortured him in Badin city (Badin, Sindh). The journalist had previously criticized local authorities for failing to protect journalists. No further details reported.

On 21 July 2020, an unidentified armed group (some in uniform) abducted a journalist from G-6 sector of Islamabad city (Islamabad, FCT). The journalist was released outside of Islamabad, 12 hours after the abduction.
On 5 September 2020, a female Baloch journalist was shot dead by unidentified persons in Turbat tehsil (Kech district, J&K).
On 8 December 2020, unidentified armed men killed a Christian journalist in Dera Ismail Khan city (Dera Ismail Khan, KPK). No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
On 18 March 2021, unidentified armed men killed a Hindu journalist in Saleh Pat town (Sukkur, Sindh). No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
On 10 April 2021, unidentified armed men killed a journalist in Batani Khel area (coded as Karak) (KPK). No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

On 20 April 2021, unidentified armed men shot and injured a journalist and former chairman of the Pakistan Electronic Media Regulatory Authority in Islamabad city (Islamabad, FCT). No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
On 25 May 2021, unidentified armed men attacked a journalist, who was known to be critical of the establishment including the army, in Islamabad city (Islamabad, FCT).

Around 30 May 2021 (as reported), police allegedly assaulted and injured three journalists in Ghotki city (Ghotki, Sindh), who were trying to report on the private torture cells operated by the Ghotki Police.
On 1 June 2021, police assaulted a journalist at Gwadar city (Balochistan) while he was covering the arrest of a JI leader and forced him to stop reporting.

On 24 November 2021, an unidentified assailant attacked the car of a female journalist with iron rod in Lahore - Aziz Bhatti (Lahore Cantt, Punjab). No casualties occurred. The female journalist claimed that the assailant hurled death threats at her before fleeing from the spot. She is also the wife of a prominent journalist who recently released a leaked audio of former Chief Justice of Pakistan.

Around 19 January 2018 (as reported), 3 private security guards beat and injured a journalist covering the Carnival celebrations in Encarnacion town (Encarnacion, Itapua). They also destroyed his camera.

As reported on 27 December 2019, in Pedro Juan Caballero (Amambay), a journalist was beaten and had his cellphone taken from him by military men after recording them evicting a group of homeless people who invaded a military building. The police arrived later to try to control the situation. No fatalities, at least 1 injury.

On 12 February 2020, in Pedro Juan Caballero (Amambay), an important journalist of the Brazil-Paraguay border was shot 12 times and killed in his own house by three hooded men. The victim was receiving threats for the last 10 years and it is believed the crime is linked to the articles he used to publish about criminal organizations, and corruption of police officers and Paraguayan authorities. The investigations concluded that the PCC (First Capital Command) was hired to kill the victim. 1 fatality.

SOURCE: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Front Line Defenders; ProtectDefenders.eu
NOTES: A radio broadcaster was shot dead by an unidentified gunman in Purok Bagong Silang, Barangay Poblacion, Pitogo, Zamboanga del Sur on 16 Feb 2016. The victim had been reporting on illegal drugs and illegal gambling in the area. The victim was also a former NPA member.

Assumed on 2 Jul 2016, a radioman who is a strong critic of illegal gambling was shot and wounded by unidentified armed men in Brgy. Rizal, Surigao City, Surigao del Norte.
An editor-in-chief of Bicol Standard, a regional partner of Philstarcom was shot dead by unidentified armed men (called 'Bicol Vigilante') at Brgy. Dayangdang, Naga City, Camarines Sur on 9 Jul 2016.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Philippines); Private Security Forces (Philippines); Government of the Philippines (2016-)
NOTES: On 14 July 2016, unidentified armed men shot and wounded a provincial board member-cum-radio broadcaster in Barangay San Vicente, Bislig City (Surigao del Sur, Caraga). The victim's security escort was killed. Two others were wounded.

On 8 November 2016, a commentator of the radio station dwPR-AM in Dagupan City and columnist for the local newspaper Northern Watch was wounded as he was shot by unidentified armed assailants along the Villasis-Asingan Road in Barangay Poblacion (Villasis, Pangasinan, Ilocos Region). The victim had previously exposed stories on mining and the drug trade.

A local newspaper publisher of Catanduanes News Now was shot dead by an unidentified assailant in Barangay San Isidro, Virac, Catanduanes on 19 Dec 2016 after releasing an article on drug manufacturing on the island.
A former radio broadcaster was gunned down by unidentified men on Tuesday morning (Jan. 31) in downtown Isabela City, Basilan.
A block time radio announcer was killed while his daughter was wounded when two men shot them in M'lang town in North Cotabato province on Wednesday. The motive is still unclear.
A journalist was shot dead by unidentified gunmen at Barangay Bacolod, Milagros, Masbate on March 13. The police is looking into politics or personal grudge as motive for the killing.
On 28 July 2017, a journalist was critically wounded in an ambush by unidentified men at his home in Marihatag (Surigao del Sur, Caraga).

On 3 August 2017, in San Juan city (Metro Manila, National Capital Region), unidentified assailants shot dead a former Business World editor, who was also a former Living Asia Channel video producer and former public servant, and his sibling. The motive for the killing is unclear.
On 6 August 2017, a journalist was shot dead by unidentified men in Barangay Culo (Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Zamboanga Peninsula).

On 7 August 2017, a journalist (for a Manila tabloid newspaper and a columnist for a community newspaper) was shot dead by unidentified men in Barangay Kalanawi or Katiku, President Quirino (Sultan Kudarat, Soccsksargen).
On 9 August 2017, a columnist for tabloids Abante and Tonite and his companion were wounded in an ambush by unidentified gunmen in Batangas City (Batangas, Calabarzon).

On 23 August 2017, unidentified armed men fired shots at the car of a radio broadcaster for ZagitSit News FM in in Barangay Cruzada, Legazpi city (Albay, Bicol Region). The journalist survived without injuries.

On 24 October 2017, a radio journalist was shot dead by unidentified armed men in Bislig City (Surigao del Sur, Caraga). Authorities said that the former Surigao del Sur governor and incumbent Bislig City Mayor perpetrated the attack.
Two city hall employees attacked a broadcaster and critic of Mayor Neil Lizares, in Talisay City, Negros Occidental on February 16. One of the perpetrators is a known supporter of the mayor.
A radio broadcaster was killed by unidentified armed men in Dumaguete, Negros Oriental on 30 April.
On 12 May 2018, a radio broadcaster was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Noboran (Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur, Zamboanga Peninsula). The motive for the attack was unclear.
A reporter and publisher was killed by unidentified assailants at Panabo City, Davao del Norte province on June 7.

NOTES: A media worker was shot and killed by unidentified assailants at Barangay Cadayonan, Marawi City, Lanao del Sur on June 23.
A journalist was shot and killed by unidentified assailants at Cabanatuan City, Nueva Ecija on June 23.

Two workers of Good Cup Coffee Company, including one student journalist, was killed by unidentified assailants at Cebu City, Cebu province on April 10, 2019. Two workers were wounded in the attack.
Unidentified assailants strafed a radio station at Barangay Bula, General Santos City, South Cotabato province on July 3, 2019.

A radio journalist was killed by unidentified assailants at Kidapawan City, Cotabato province on July 10, 2019. The suspects behind the killing are members of the controversial religious and scam group Kapa-Community Ministry International Inc. due to the victim's criticism of their group.

On 6 August 2019, in Lagawe, Ifugao, a journalist for Northern Dispatch and paralegal volunteer for the Ifugao Peasant Movement (IPM) was shot and wounded by unidentified gunmen in front of his house. The Cordillera Human Rights Alliance (CHRA) reported that the 54th IB were seen frequenting the victim's house for weeks before the shooting. The victim was an American national.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Women (Philippines); Journalists (Philippines); GABRIELA: General Assembly Binding Women for Reforms, Integrity, Equality, Leadership, and Action; CEGP: College Editors Guild of the Philippines
NOTES: On 14 Sept 2019, in Laguna province, a female member of College Editors Guild of the Philippines and Gabriela Youth was illegally arrested by the military, was deprived of sleep and food for up to 30 hours, and was forced to sign an affidavit that she was a member of the NPA who voluntarily surrendered to the army. The military denies the allegations and claimed that her surrender was not coerced.

On 11 October 2019, a radio broadcaster who was also working as the provincial public information officer was wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in Purok White Dove, Barangay Visayan, Tagum City, Davao del Norte.

SOURCE: Abante; ABS CBN; Sunstar (Philippines); Philippine Daily Inquirer; Rappler
NOTES: On 20 October 2019, a journalist and his companion were shot dead by an assailant suspected to be connected to illegal gambling in Barangay Cacutud, Arayat, Pampanga. The slain journalist was a known critic of illegal gambling.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NUJP: National Union of Journalists of the Philippines; Journalists (Philippines)
SOURCE: Abante; GMA News; Manila Bulletin; Philippine Star
NOTES: On 30 October 2019, a radio broadcaster was critically wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay New Isabela, Tacurong, Sultan Kudarat. The broadcaster, who was a member of the National Union of Journalists of the Philippines, died at the hospital more than a month later because of his injuries.

SOURCE: Philippine Star; Sunstar (Philippines); GMA News; ABS CBN; Rappler; Cebu Daily News
NOTES: On 7 November 2019, a radio broadcaster was shot dead by a motorcycle-riding assailant in Barangay Piapi, Dumaguete, Negros Oriental. A police officer assigned to the Provincial Mobile Force Company of the Negros Oriental Police Office was later identified as the suspect in the attack.

SOURCE: Abante; Philippine Daily Inquirer; ABS CBN; Manila Bulletin; Cebu Daily News; Rappler; GMA News
NOTES: On 5 May 2020, a radio reporter was shot dead by unidentified motorcycle-riding assailants in Barangay Daro, Dumaguete, Negros Oriental.

SOURCE: Abante; GMA News; Philippine Star; ABS CBN; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Manila Bulletin; Rappler
NOTES: On 25 May 2020, the Cotabato City mayor's executive assistant - also a former broadcaster - was shot dead by unidentified assailants along Notre Dame Avenue in Cotabato City, Maguindanao. The motive for the attack was unclear, though there had been a previous attempt on the executive assistant's life in July 2015.

On 18 June 2020, a Muslim broadcaster who hosted a religious program on a radio station was wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Pasalobong, Zamboanga City, Zamboanga del Sur. The motive for the attack was unclear.

Around 20 July 2020 (between 20 - 21 July), a cameraman of a prominent news program - also reportedly a former police informant - was killed by unidentified assailants and was found dead along Regalado Avenue in Quezon City (Metro Manila, National Capital Region). The exact time and place of the killing are unknown. The motive for the attack was unclear.

On 14 September 2020, a journalist was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Cabid-An, Sorsogon City (Sorsogon, Bicol Region). The journalist had an online news and commentary program and was described in reports as a 'hard-hitting commentator.' The motive for the attack was unclear.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 15 October 2020, 3 radio broadcasters of a local government-run radio station, attached to the Municipal Disaster Risk Management Office of Buluan, Maguindanao, were killed, while another was wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in Buluan town (Maguindanao, Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao). The radio broadcasters were also reportedly volunteers assisting the local government's coronavirus response. The motive for the attack was unclear.

SOURCE: Abante; Philippine News Agency; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Bulatlat; Manila Bulletin; Kodao Productions
NOTES: On 10 November 2020, a local newspaper reporter and radio commentator was shot dead by unidentified assailants in front of his residence in Barangay San Blas (Villasis, Pangasinan, Ilocos Region). The slain journalist was reportedly a known critic of local politicians alleged to be involved in illegal gambling. The journalist had already survived a previous assassination attempt on 8 November 2016, where the assailants reportedly tried to frame him for involvement in illegal drugs. Journalist groups rejected the drug link, saying this angle was manufactured to conceal the real motive for the attack.

SOURCE: Abante; Philippine Daily Inquirer; GMA News; Bulatlat; Philippine Star
NOTES: On 15 November 2020, a newspaper-cum-radio reporter - also a Christian pastor - was shot dead by soldiers in Barangay Matanglad (Milagros, Masbate, Bicol Region). The military said that the journalist was reaching for a gun when he was shot, but the journalist's colleagues and the National Union of Journalists of the Philippines disputed the claim, saying that the journalist was shot when he reached for his phone to call for police assistance when he and his companions were accosted by the soldiers while working. State forces linked the journalist to the NPA, though the local government asked security officials to substantiate this claim.

On 18 March 2021, a radio reporter was left unscathed in a gun attack by unidentified assailants at his residence in Labo town (Camarines Sur, Bicol Region). Police said that the reporter had previously received threats. Police were investigating whether the attack might be related to the reporter's work, through which he had previously witnessed a police operation.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of the Philippines (2016-); NUJP: National Union of Journalists of the Philippines; Journalists (Philippines)
SOURCE: ABS CBN; Bulatlat; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Panay News; GMA News
NOTES: On 2 May 2021, the town administrator of Pilar town - a prominent former journalist who also served as former national director of the National Union of Journalists of the Philippines (NUJP) - was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Lawa-an, Roxas City (Capiz, Western Visayas). The motive for the killing was unclear, though reports noted that the slain town administrator's wife, a human rights lawyer who had been red-tagged, survived a separate ambush attempt on September 2019.

On 14 July 2021, a married couple who hosted a popular justice-themed radio program were shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Talomo, Davao City (Davao del Sur, Davao Region). The radio program was focused on legal questions and often relayed criticisms of government officials and other groups and individuals. The radio program's staff said that they had received threats prior to the attack. One of the slain hosts was also a lawyer.

SOURCE: ABS CBN; Cebu Daily News; Sunstar (Philippines)
NOTES: On 22 July 2021, a prominent veteran radio commentator of radio station dyRB Cebu was shot dead by unidentified assailants outside the station in Barangay Mambaling, Cebu City (Cebu, Central Visayas). The motive for the attack was unclear, though the victim's associates said that he had made several enemies due to his radio commentaries.

SOURCE: GMA News; Philippine News Agency; Manila Bulletin; Abante; Philippine Daily Inquirer
NOTES: On 17 August 2021, a newspaper editor was shot dead by unidentified assailants outside a salon that she also owned in Barangay Apolonio Samson, Quezon City (Metropolitan Manila, National Capital Region). The motive for the attack was unclear, though police dismissed earlier reports of a robbery motive. Authorities were investigating possible motives linked to the victim's work as journalist.

SOURCE: GMA News; CNN; Manila Standard; ABS CBN; Manila Bulletin
NOTES: On 8 December 2021, a veteran journalist reporting for Reuters, Manila Standard and Bandera was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay San Joaquin, Calbayog City (Samar, Eastern Visayas). The motive for the attack was unclear. Journalist groups condemned the killing.
Newspaper editor attacked

SOURCE: O Democrata; DW; Agencia de Noticias da Guine; RTP; Angola Press Agency
NOTES: Around 9 March 2021 (as reported), a journalist was kidnapped, beaten, had his tongue cut, and released by unidentified individuals in the Bolola zone, city of Bissau (Sector Autonomo de Bissau, Bissau). The journalist mentioned that he has been chased by members of the government for having supported an opposition candidate in the last presidential elections. The African Party for the Independence of Guinea-Bissau and Cape Verde also accused the government of being behind the attack.

On 12 March 2021, a journalist was beaten and injured by alleged plain-clothes police officers with AK-47s as he arrived at the Herois Nacionais square in Bissau (Sector Autonomo de Bissau, Bissau) to cover the arrival of a PAIGC leader in the country.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Puerto Rico (2019-2021); Journalists (Puerto Rico)
NOTES: On November 6, 2019, in Hato Rey, San Juan, a man fired shots in front of the Federal Court and then in front of broadcaster Telemundo. He had a rifle and a pistol, and was detained by the police.
On 7 March 2018, a journalist of journal Expert was beaten up on Sakhalin. The journal links this event to his work.
On March 18th 2018, a journalist was slapped by an election official in Derbent, Dagestan while filming election violations.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: LPR: Libertarian Party of Russia; Journalists (Russia)
NOTES: On April 1, a blogger Mikhail Svetov, member of Libertarian Party of Russia was beaten by unidentified group of 15 in the airport of Kemerovo and sent back to Moscow. He was going to read a lecture in Kemerovo about not trusting the Government, following the deadly fire in the city
On April 12, editor in chief of the 'Oblastnaya Gazeta' Dimitry Polyanin was beaten in Yekaterinburg by unidentified people

On 05 May 2018, two journalists reported being assaulted as they covered the protest against the presidential inauguration of Vladimir Putin in Chelyabinsk. One of the journalist, Vadim Akhmetov was hit in the face from the back and was reportedly dragged out of the protest by other people. The persons involved were not identified.

On 26 May 2018, journalist Anton Chablin was beaten by two unknown persons in Stavropol. According to the victim, the assault would be connected to his investigation on land corruption in the Stavropol region.
On 03 June 2018, Journalist Yegor Pogorelov was assaulted in Moscow by an unknown individual.

On 17 June 2018, blogger Evgeny Shirmanov was attacked and beaten up by unknown persons in Krasnodar in the courtyard of his house. Shirmanov have been filming illegal actions of the traffic police in different Russian regions and posting them. The attack is thought to be connected with the blogger's posts.

On July 15th, two journalists of an almanac called moloko  (focused on revolutionary history and terrorism) were attacked by unidentified individuals at a public transport stop in Krasnodar. They sprayed them gas info their face, shouting: 'Hello, Ukraina'. Both managed to survive without serious injuries.
On 19 September, journalist Maksim Novikov was attacked by two unidentified men in Tver.

On 05 October 2018, blogger Konstantin Ishutov was assaulted by an unknown person in Chuvashia. The incident occurred a day after Ishutov's arrest for having compared life under the current government as worst than living under the Third Reich occupation. He was released and lately the investigative committee of Chuvashia declared that child pornography was found at the blogger's house. So far charges against the blogger were only pressed for rehabilitation of Nazism.

On Wednesday, January 23, 2019, in Makhachkala, unknown assailants assaulted Eldar Iraziev, a Dagestani actor and pro-government blogger who was most recently calling for closures of all night clubs in Dagestan, claiming that they accelerated the 'decay' of the Dagestani society. Iraziev did not report any major injuries.

On February 15, 2019, unknown assailants attacked Dmitry Kosenko, chief editor of the local newspaper 'Your Voice' who was investigating the acquisition of a coveted land plot by the family of the district head Anatoly Rusin. Kosenko was hospitalized and was diagnosed with a concussion, broken nose, and bruising.

On 6 February 2020, a group of more than 15 unidentified individuals violently beat a female activist journalist and a female lawyer in the lobby of a hotel in Grozny, Chechnya. Both women were in Grozny to support the court hearing of a man, who was detained and tortured for criticizing nepotism among Kadyrov and his allies, and both repeatedly received threats for representing defendants in Chechnya. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

SOURCE: TV Rain; OVD Info; MBK Media; RFE/RL; Meduza; MediaZone; Interfax
NOTES: On 30 June 2020, a police officer and an unidentified official election observer attacked and attempted to forcefully remove a journalist after he arrived to investigate reports of alleged fraud at a voting site in St. Petersburg. The journalist suffered a broken arm in the process and had to have an emergency surgery later that day to address the fracture.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: RF: Russia of the Future; Navalny HQ; Journalists (Russia)
NOTES: On 31 August 2020, 2 unidentified individuals attacked Yegor Zhukov, a radio host, member of RF and Navalny HQ, and an opposition activist, near his Moscow home. Zhukov was diagnosed with a concussion, among other injuries, but refused hospitalization. He maintains that the attack was politically motivated.

On 15 October 2020, a blogger and journalist from Khabarovsk reported that seven unidentified masked men forced him into a minibus, beat him up, and threatened with a loaded handgun. The assailants then reportedly drove to the outskirts of Khabarovsk and abandoned him there. The journalist was reported to require medical treatment.

On 21 January 2021, the Deputy Minister of South Ossetia Sergei Kabirov and one other person allegedly assaulted a journalist of a North Ossetian news site in Vladikavkaz. No injuries were reported, while the attacked journalist claims that he was targeted due to his reporting on the activities of the President of South Ossetia. Kabirov was charged with 'obstructing journalistic activities' by the Investigative Committee of Russia on 14 May, 2021.
On 28 January 2021, police beat up a local journalist in Kursk for his alleged role in organizing the upcoming January 31 protest in support of Alexei Navalny.

Around 15 May 2021 (month of), a man related to a member of a local village assembly in Omsk physically assaulted a cameraman working with a film crew for a Russian state-controlled TV channel. The film crew was shooting a report on allegations of child pornography production by the member of the village assembly and by his wife.

On 21 May 2021, an unidentified masked assailant attacked a local journalist in the city of Yugorsk, striking him about 10 times in the head. The journalist required medical attention, including 5 stitches. The journalist alleges that the attack is connected to his journalistic activities.

On 9 June 2021, 3 men attacked a local journalist in front of his home in Blagoveshchensk, beating him with metal objects. The journalist, who said the attackers told him to cease his investigations, had his wounds seen by doctors but was not hospitalized.
On 1 July 2021, a police officer physically assaulted a journalist in Moscow - Central after he started filming the allegedly brutal arrest of a man by the police officer.

On 17 July 2021, police allegedly physically assaulted and beat a female journalist in Moscow - Central. According to the victim, the incident occurred after the journalist started filming the detention of a passerby by police.

Around 24 July 2021 (week of), a Chechen blogger from Bachi-Yurt, who had recently criticized Chechen authorities for compulsory coronavirus vaccination as well as regarding a minor local issue, was allegedly kidnapped by unidentified culprits representing local authorities. The information was publicized by a self-exiled Chechen blogger.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Russia); Yabloko: Russian United Democratic Party
NOTES: On 25 September 2021, four unidentified culprits physically assaulted and beat a journalist and activist for the opposition Yabloko: Russian United Democratic Party. The assailants blocked the victim's car with their own, while both were driving on a highway in Krasnodar, then allegedly pulled the victim out of his car and beat him. Having suffered mild injuries, the Yabloko activist claimed the attack was linked to his political activity.

SOURCE: RBC; BBC News; Lenta.ru; OVD Info
NOTES: On 2 October 2021, a Belarusian journalist was allegedly abducted at an unspecified location in Moscow, by unidentified culprits allegedly linked to the Belarusian government. According to the editor-in-chief of the newspaper the journalist worked for, the victim was detained and taken to a prison in Minsk for writing a critical article about a recent shootout in Minsk during an operation aimed at detaining an opponent to the regime of Belarusian president Alexander Lukashenko, in which the opponent as well as a member of Belarusian security services were killed. According to the press secretary of the Russian president, Russian authorities had no information on the circumstances of the journalist's disappearance, and could not send a query to authorities in Minsk on this topic as the victim was a Belarusian citizen. According to a representative of the Belarusian Ministry of Internal Affairs, the journalist was detained in Belarus after attempting to leave the country through Moscow, being forced to return after Russian authorities did not allow for his entry into Russia or for him to continue his trip to a third destination.

On 17 November 2021, police physically assaulted and beat a journalist who was filming a corridor in the Moscow Oblast court in Krasnogorsk, where he had come for a hearing in the case of two colleagues of his. Police suffocated the man in an attempt to make him fall to the ground. The victim was hospitalized with a concussion as a result of the incident.

On 25 November 2021, a professional wrestler beat a local blogger in Dagestanskiye Ogni, in what the victim claimed was an attack on him ordered by local authorities after he publicized a case of municipal land in the area being sold at below-market value.

Editor Jean Bosco Gasasira of the Kinyarwanda-language Umuvugizi attacked by three men armed with iron bars after his magazine published a series of recent articles critical of officials in the government of President Paul Kagame

A Rwandan journalist who accused the regime of attempting to assassinate a dissident general in Johannesburg was gunned down in Kigali, fuelling tensions ahead of August elections. The government denied any assassination attempts.
Rwandan journalist shot dead by unknown in Kigali.

On 16 July 2019, an unidentified armed group abducted a journalist for TV1 Rwanda around Gicumbi district (Gicumbi, North). He has yet to be found, but Rwandan intelligence are suspected to be behind the abduction.
A journalist was assaulted by police after investigating the foricble removal of people living in Dakar.

A health correspondent for a radio station was attacked by members of the Mouride Brotherhood, a religious sect, for criticizing the sects leader.
Two sports journalists were beaten by police officers.
Newspaper offices were ransacked by unidentified men using teargas.

On or around 12 February, 2019, BBY supporters assaulted a minibus transporting journalists responsible for following the opposition PUR candidate's convoy in Tambacounda and wounded eight of the journalists.

On 1 October 2020, police officers beat up a female journalist and broke her equipment as she was recording the arrest of an activist in Dakar city (Dakar Plateau, Dakar). 4 police officers were arrested in relation to that incident.

On February 16, 2018 in Karaburma, Belgrade, two reporters from the 'O2' and 'Prva televizija' media outlets respectively were assaulted while reporting on a story about illegal migrants found in a private house in that settlement.
On April 17, 2018 in Leskovac, Serbia TV Prva journalist team was assaulted, during which a cameraman suffered a head injury.
On July 10, 2018 in Bela Crkva, Serbia journalist Stefan Cvetkovic was assaulted with a metal pipe.
On January 31, 2019 in Valjevo, Serbia unknown perpetrators attacked a journalist Marko Acimovic while he was reporting about a public gathering happening at that moment.
On May 30, unidentified assailants burned the car of a local journalist and activist in Aleksinac, Serbia.
On 3 July 2020, a cameraman of local KTV was physically assaulted by an unknown person while reporting on election irregularities is Zrenjanin, Serbia.

On 16 April 2021, a radio broadcaster and journalist was attacked with a metal rod and teargassed by two men in Novi Sad, Serbia, requiring hospitalization. He has also been an outspoken member of an anti-fascist group. Two men were arrested for the beating and a third for allegedly organizing and paying for the attack.

On 6 August 2021, a local citizen-reporter, who ran a facebook page with local news, was shot and killed in Sjenica, Serbia, from a moving vehicle. One man, who the journalist had been reporting on was arrested. The local ruling party stated the attacker was close to oppositional parties, though this is still unconfirmed.

A journalist is stabbed and killed by an armed group. Police make three arrests several days later in connection to the killing. The group that attacked the reporter believed his writing was biased against them.

A journalist is stabbed and killed by an armed group. Police make three arrests several days later in connection to the killing. The group that attacked the reporter believed his writing was biased against them.

Abdul Karim Fonti Kabia, the Executive editor of a Freetown-based privately-owned Sierra Leone News Hunters (ARIOBGO) newspaper, was on November 30, 2011 violently assaulted by two pastors of the Baptist Convention Church. Witnesses see police assault journalists and take their equipment. The journalists were covering a military protest by former soldiers.
Unidentified attackers abducted a photo journalist who had been vocal about the political situation in the country at Hill station in Freetown.
On 11 October, SLPP supporters stabbed a journalist after forcing news reporters to leave parliament

SOURCE: WANEP-SL; Inter Press Service; Agence de Presse Africaine; Awoko; SL-LED
NOTES: On 31 March 2018, a journalist was beaten whilst covering the presidential run-off election in Freetown. Sources indicate that APC supporters, acting under the instructions of senior APC officials such as the former Mayor of Freetown and a former Public Relations Officer in the Ministry of Agriculture, were responsible for the violence. The victim died on June 6th, reportedly as a result of his injuries.
On 15 April 2018, SLPP party task forces attacked the offices of Sierra Express Media in Freetown, allegedly in retaliation of coverage during the elections.

On 28 April 2018, a radio reporter for the Sierra Leone Broadcasting Corporation (SLBC) was attacked in Freetown, allegedly following ''negative reporting'' of the SLPP in the run up to the elections.
On 21 January 2019, SLPP party taskforces attacked the Sierra Epress Media office in Kissy area of Freetown, badly injuring the editor. Attackers were wearing SLPP t-shirts.
