NOTES: On Oct 29 2015, after a bomb was detonated at the building targeting an Islah affiliated member previously (coded separately), UAE forces and foreign mercenaries integrated into UAE forces fire shots inside the building targeting at least 10 international journalists and Islah staff leaving a number injured.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2015-2016) Supreme Revolutionary Committee
NOTES: Three Yemeni journalists working for Al Jazeera, Hamdi al Bokari, Abdulaziz al Sabri anf Moneer al Sabai, are suspected to have been kidnapped by an unidentified armed group in Taizz city, Taizz governorate. Upon release on 28/01, they said that they had been kidnapped by Houthi fighters.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2015-2016) Supreme Revolutionary Committee
NOTES: Houthi popular committees tortured 3 journalists, Toufiq al Mansoury, Abdelkhalik Omran and Akram Al Waleedi, detained in the Ath Thawra prison since 09/06/2015 of the capital Sanaa, Amanat al Asimah governorate.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2015-2016) Supreme Revolutionary Committee
NOTES: A Houthi sniper killed Ahmed al Shaybani, a cameraman working for the State TV Yemen TV Channel in the city of Taizz, Taizz governorate.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2015-2016) Supreme Revolutionary Committee
NOTES: A Houthi popular committees sniper killed Muhammad al Yamani, a Yemeni photo journalist, in the Dhubab district, Taizz governorate. Other journalists were also injured.
20 December 2016: An investigative reporter died under mysterious circumstances in the capital, Sana'a. An autopsy later revealed he had been killed by poisonous gas.
A Houthi top figure was assassinated by masked gunmen in Sana'a. 'Abdullah Alwazir, who owns a Shi'ite publication, was killed along with four of his attaches' witnesses said.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Yemen); Yemen Organization for Defending of Rights and Democratic Freedoms
NOTES: 25 January 2017: Houthi soldiers manning a checkpoint in Sana'a assaulted a Human Rights investigative officer, beating him in the chest and causing injuries.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
NOTES: Two young journalists were arrested at al-Thawra Remand Prison in Sana'a along with seven other journalists by the Houthis. They were tortured by tying their hands behind their backs and hanging them from the roof for a whole day.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
NOTES: Three reporters died this morning while covering clashes around the Tashreefat military base (Rudajah) east of the city of Taiz. Two others were wounded in the incident, along with 27 other civilians. The Yemen Journalists Union claimed the Houthis were responsible for the deadly attack and demanded that they be persecuted. UNESCO later issued a statment condemning the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
NOTES: On 19 and 20 January, social media users circulated photos and videos said to show the body of a female Yemeni journalist and activist who was reported to have been killed by the Houthi rebels in the central province of Ibb. Her body was found in Al-Dhaher district of the province. Rumors were that she was loyal to the GPC (General People's Congress), which may have been why she was killed as Houthi militants have been targeting prominate members of the group since the takeover of Sana'a.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2012-) Security Belt Forces
NOTES: Suspected gunmen belonging to the UAE backed Security Belt forces have burned down the headquarters of 'Akhbar Al-Youm' newspaper in Dar Sad neighborhood of Aden. Gunmen in pickup trucks swarmed the area prior to the attack and, according to local sources, several employees were injured as they escaped the building. No fatalities were reported. Local sources could not confirm whether they were acting under official roles at the time of the attack.
Unidentified armed men stormed the office of Al-Shomou - a foundation close to the Muslim brotherhood, and forcibly kidnapped 7 journalists. The same office was torched on 1 March 2018.

SOURCE: Yemen News Agency SABA; Yemen Data Project
NOTES: Journalist Ahmed Muhammad Rajih al Maymuni - working for SABA agency - was killed by unknown gunmen in Algiers Street of Sana'a city in Hadda area.

SOURCE: Al Mashhad Al Araby; Yemen Data Project
NOTES: Unidentified gunmen opened fire at the vehicle of journalist Mazen Shaabi, correspondent for the UAE-based Sharjah TV, in Inma neighbourhood of Aden port city, in Al Mansurah district. Shaabi survived the assassination attempt but was hospitalised following the incident.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
NOTES: 14 August 2018: A human rights field researcher in Hudayda city was blindfolded and abducted by Houthi forces and taken to an unknown location where he has not been heard from since.

SOURCE: Yemen Data Project; Twitter; Yemen al Ghad
NOTES: 2 citizens were reported killed, including 1 journalist, in the downtown area of Taizz city, southwestern Yemen, by unidentified sniper fire. 1 citizen was killed in the Nisiriyah neighbourhood, located 200 meters to the west of Bab Musa; the other, journalist Muhammad Tahiri, was killed near the Mudhaffar hospital, located 200 meters to the south of Bab Musa.
Armed men reportedly shot and killed local journalist Zaki al Saqladi, who was affiliated with the Islah party near his house in Sha'ib city of Dali governorate, then fled the scene.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
NOTES: On May 5, pro-Houthi snipers reportedly killed a journalist in Hijar area west of Al-Qa'atabah in Al-Dali governorate, southern Yemen.
On May 12, a journalist was reported injured by unidentified sniper fire while covering events in Qatabah district of Al-Dali governorate, southern Yemen.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2012-) Shabwani Elite Forces
NOTES: On 10 June 2019, Shabwani Elite Forces abducted a media activist from his home in Ataq city (Ataq, Shabwah). He was detained in the Elite Forces camp prison in Azzan district.
On July 24, policemen affiliated with the Minister of Interior Al-Maysari attacked and injured a photo journalist of Aden Times as he was visiting a Qat Market in Aden.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
NOTES: On 27 July 2019, Houthi gunmen abducted a journalist in front of his home in Sanaa (Old City, Amanat al Asimah). They beat him, dragged him into the vehicle and brought him to an unknown location. He was disappeared for about three and a half months. Five months after his arrest, Al-Samadi appeared in front of the Public Prosecution. He was mistreated during interrogation sessions although no date is specified.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Saudi Arabia (2015-); Police Forces of Yemen (2012-)
NOTES: In mid-July 2019, a journalist was reportedly arrested by Saudi-backed Yemeni forces in his hotel room in the city of Al Ghayzah, Al Mahrah governorate, and then transferred to the Saudi-run prison in the city's airport where he was detained for more than a month. Upon his release, he reported that he was tortured during his unlawful detention, inclusing with electric shocks.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Saudi Arabia (2015-); Police Forces of Yemen (2012-)
NOTES: On 27 August, after he managed to escape 56 days of forced disappearance at the hands of Saudi and Saudi-backed Yemeni forces in Al Mahrah governorate (detained in early July 2019), a journalist reported that he was tortured during his unlawful detention. Initially arrested by Yemeni forces allied with Saudi Arabia in Al Ghayzah, he was transferred to the Saudi-run prison in the city's airport and then to several Saudi-run detention centres at unknown locations. He was accused of alleged links Hezbollah, Qatar, the Houthis and Oman.

ACTOR1: STC: Southern Transitional Council (Shabwani Elite Forces)
NOTES: On Aug 25, the pro-STC Shabwani elite kidnapped a TV journalist while covering the clashes around Ataq.

29 August 2019: Unidentified armed gunmen shot several bullets through the door of Aden Al-Ghad, a local newspaper in Mansura (Aden city). No injuries were reported (although several staff appear to have been present).

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
NOTES: In November, 10 journalists were reportedly tortured by Houthi forces in the political security prison in Sanaa.
On November 25, members of the security forces aligned with al-Islah party reportedly kidnapped the distributor of the al-Shari' newspaper in Taizz to prevent its distribution in the city.

On 22 December 2019, unidentified gunmen reportedly attacked a crew of journalists from the 'Yemen Youth' channel in Al-Asabih area of Taizz governorate (Al-Shamayatayn district). They allegedly opened fire on their car, stole their phones and other belongings but with no report of fatalities nor injuries.

On 15 April 2020, a pro-Islah security force reportedly abducted a journalist-activist from the Ayal Hadaf checkpoint (location unknown) on Suqutra island. The journalist-activist was trying to get people to participate in an anti-Islah protest.

ACTOR1: STC: Southern Transitional Council (Support and Reinforcement Brigades)
NOTES: On 1 May 2020, a journalist was abducted on the road between Taizz and Aden by forces from the Support and Reinforcement Brigade. He was held in the Al Waht area (Tuban, Lahij) until his release on 30 May bearing signs of torture. The journalist had previously received threats due to his work in media.

ACTOR1: STC: Southern Transitional Council (Security Belt Forces)
NOTES: On 10 May 2020, forces of the Security Belt reportedly abducted a citizen journalists in Sirar (Sara, Abyan) after he posted an article critical of the STC's self-administration.

ACTOR1: STC: Southern Transitional Council (Support and Reinforcement Brigades)
NOTES: Around 15 May 2020 (month of), a journalist was tortured after the pro-STC Support and Reinforcement Brigade reportedly abducted him in the Al Waht area (Tuban, Lahij) on 1 May 2020. When he was released on 30 May 2020, he bore significant signs of physical and mental torture, with pictures showing significant bodily harm consistent with beatings in addition to a reported inability to speak. He reportedly required hospitalization during his time as an abductee of the Security Belt forces.

SOURCE: Crater Sky; Yemen Data Project; News Yemen
NOTES: On 2 June 2020, a journalist was shot in front of his house in Dar Saad (Aden) by unknown gunmen.

ACTOR1: STC: Southern Transitional Council (Security Belt Forces)
NOTES: On 22 June 2020, pro-STC forces reportedly abducted a journalist from his house in Hadibu (Hidaybu, Suqutra) after taking control over the island. The journalist was not affiliated with any force.
On 29 June 2020, a journalist was killed and found dead in his car in Sayun city (Hadramawt).

On 30 July 2020, pro-STC forces reportedly abducted a journalist and his son from in front of the Khalifa Hospital in Hadibu (Hidaybu, Suqutra). They reportedly abducted him for articles he had written critical of the STC.

ACTOR1: STC: Southern Transitional Council (Security Belt Forces)
NOTES: On 14 August 2020, pro-STC forces (coded as SBF by default) reportedly abducted a journalist en route to Aden from Marib in Ash Shaykh Salim (Zingibar, Abyan) for unknown reasons. He is reportedly held in a prison in Aden.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2012-) Military Police
SOURCE: Yemen Data Project; Khabar News Agency (Yemen); News Yemen
NOTES: On 18 August 2020, pro-Islah military police beat and kidnapped a Journalist in Al Ashruh area (Jabal Habashy, Taizz). According to one source, the journalist was vocal about smuggling opertions in the governorate.

ACTOR1: STC: Southern Transitional Council (Support and Reinforcement Brigades)
NOTES: On 17 September 2020, pro-STC security forces abducted a journalist, his lawyer, 3 of his relatives and 4 of his colleagues in Al Alam checkpoint (Khur Maksar, Aden). HRW reported that judging by their outfit, the forces that made the arrest were the support and reinforcement brigades. The journalist has been tortured and accused of spying on the STC for foreign countries and remains in custody until the time of the reporting February 22, 2021.

ACTOR1: STC: Southern Transitional Council (Support and Reinforcement Brigades)
NOTES: On 9 November 2020, the pro-STC 3rd Support and Reinforcement Brigade abducted Aden Al Ghad staff members in Aden (Craiter, Aden) as they were distributing newspapers. The reason for the abduction was not given.

ACTOR1: STC: Southern Transitional Council (Security Belt Forces)
NOTES: On 7 December 2020, pro-STC forces (coded as Security Belt) kidnapped an activist, because of his media coverage of a protest, and took him to an unknown destination.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
NOTES: On 18 December 2020, a Houthi sniper targeted a Yemeni journalist from Yemen al Yawm channel while he was covering clashes in Battar sector (Al Husha, Ad Dali) without injuring him.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
NOTES: Around 27 January 2021 (week of), a Houthi supervisor (mushrif) accompanied by other armed men reportedly beat with truncheons and guns a journalist in front of Bani Matar Court of First Instance in the west of Sanaa city (coded to Sanaa-Musab Bin Umayr) (Amanat al Asimah) and took him to prison without justification as he was entering the court to file a complaint against a pro-Houthi individual.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
SOURCE: Yemen Data Project; Khabar News Agency (Yemen)
NOTES: On 31 March 2021, Houthi forces abducted a journalist in Ibb city (Al Mashannah, Ibb), and transferred him to the Political Security Prison in Ibb.

On 14 April 2021, unidentified militants opened fired on a journalist in the Ghazi Alwan area, just north of Jawlat al Arish (Khur Maksar, Aden). There were no fatalities and the reason for the attack was not known.

SOURCE: Yemen Data Project; Khabar News Agency (Yemen)
NOTES: On 17 June 2021, 4 unidentified but allegedly Islah-affiliated gunmen on motorbikes shot at a civilian in his car in Taizz - Habil Salman (Al Mudhaffar). The civilian, who survived the attack, is reportedly a writer and a blogger who had criticized the pro-Hadi Islah-affiliated local security forces. The day before the attack, the head of Al Hasab police station Fuad Fadhel, brother of the head of the Taizz Axis Khaled Fadhel, had threatened him.

On 27 June 2021, unidentified gunmen, suspected of belonging to Houthi forces, attacked a journalist near his home in Sanaa city (Amanat al Asimah) after which he was transferred to the hospital. The source indicates that local police refused to allow the journalist to lodge a formal complaint of the incident.

On 20 October 2021, three unidentified gunmen attacked a photojournalist while he was working in Taizz - Bab Musa (Al Mudhaffar). The journalist managed to flee and file a police report on the incident.

ACTOR1: UPND: United Party for National Development
NOTES: UPND cadres harassed and beat up 2 journalists at a UPND event in Lusaka. They accused the journalists of being ZNBC reporters. Police then denied UPND the right to hold the event.
Patriotic Front members assault a Muvi Televisions Kabwe journalist at the Kabwe High Court during an election petition hearing.
Zambian traffic police beat up a journalist who had been filming an example of corrupt policing.

ACTOR1: UPND: United Party for National Development
NOTES: Around 27 November 2021 (as reported), alleged cadres of the UPND party kidnapped and threatened to kill the executive director of a media outlet in Kamwala South neighborhood of Lusaka city (Lusaka). They accused him of reporting inaccurately about the UPND. He managed to escape, while they took away his car.
